Justo is 52 and lives with Domitila age 46. They have two children: Roxana age 21 and Viviana, 17. They all live is a rented home in San Pedro de Cajas. He is a skilled and hardworking man who used to work is a gas sales business which generated additional income to his work as an artisan which he has done since he was 18. 

Today he has his own workshop making mainly ponchos and blankets. Thanks to his dedication and creativity he has large orders from customers in different cities around the country. They visit his shop frequently to purchase his goods. His profits allowed him to save up and open his own small gas station where he sells to drivers in his area. 

Now he wants to invest in improving his business. This is his third loan with MFP and he is happy with his accomplishments thus far, saying "I learned how to save and grow." With this loan he will invest in buying fuel with each gas canister costing an average of S./620.00 Nuevos Soles. If he has enough left then he will buy thread and other items for his knitting business

loans.use: Purchase gas ciliner and thread for knitting.

loans.name: Lisseth

texts.es: Lisseth, de 26 años, vive en casa de su madre, en compañía de ella y de sus 2 pequeños hijos; y juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Desde hace 1 año esta emprendedora joven se dedica a la fabricación de toda clase de bojouteria con pedrería de colores. Esta muy satisfecha con esta labor pues mientras trabaja puede a la vez educar a sus hijos; y solo ocupa  largos ratos durante todo el día, además  vende al por mayor y también por unidad sus preciados accesorios. Con el tiempo ha logrado adquirir gran cantidad de clientes que le compran con regular frecuencia, pues saben  de los buenos precios y de la buena calidad de sus accesorios. Es por esta razón que esta muy contenta con su labor, además con las ganancias ayuda a su madre en los constantes gastos del hogar; también  tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de aumentar la cantidad de su producción en bijouteria e instalar un puesto de venta de accesorios. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Lisseth tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería en pedrería (variedades y colores) para aumentar su producción y ganancias.
texts.en:
Lisseth, 26, lives in her mother’s house with her and her two small sons.  Together they struggle each day to get ahead.  For the last year this enterprising young woman has been making all kinds of costume multicolored stone jewelry.  She is very satisfied with her work because she can educate her children while she works; she only needs long moments during the day.  She sells her attractive accessories at wholesale and by the piece.

In time she has managed to secure a regular clientele that buys from her frequently because they know of the good prices and high quality of her accessories.  For this reason, she is happy with her work.  Besides, she is able to use profits to help her mother cover household expenses.  In addition, she has many plans for the future like increasing the amount of her costume jewelry production and setting up a sales stand for her wares.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to repay in a timely fashion because she does not want to disappoint the people who have made this contribution possible that will allow her to keep working seeking progress.

Lisseth plans to use the requested funds to buy an amount of assorted stone merchandise in several colors to increase production and profits.

loans.use: To buy jewelry stones.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida B. is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a plumber. She has completed junior high school. Vida sells bags of charcoal at Takoradi, which she has been doing for six years. Vida uses her income to assist her husband in educating her children. Vida will use the loan to purchase more charcoal in order to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vida plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and two school-age children. She has worked as a private teacher in her house since 2003 and in parallel she has worked as a teacher in a local school since 2008. She cooperates with her husband who works in the construction field to provide the family’s income. It’s frequent in Lebanon to have many jobs to be able to handle the high costs.

Today she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve the teaching room and equip it with the needed tools to make to students feel comfortable while having their lessons.

loans.use: To improve the teaching room and equip it with the needed tools

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia D. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old. Aurelia is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Aurelia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling chicken and pork kabab in the local community. She is also making and selling home made sausage or longganisa. Aurelia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aurelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients like pork & spices. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Aurelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients like pork & spices

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C. is from the village of Research Minante 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 61 years old. Helen is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in the business for almost two years. She earns approximately $46 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Helen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Helen is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 8th loan  from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida M. is from the village of Laturan, Libona, Bukidnon. She is 68 years old, widowed and has 7 adult-aged children. Adelaida owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling vegetables such as eggplants and ampalaya (bitter melon) in the local community. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Adelaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Adelaida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Anarkul's Group

texts.en:
Anarkul S. is the treasurer of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a nice village in the south of the Isykul region. She is 43 and married to a taxi driver. Together they have raised a daughter and a son. The daughter is married and the son studies at school. 

Two years ago, Anarkul rented a place and started to sell shoes. She opened a store and as a result, she improved the family’s living conditions. In the near future, she wants to purchase a car for her family, but still needs some additional funds.  For this purpose, Anarkul applied for this loan.

Where Did This Loan Come From? 

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her family

loans.name: Norielyn

texts.en:
Norielyn M. is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Manila Group within Wao municipality, a part of Lanao del Sur province on the islands of Mindanao. Norielyn runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop from which she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snacks and beverages to the local community. Norielyn has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Norielyn joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and obtain some working capital. Norielyn is requesting a new loan, her second from HSPFI, of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snacks to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snacks to sell

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: Hilaria tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores. Vive en casa propia en el distrito de Chochope en el norte de Perú. Desde hace 4 años, ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Hilaria es muy conocida en el mercado y tiene clientela ya establecida. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Con esta inversión, podrá incrementar sus inventarios y tener mejores ventas. Hilaria posee buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad urbana. Es muy responsable. Ha manejado otros préstamos y cumplió con sus obligaciones de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Hilaria is 34 years old, married, and has two dependent children.  She lives in her own home, in Chochope district, in the north of Peru.

For four years, Hilaria has owned a small grocery store which is located in her home.  There she offers her neighbors and local customers a range of staple products, including essentials and groceries.  Hilaria is very well known in the market and has an established customer base.  She would like to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  With this investment, she will be able to increase her inventory and make more sales.

Hilaria has good personal and work references from her urban community.  She is very responsible.  She has received previous loans and paid them back on time.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ulmaskhon's Group

texts.en:
Ulmaskhon A. is the leader of this group. She is 51 and married to a teacher. Her husband works at a school and receives a monthly salary in the amount of 3,500 KGS. Together they brought up a son who is now 20 years old and works as a welder. Ulmaskhon herself works as a teacher, too. 

The family also cultivates agricultural products for making additional money. They have been cultivating cabbage and wheat for eleven years. Selling some part of the harvest, the family earns an additional $433 per month, approximately.  

Ulmaskhon applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase mineral fertilizers for farming.  In the future she wants to purchase furniture for their home to improve their living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, donde se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sonia, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores  de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es albañil. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio y nos dice que el banco es lo mejor ya que gracias a los créditos su negocio ha mejorado.

Ella se dedica al comercio en lo que es compra y venta de  de adornos y cerámicas,  tiene un  local en su casa en el cual vende todo tipo de artesanía, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, su hijo a veces le ayuda cuando está desocupado pero  la mayor parte del tiempo trabaja sola, nos cuenta que empezó con este negocio hace  10 años y que con el pasar de los días lo ha ido aumentando y mejorando, por eso está muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir ya que gracias a los créditos esto ha sido posible. Sus productos los compra a artesanos de la zona.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para surtir su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son seguir en el negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The “Communal Bank for the Future of Women” meets every 15 days in La Pila, in the canton of Montecristi. This area is very well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture; it is a place where a great variety of crafts are made by its residents, following the traditional customs.

In is where we meet Sonia. She is 56 years old, is married, and she has three grown children. One of them still lives at home. Her husband is a mason. She has been in the communal bank almost since it started and she tells us that the bank is the best because, thanks to the loans, her business has improved. 

She works in sales. She buys and sells decorative items and ceramics. She has store in her house where she sells all kinds of crafts. She works every day from 8:00am to 5:00pm. Her son sometimes helps her when he isn’t busy, but most of the time she works alone. She tells us that she began this business 10 years ago and that over time she has been expanding and improving it. She is very grateful to Fundación Espoir because it’s thanks to the loans that this has been possible. She buys her products from area artisans.

This loan is for buying more crafts of all kinds and models for stocking her business. Her dream is to continue with her business and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of craft items.

loans.name: Pearly

texts.en:
Pearly is 48 years old and married with 1 child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Pearly has a general store business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 4 years.  She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

In the future, Pearly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Cesarea

texts.es:
Cesarea es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Surte, tiene 54 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos.
Es feriante y tiene un puesto D. papas en el mercado Mayorista D. Nery Garcia Zarate. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, entre otros para surtir su mercadería.
Cesarea viaja a la feria D. Seccelambras. Tuvo problemas le asaltaron y le robaron toda su mercadería, pero ya se ésta recuperando y sigue para adelante trabajando.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Cesarea is a member of the "Buena Suerte" (Good Luck) community bank.  She is 54 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She is a market seller and has a stall in the Nery Garcia Zarate wholesale market.  

Cesarea is requesting this loan to invest in buying groceries such as sugar, noodles, milk and other products, with which she will stock her business.

Cesarea travels to the Seccelambras market.  She had problems when some people assaulted her and stole all her merchandise.  However, she is now recovering and continues getting ahead by working.

Cesarea's dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles and milk

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace bakes bread and meat pies at Abura near Nyame Bekyere, a village in Cape Coast near Abura. Grace has received a senior high education. She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a driver. As part of her responsibilities, she helps her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake to sell. Her future plan is to buy land with her increased income.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia es una mujer de 63 años de edad, ella una persona muy emprendedora, ella vive con dos de sus hijos hace un año perdió a su esposo y ha tenido que seguir adelante, es una persona muy activa
Con este crédito la señora piensa invertir en la compra de mercaderia para surtir su bazar ya que vienen una épocas muy buenas y necesita reforzarlo, con la fundación la clienta ya ha tenido varios prestamos los cuales ha mantenido una buena moral de pago
La señora tiene como meta hacer su negocio mas grande y poner una fotocopiadora, ella se levanta como a las 6 de la mañana y hace las labores doesticas y después de la 8 abre y cierra como a la 8.
Con este crédito la señora podrá surtir su bazar y tener mas capital de trabajo para seguir trabajando y tener como subsidiar con sus gastos económicos.
texts.en:
Señora Virginia is a 63-year-old woman and she is a very enterprising person. She lives with two of her children. A year ago she lost her husband and has had to move forward. She is a very active person.

With this loan she will invest in the purchase of merchandise to supply her shop as the busy season is approaching and she needs to stock up. She has had several loans with the foundation, maintaining a good payment history with each of them.

Her goal is to expand her business and install a photocopier. She gets up at six in the morning and does her household tasks after which she opens the shop at 8 and closes at 8. With this loan she will be able to supply her shop and have more working capital to continue working and subsidize her expenses.

loans.use: to buy articles for the home, jewelry, and school supplies.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Milange Provincia de Zambezia ao norte de Mocambique, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 7 a 20 anos de idade todos Vão a Escola. Fez a 5ªclasse e parou devido a falta de condiçoes financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Zambezia para Maputo ainda pequena com os seus pais, mais tarde formou o seu proprio lar. É negociante ha  mais de 12 anos, vende produtos diversos e bebidas onde consegue um rendimento mensal de 7.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu Hluvuku atravez de vizinhos que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 17.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (colgate, amendoim, omo,refresco, e outros ) para aumentar a quantidade da mercadoria. O emprestimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt e aplicou no comercio.
Vai pagar de acordo com calendario e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos para comprar uma viatura e para tal tenciona solicitar a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in Milange District, Zambezia Province in northern Mozambique. She is married and has three children between the ages of 7 and 20; all the children go to school. Veronica finished fifth grade and quit school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left Zambezia to move to Maputo with her parents when she was young, and later she made her own home. She has been a businesswoman for more than 12 years. She sells assorted products and drinks, and she earns a monthly income of 7,000 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank acount (at BIM).

Veronica has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through neighbors who are also customers of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. She is asking for 17,000 meticais, which she will use to buy products (Colgate, peanuts, Omo laundry soap, soft drinks and other items) to increase her inventory. The earlier loan was for 10,000 meticais and was used for business.

Veronica will make her payments as scheduled, and in the future she intends to ask for more loans to buy a vehicle, and to do that she will ask Hluvuku for loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (Colgate, peanuts, Omo laundry soap, soft drinks, etc.).

loans.name: Sergio Margarito

texts.es: El Sr. Sergio es una persona muy sencilla y amable el esta casado con la Sra. Sonia y  juntos  forman  una   familia muy unida, en este  momento ellos requieren de nuestra ayuda   por que  desean ampliar su cocina ya que es  muy  pequeña  y a  ellos  les  encanta  convivir  al  realizar  la  comida  juntos,  el Sr.  Sergio quiere lo mejor para su familia es por eso que se preocupan por el bienestar de su familia dándoles lo mejor de ellos, agradece el apoyo  brindado por la institucion para la realizacion de  su proyecto.
texts.en: Sergio is a friendly simple person.  He is married to Sonia and together they form a united family.  At the moment they need our help because they want to expand their kitchen because it’s really small and they really enjoy cooking together.  Sergio wants the best for his family, worries about their well-being, and wants to provide the best for them.  He is grateful to the institution for the support given him toward completing this project.

loans.use: to expand his kitchen

loans.name: Sabougnouman  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Sabougnouman 1 sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 48 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Moussokorobougou dans la commune rurale de Pelengana dans la 4ème région administrative du Mali: Ségou. Dans le but d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition en début d’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil et le niébé.
Madame Alimata (qui est assise au milieu) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un sac d’urée, 25 kg d’arachide et se faire aider dans les activités de labour et de désherbage par la main d’œuvre masculine. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Ségou et en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes du village. Avec une superficie de 2 hectares, elle espère produire 15 sacs d’arachide, 8 sacs de mil, 2 sacs de niébé et des fanes. En plus des fanes de niébé, une partie de la production du mil et de niébé sera vendue pour gérer les petites dépenses du foyer au quotidien tandis que le reste serait auto consommé en famille. Madame Alimata a pour objectif de faire l’élevage des petits ruminants dans le village.
texts.en:
Most of the 10 women of the Sabougnouman 1 group are married, live in traditional extended households, and are on average 48 years old with 2 children. They all live in the town of Moussokorobougou in the rural district of Pelengana in the 4th administrative region of Mali: Ségou.
With the goal of having agricultural inputs at their disposal at the start of the rainy season, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first farming loan cycle. The group members are going to grow groundnuts, millet, and black-eyed peas.
Ms. Alimata (sitting in the middle of the photo) intends to use her loan to buy 1 bag of urea and 25 kg of groudnuts, and also to recruit male manual labour to help her with physical tasks and weeding. She gets her supplies of agricultural inputs at the Ségou market fair and hires manual labour from a group of young people in town. From her 2 hectares of land, she hopes to produce 15 sacks of groundnuts, 8 sacks of millet, 2 sacks of black-eyed peas, and greens. In addition to the greens from the black-eyed peas, a portion of the millet and black-eyed peas will be sold to manage the minor daily household expenses, while the rest will be consumed by the family itself. Ms. Alimata's future goal is to raise small livestock in town.

loans.use: To pay for urea, groundnut seeds, and male manual labour for physical activities and weeding.

loans.name: Juan Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Alfredo es casado, tiene 36 años de edad, estudio los estudios de educación primaria, se dedica a la artesanía al tejido de cortes típicos, servilletas, etc, inicia este negocio como operario y hasta el momento tiene 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al mismo oficio.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá ampliar su capital de trabajo, en esta ocasión para la compra de hilo de diferentes clase y colores, en el futuro espera que su negocio sea grande y productivo.
texts.en:
Juan Alfredo is 30, and married. He has a primary school education. Juan Alfredo makes handicrafts such as traditional hand-woven fabrics, decorative serving cloths etc.  

He began this business as an operator, and to this point, has 3 years of experience  He has the support of his wife, who works in the same trade.

He has decided to apply for a loan in order to increase his working capital, in this case to buy thread of different kinds and colors. In the future he hopes that his business will be large and productive.

loans.use: To buy thread for weaving.

loans.name: Zizhou Group

texts.en:
This is 57-year-old Abigail from Masvingo in Zimbabwe. She is married and has five children age 41, 39, 31, 29 and 16. One is attending school. 

Abigail sells clothes and plates. The business has been in operation for six years. She says the main challenge she faces is lack of capital to buy more goods to sell. Abigail has requested a loan of $400 to increase her stocks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase disposable income and improve the family's quality of life. 

In the future Abigail plans to have her own shop in town.

loans.use: To buy clothes, plates and maize for sale.

loans.name: Romelia Paola

texts.es:
Romelia es una joven de 20 años de edad, casada, y se dedica a la venta de golosinas. Inició con su negocio hace tres años atras y aprendió de su madre ya que esta actividad comercial es muy antigua y muy comun en la comunidad Juticalpense. 

Su pequeña venta de golosinas esta instalada en la calle que pasa al frende de la casa de sus padres ya que por falta de recursos economicos no ha podido mudarse ni tampoco alquilar un local. Su horario de atencion los dias de semana inicia desde las 4:00 pm y culmina a las 10:00 pm y en fin de semana culmina a la medianoche o dependiendo de la cantidad de clientes que alla en el lugar. 

El prestamo que Romelia esta solicitando lo necesita para comprar carne de cerdo y res, pollo, refrescos, harina, aceite, leña, verduras, polipel, canastillas de plastico, entre otros productos. Con el apoyo de este prestamo ella tendra lo necesario para seguir elaborando sus golosinas y mantener activo su negocio.

Su mayor problema es que el personal de la Alcaldia Municipal los desaloje por ser vendedores ambulantes, pero aun asi no se deja vencer por las adversidades y sigue adelante con muchas ganas de tener su propio local y su propia casa. 

Este es su segundo ciclo en FAMA y ha sido una clienta muy puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Romelia is a young woman who is 20 years of age, married, and earns her living by selling appetizers. She started this business three years ago, having learned from her mother this ancient trade that is very common in the community of Juticalpense.

Her small appetizer business is set up along the street in front of her parents’ house since she does not have the financial resources to move to another location or rent a shop. Her hours of operation are from 4pm to 10pm. On the weekends, she will close at midnight depending on the numbers of customers that are around.

The loan Romelia is requesting will be used to buy pork, beef, chicken, soft drinks, flour, oil, firewood, vegetables, containers, plastic baskets, and other products. With the help of this loan, she will have what she needs to continue preparing her appetizers and maintaining an active business.

Her greatest problem is that city inspectors are evicting street vendors. However, she is not discouraged by these adversities and presses forward with great determination so that she can have her own shop and her own home.

This is Romelia’s second loan cycle with FAMA and she is a client who has been very punctual with her payments.

loans.use: to buy pork, beef, chicken, soft drinks, flour, oil, firewood, vegetables, containers, plastic baskets, and other products.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: Maricela tiene 26 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora ella dice “mi trabajo es de hombres me dice la gente pero eso no me importa ya que de ahí saco adelante a mis hijos que es lo que a mi me importa”. Día a día ella a muy temprana hora se pone a trabajar en su lavado de carros que tiene en su casa, aproximadamente tiene con su negocio mas de 9 años ya que su esposo y ella emprendieron ese negocio debido a la falta de empleos en su localidad optaron por lavar carros, dice que los clientes llegan desde muy temprana hora mas que nada los taxis y los vehículos de transporte publico. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de una aspiradora para lavar los carros por dentro ya que la que tiene no le sirve se le descompuso de tanto usarla. Comenta que gracias al crédito podrá mejorar la calidad de servicio de su negocio y con las ganancias comprarles a sus hijos lo que ocupen para una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Maricela, 26, is a hardworking woman.  She says: “People tell me that I work doing the work of men but that doesn’t bother me because that’s where I earn what I need to support my children and that’s all that concerns me.”  She starts working washing cars at the car wash service she has at home starting very early in the morning day after day.  She’s had the business for over 9 years since her husband and she started it due to the lack of employment opportunities in their community; they opted to wash cars.  She says that customers start coming by starting very early, especially taxis and public transportation vehicles.

She is asking for a loan to buy a car vacuum cleaner to wash the interior of the cars because the one she has now has broken down from so much usage.  She comments that thanks to the loan she’ll be able to improve customer service and will use profits to buy her children what they need to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy a car vacuum cleaner.

loans.name: Kawral Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 08 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de 11 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Maimouna qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge un autre enfants confié par son frére.

Elle s’active dans la vente de poisson sec, lait, café et huitre. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plus de 10 ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on May 8, 2001. It is composed of eleven women who reside in the same district. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Maimouna, who is to the right in the picture with her hand raised, is the group's leader. She is 47 years old. She is married and a mother of three. Another child was also left in her care by her brother.

She is active in the retail of dried fish, milk, coffee and oysters. She is quite experienced in this business, in which she has been involved for over ten years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her working capital and to better grow her business. The profit will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, milk, coffee and oysters.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is a widow and takes care of three children. 

She wants a loan to buy a digital satellite television for her cinema business. This seems like a good business venture, as people like watching international football and other sports. In her area there are few venues to show such programs. 

Specioza currently sells spare bicycle parts and also runs a cinema. Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a digital satellite television for her cinema business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 51 years old and has two children.  Erlinda is married and both her children are in school.

Erlinda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Erlinda has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Mrs. Pech is 37 years old and married with 8 children. She earns a living by fishing with her husband along Tole Sap River, one branch of Mekong River. This couple tries hard in order to raise their children, some of whom are working to help the family’s condition. Through fishing, Pech and her husband can generate a profit of $8.00 per day. Pech said that some of her fishing materials are very old and ruined, which have a bad effect upon her daily income. And now she is taking out a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy fishing tools and a machine boat. With the increase in income she’ll earn, she will save it to open a general store for her daughter selling mixed products to the people in the community.

loans.use: to buy fishing tools and a machine boat.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes D. 47 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo, hija y su nieta. Ella se dedica al comercio, tiene muchos años D. dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia.  María se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora ya que tiene muchas ideas D. negocio  y poco a poco va poniendo en  marcha. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado establecer un pequeño  puesto en su hogar D. residencia en el cual venD. variedad D. prendas D. vestir para todos los gustos, y preferencia. Su sueño es mantener su negocio surtido con variedad D. prendas D. vestir con el objetivo D. atraer a más clientes que le permitan mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra D. prendas D. vestir ( faldas, pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa interior, etc.), con el fin D. mejorar la calidad D. vida que por el momento tienen. Confía en Dios que los resultados van hacer favorables.
texts.en: María Mercedes, age 47, lives in her own home with her family, which consists of her husband, daughter, and granddaughter. She dedicates her time to her sales, and having done so for many years, she has built up a lot of experience. María describes herself as being an enterprising woman, with lots of business ideas which she is gradually putting into action. With great effort and dedication, she has succeeded in establishing a small store in her home, where she sells a variety of clothing to cater to all tastes and preferences. Her dream is to keep her business stocked with a wiD. range of clothes, with the aim of attracting more customers and ultimately improving her family's standard of living. For this reason she has decided to seek a loan with INTEGRAL to invest in her business by buying items of clothing (skirts, trousers, shirts, blouses, underwear, etc). She trusts in God that the result of the investment will be to improve the standard of living she has at present.

loans.use: To buy skirts, trousers, shirts, blouses, underwear, etc

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
This is Hazel, 40, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Remegio, an electrician, and father of her four children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Hazel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. 

Hazel earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
 
Hazel dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Modi

texts.en:
Modi is a 40 year old a married woman with no children.  She has a business of selling food in Yambio South Sudan for the past two years.
Modi is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice to sell.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is now 58 years old and has five adult-age children. She is engaged in selling detergent soaps and dish-washing soaps in their village to earn additional income. She has been a farmer for almost 38 years, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. Due to financial difficulty, Florenda aimed to improve her small business to earn a higher income and satisfy their necessities. 

She planned to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demands, but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional P15,000 to buy additional stocks of detergent soaps, dish-washing soaps and vegetables to sell in the village. She mentioned that this loan will help her to make an improvement in her business and she is hoping that she will be successful someday.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of detergent soaps, dish-washing soaps and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Jesus

texts.es:
Nelson Jesus tiene 22 años es Soltero, vive con el papá en el Cantón Chillanes provincia  de Bolívar.

La ventanilla LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Josè de Guayabal a 15 minutos de la oficina perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz, mora, fréjol.

Nelson Jesus se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, mora desde hace tres años. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz, fréjol, mora. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. 

El sueño es incrementar los sombríos de mora para tener mejores ingresos y así un mejor estilo de vida  Le gusta salir a jugar fútbol  y  que llegue el carnaval.
texts.en:
Nelson Jesus is 22 years old, he is single and he lives with his father in Chillanes, a canton in the Bolívar province.

LUZ Y PROGRESO (Light and Progress) is a Community Bank located in San José de Guayabal, 15 minutes away from the Chillanes office. The members of this Community Bank engage in short-cycle farming of maize, blackberries and beans.

Nelson Jesus has been engaged in agriculture for three years, growing maize, beans and blackberries. He buys and sells in Ventanas.

The loan he has requested will be used to buy manure, urea, insecticides and fertilizers to grow maize, beans and blackberries. The loan has helped him increase his income both for the needs of his family and to make investments.

His dream is to increase the blackberries production to earn a better income and consequently improve his standard of living. He likes playing soccer and he enjoys the carnival.

loans.use: To buy manure, urea, insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sokea

texts.en:
Sokea, 48, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. 

Her husband is a construction foreman. Two of her children are employed at the garment factory. 

Sokea is requesting for a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase construction materials for building her house. 

In the future, she would like to run a food store that sells all kinds of food and drink and send her youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building her house.

loans.name: Megi

texts.en:
Megi, who is 33 years old housekeeper, is from Gori. She is divorced woman and takes care with school-aged son. In spite of her high education, Megi was unable to find any stable job. She had been involved in trading business with bed linens and was getting some income. Now she has no source of income and has start to seek credit among local financial institutions. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living.  So, she decided to re-start trading business with the loan but the local credit providers usually request some stable income from the borrowers. Megi’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Megi will purchase stock of bed linens at wholesale prices and sell among her clients in increased prices. 
The loan will greatly assist Megi, and she will be able to continue her lovely job. Due to her kind and nice attitude toward clients, Megi has a big list of loyal customers. She will be very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: To re-start her trading business with bed linens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fabrics.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en: Sammy is a father of two and started his business in 2004. He initially traded in chicken and has gradually graduated to goats and cattle trade. He has been doing this business over the past 10 years. This is first time that an opportunity for a loan has availed itself to him. With the loan of US$150 from PEMCI, Sammy sees good prospects for his business. He will use the loan proceeds to grow his business and increase profits.

loans.use: Goat Trader

loans.name: Fine

texts.en: Fine G. is from the village of Vaiee.  She is 42-years old and has five children.  She runs a sewing business and makes clothes on order for the local villagers.  She works very long hours trying to fulfill all of her customers’ orders and her family is very supportive of her business efforts.  On a productive day, she can complete up to twenty items of clothing a day and bring in about ST 200 (approximately USD 80).  She is confident of the demand for her unique tailoring talents in the village that she lives in.  With a loan, Fine will make some needed repairs to her machine and purchase additional sewing supplies.  A loan to Fine ensures that she can continue to leverage her talent to provide for the educational expenses of her five children and continue to raise the living standard of her family.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies and make machine repairs

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid A. is from Saatli. He is married and has three children. He began his business in 1990 when he borrowed money from his friend to purchase a cow and a calf. He wants to increase production and has applied for an $800 loan to purchase one more cow.

loans.use: Going to purchase a cow

loans.name: Ya Marie

texts.en: Ya Marie K. is forty-nine years old, widowed, with eight children.  She lost her husband during the civil war in Sierra Leone.  She runs a small store selling utensils and stationery.  Since she is the only breadwinner, most of her profit goes to family expenses especially school requirements.  With her previous loan, Marie included stationery in her inventory.  She is now requesting another loan so as to have more capital to maximize profits when schools re-open.

loans.use: Increase inventory in her utensils and stationery shop

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
Elisa is single. She lives in the city of Inhambe, capital of the province. Elisa joined the program in 2006. She doesn't have children but lives with her nephews. She sells baskets, hats, wood spoons made of straw in the central market. Her business is growing. With the income from the business she pays for her nephews' school.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Elisa e solteira e nao tem filhos.Ela vive na cidade de Inhambane,capital da Provincia com o mesmo nome.Elisa entrou para o Programa de crediro em 2006. Embora nao tenha filhos ela vive com os seus sobrinhos. Ela vende cestos, chapeus, carteiras, colheres de pau, tudo feito de palha e outros materiais no mercado Central. O seu negocio esta a desenvolver. Com os rendimentos ela paga a escola dos sobrinhos. Ela nao tem marido.

loans.use: Buy material

loans.name: Phim

texts.en: Mrs. Phim K. S., age 47, works as a farmer, making only $1.20 per day. Her husband, age 60, is a farmer as well, and also hires out his bull for stud, making $0.50 per day. They have five children, four of whom work at a garment factory and one who is a student. She would like to request a loan of $300 in order to purchase ducks to breed in order to generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase ducks to start a duck-breeding business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a photocopier (Comprar una copiadora)

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mrs. Thy C., is married with three children and works as a vendor selling yams to the people in her area, and generally makes on average around $2/day in revenue. Her husband is has a motor-taxi business and typically earns around $3 per day of income. Mrs. Thy C. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by adding more yams to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more yams to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.name: Nhóm Chị Đố - Tiên Trà - Trung Nghĩa Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đố, 45 years old, married with two children, farms, tends livestock and đi chợ*. Her children are grown-up and have moved out. Her average weekly income is 12USD. She is taking out loan to by feed for her pigs, same as Mrs. Thi. Mrs. Phúc and Thu use the loan for đi chợ.

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Đố, 45 tuổi, làm ruộng, chăn nuôi và đi chợ. Chị có chồng và 2 con. Các con đã lớn và ra ở riêng. Thu nhập bình quân nhà chị từ 150 000 đến 200 000/tuần. Chị vay vốn để mua thức ăn cho lợn. Chị Thi vay vốn để chăn nuôi. Chị Phúc vay vốn để đi chợ. Chị Thu vay vốn để đi chợ.

loans.use: Buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Mr. M. is 43 years old and married with 6 children. He sells building materials and tools in the Makeni town market. Mr. M. started his business more than 10 years ago, but progress has been slow due to lack of capital.

Mr. M. is requesting this loan so that he can expand his stock. He believes that additional inventory will generate more income, which will help him pay for family expenses – especially school fees for his children.

loans.use: To increase inventory; this will enable him to pay his children’s school fees

loans.name: Sabina's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Sabina is 33 years old and married. She has 4 children between the ages of 1 and 13. Sabina started selling clothes in 1998. She works from 8am to 8pm every day at her business and can earn a monthly profit of $140 from her sales.

Sabina has applied for this loan in order to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Maria, who also has a business in clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell in a successful shop

loans.name: Armiyawou

texts.fr:
Born March 16, 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital and largest city in Benin, Mr. Armiyawou G. is a married father of three children, whose needs he must meet with his income alone. He is a tailor by trade but also sells traditional African Bazin cloth and various sewing supplies. He is currently facing difficulties related to a lack of financial means. To overcome this, he is requesting a loan in order to meet his customers’ needs both in providing tailoring services and in selling cloth.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 16 mars 1973 à COTONOU dans la capitale économique et première ville du BENIN, monsieur G. Armiyawou est marié et père de 3 enfants dont il a exclusivement la charge. Il est couturier de profession mais mène parallèlement à celle-ci la vente de tissu bazin et de différentes fournitures de couture. Actuellement il éprouve quelques difficultés liées au manque de moyens financiers. Pour cela, il sollicite ce crédit afin de répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle tant dans le domaine de ses prestations de services que dans la distribution de tissu.

loans.use: Purchase of eight pieces of traditional African Bazin cloth and various sewing supplies

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha is 35 years old and she finished school in 6th grade. She has 3 young sons and 3 young daughters and her husband works alongside her every day.

Now she sells women's and men's clothes in the 15 de agosto market, post number B68 in the town of Yunguyo. In the last 6 months she has noticed a vast improvement in her business as she received a loan through the Comunal Santa Rosa de Lima bank of the district and province of Yunguyo.

With the loan of $1500 which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will buy 3 dozen overalls, 3 dozen sweaters, 3 dozen pairs of pants among other things. With this she hopes to increase her earnings little by little.

Her dream is to expand her current business and open a restaurant in the Plaza de Armas in Yunguyo. This is how she will pay for her kids education.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La Señora Bertha tiene 35 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto de primaria, es madre de 3 hijos y 3 hijas menores de edad, su esposo trabaja junto con ella en las actividades que están desarrollando diariamente. Actualmente, se dedica al negocio de venta de ropas especializado en damas y varones en el mercado 15 de agosto puesto Nº B 68 en la localidad de Yunguyo, sus negocios en los últimos 6 años ha mejorado notablemente con el préstamo que adquirió del banco Comunal Santa Rosa de Lima del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará 3 docenas de buzos, 3 docenas de chompas, 3 docenas de pantalones y otros, con ellos poco a poco sigue incrementando su mercadería para generar más ganancias. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio que tiene actualmente y tener un restaurante en Plaza de Armas de Yunguyo, y con ella sacar adelante a sus hijos dando una educación adecuada.

loans.use: To bulk buy food/Compra de ropa al por mayor.

loans.name: Sri

texts.id:
Sri U., 48 year old, lives with Nanang (husband) and Riski (son). Their son is 15 year old. Her husband works as a mechanic in a local motorcycle repair shop. They live in Prikila street in Denpasar, Bali.

Sri U. sells rice in her small stall. She goes to the local market every morning at 6 am to buy the ingredients. She cooks and prepares the rice for her stall as soon as she gets back from the market. She opens the stall at 8 am. She only sells few portions of rice, that's why the rice is usually sold out already by noon time.

She wants to use the loan money to expand her business.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Sri U., saat ini berusia 48 tahun. Usaha yang dijalaninya saat ini adalah sebagai penjual nasi. Setiap hari, dia berangkat ke pasal pada pukul 6 pagi dengan mengendarai sepeda motor. Setelah selesai belanja untuk kebutuhan warungnya, dia pulang untuk memasak. Pada pukul 8 pagi warungnya sudah siap melayani pelanggan. Oleh karena jualannya hanya sedikit, biasanya pada pukul 12.00 warungnya sudah tutup. Kali ini Sri U. mengajukan pinjaman untuk menambah dan mengembangkan warungnya. Dia berharap, nantinya keuntungan yang didapat akan lebih besar. Bersama suaminya Nanang, saat ini mereka tinggal di Jl.Priskila Denpasar bersama anaknya Riski (15). Pekerjaan suaminya saat ini adalah sebagai pekerja disebuah bengkel sepeda motor.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Nukra

texts.en:
Nukra C. is 34 years old. She is married and has three children to whom she wishes to give the best. Nukra is a market vendor. She is very dynamic and cares deeply for her family. She sells different kinds of hair accessories for girls and women in her store. The husband of Nukra who is pictured in the photo is also engaged in this business. 

Nukra tries to give her family as much money as possible so as to be able to cover the expenses of schooling for her children as she is dreaming that all of them might be well educated. Today Nukra wants to expand her business and to increase her working capital in order to purchase new goods to sell. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting 1700 Somoni (500 USD) for a term of 3 months. Having received loans from IMON several times already and having shown herself to be an responsible client, Nukra promises to manage this loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Expanding her business and increasing working capital to purchase new goods for sale

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mrs. Vann S. lives in Prey Tamao Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who now faces a small problem because her plantation field is infertile. To solve this problem, Mrs. Vann S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to support her field. In addition, she will use part of the loan to buy pesticides to protect her crops from all kinds of insects. Her husband, Mr. Yort Saroeurn, is a lottery seller who makes a small income to support his household. Mrs. Vann S. is 29 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is an entrepreneur from Beregovo, Western Ukraine. She sells women's clothing and footwear in the central marketplace of her home town. Her vending facility is located in a favorable place that is always busy with customers. Irina launched this venture 10 years ago. Presently, she has about $3000 in turnover capital and her monthly net profit is about $600.  

Financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine has added a lot to the success of this small enterprise. However, Irina doesn't want to stop where she is at right now. She wants to keep on working hard and stay focused on further sustainable development of her trade. Irina believes this smaller loan will help her meet current business needs and satisfy customers' demand this season.   


Note: this is a short term express loan that will be repaid in 4 weeks.

loans.use: To purchase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia is a member of the Gracias Morenita Village Bank.  She is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two children.  She has a store in her home in the Covandonga Association (a neighborhood on the outskirts of the city of Ayacucho) where she sells dry goods, vegetables, meat and firewood.  She works every day.  She also sells anticuchos (cow-heart kabobs) and tripe from a mobile cart on the Enace Bridge at night. 

Gaudencia needs a loan of 600 soles to buy rice and sugar. 

Gaudencia dreams of outfitting her business, building a second floor onto her home, and leaving a good business for her children to take over someday.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Gaudencia es socia del Banco Comunal Gracias Morenita.
Gaudencia es conviviente, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Gaudencia tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en la Asociación Covandonga en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, leña, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además por las noches vende anticuchos, tripas de manera ambulatoria en el puente enace.
Gaudencia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Gaudencia son implementar su negocio, construir el segundo piso de su casa y dejar un buen negocio a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is married to Leandro, a carpenter and farmer. They are blessed with three children who are all college graduates and already married. Their eldest is working as a salesman while their other two children are working as overseas contract workers or OFW.

Evangeline sells dry goods such as clothes, blankets, bed sheets, etc. Aside from that, she also sells frozen foods in their community. Though their children have already finished their studies, she and her husband are still working hard because they do not want to depend on their children to support them financially since they all have their own families to support.

At present, Evangeline is financially in need of PHP 9,000.00 to purchase additional inventory for her business. She intends to buy more frozen foods like hot dogs, tocino (a sweet pork dish), and longaniza (ground pork) to increase her profit. She is hoping that with her business, she and her husband can cope with their everyday needs and expenses. .

loans.use: additional capital for her small business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Inti que quiere decir Sol en quechua.
Ruth es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Ruth tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende verduras al por mayor y menor, actividad que realiza todos los días desde muy temprano.
Ruth necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebolla, camote.
Ruth sueña con que sus hijos salgan adelante y incrementar su capital, vender mas productos.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Inti community bank, a name that comes from the Quechuan word for "sun". Ruth, 42, is partnered and has 5 children. She has a stall in the Nery Garcia market where she sells vegetables, both wholesale and retail, a business that she operates every day from early in the morning. Ruth needs an 800-soles loan that she use to buy onions, sweet potatoes, etc. Ruth's greatest wishes are that her children get ahead in the world and that she can grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes Ankoma is forty-six years old. She is divorced but has four children to care for, all are girls. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. One of her children is married. One is in junior high school; the others are learning trade. Agnes works very hard to provide for the family. She sells maize at the local market. Agnes procures bags of maize from farmers in the surrounding communities. She supplies to retailers in her community and also sells on a table top in the local market square. She has been in business for over twenty years. Agnes wants a loan to procure bags of maize produce to retail to more customers. She needs to increase her profit to be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: To procure maize in bulk

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah B. earns a living growing rice. She tills the land with the help of Tereso, her husband. Tereso is also a farmer.

Leah wants to help her children complete a college education. She wants them to earn a college degree so that when they grow up, they can have better job to support their own children.

Aside from farming, the family earns money from selling a variety of goods. They own a sari-sari store, which gives them additional income.

Leah is requesting a loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers for her farm. This will allow her to increase the yield on her farm. This will give her more rice to sell in her store.

Leah is just one of the thousands of entrepreneurs helped by CEVI to improve their lives and businesses. Through credit assistance, training and insurance coverage, CEVI helps its clients grow their small businesses.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Benkelema (Unity) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkelema (toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles à Gongebougou un des villages de la sous préfecture de Loulouni, cercle de Kadiolo,  3ème région administrative de la république  du Mali (Sikasso).

Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de riz, de couscous et de beurre  de karité.  Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt de groupe,  tous les précédents se sont bien dénoués. 

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter 3 sacs de 100 kg de riz paddy pour les décortiquer et  revendre, 4 sacs de 100 kg de sorgho pour en faire du couscous afin de le revendre et 2 sacs de 100 kg de noix de karité pour les revendre ou en faire du beurre de karité pour le revendre. Elles s’approvisionnent à Gongebougou et dans les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues au comptant en détail et à crédit au marché de Dallen, Nimbougou et Loulouni les jours de foire à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 

Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the Benkelema group (all married) have an average age of 32 and on average 2 children. They live in traditional families in Gongebougou, one of the villages of the Sous-prefecture of Loulouni, Kadiolo circle, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali (Sikasso).

They have various businesses, among others selling rice, couscous, and karité (shea) butter. They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele, and they are on their fourth group loan, all preceding loans having been repaid correctly.

With this new loan, they intend to buy 3 sacks of 100 kg of paddy rice to hull and sell, 4 sacks of 100 kg of sorghum to make into couscous for sale, and 2 sacks of 100 kg of karité (shea) nuts to sell or to make into shea butter. They do their buying in Gongebougou and the surrounding area. The merchandise is sold for cash or on credit in the markets of Dallen, Nimbougou and Loulouni on market days, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 12,000 F CFA of which part will be used for family needs and the rest will be reinvested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals (rice and sorghum) and  karité (shea) nuts

loans.name: Meer Azam Group

texts.en: Meer Azam is the group leader of the Meer Azam group. There are four members in this group. They want to expand their businesses and make them larger. Meer Azam wants to take a loan for the business of carpentry. Najellah wants to take a loan for tailoring. Torpayke wants to take a loan for her embroidery business. Muhammad Maruf wants to take a loan for the business of carpentry. They requested a group loan of 56000 Afghani for the term of 10 months. They are all thankful to the Kiva lenders for their great support.

loans.use: expanding their businesses

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean C. is managing a small piggery in her village. She is forty years old and all of her four children are in school. She wants to expand her business. Aside from the pigs, she also grows rice to supplement the income of her family. Her husband, Rodrigo C., manages their rice farm. Some of their harvest is intended for family use and the rest is sold to meet living expenses.

She is requesting a loan of $225 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy piglets and pig feed. She will also use some of her loan to buy fertilizers and quality rice seeds.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. It gives credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage services to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy pigs, feed, fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia  es socia del Bancomunal Las Gitanas.
Celia es casada tiene 65 años, 4 hijos todos mayores, ninguno en su poder.
Celia empezó vendiendo productos de Belleza  por catalogo,  su hijo empezó con el negocio de venta de ropa en su casa, su hijo se caso y le dejo el negocio hace un año, ahora Celia se dedica ala venta de ropa en su casa.
Celia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de ropa por el día de la madre.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a ser unida, solidaria con todos los que ella pueda ayudar, le gusta las reuniones por que se distrae, y tiene amigas con las que comparten experiencias. 
El sueño de Celia es viajar a Venezuela a ver a su hija.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of Bancomunal Las Gitanas. She is 65, married, and has 4 grown children, all independent. Celia started selling beauty products by catalog, and her son started a business selling clothing from her home. A year ago the son married and left her the business, and now Celia sells clothing from her home. Celia needs a loan of $350 to purchase clothing for Mother's Day. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to stay united and supportive of all those whom she can help. She enjoys the meetings because they amuse her and she has friends with whom she can share experiences. Celia's dream is to travel to Venezuela to see her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to sell for Mother's Day

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar Mushtaq Group

texts.en:
Nargis baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies (pipes and taps) for her sanitary supplies selling business. Nishat baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Voilet baji wants a loan to buy an embroidering machine for preparing embroidered dresses.

Shamim akhtar baji is a widow and lives in the historic part of the city of Lahore named Yadgar, Pakistan. Her husband died from a heart attack and left her alone in this world. She gathered her courage to face the circumstances. She started a business selling clothes. She buys clothes from her native city Lahore and sells to the clothing shops and in the community. She has 6 years of experience in this business.

She is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her clothes selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Santos Roberto

texts.es: El señor Santos Roberto Busto, tiene la edad de 45 años, habita en el barrio San Juan, junto a su esposa, la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos uno de 22 años ya es casado, el de 19 estudia y le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas y una adolescente de doce años que estudia, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda , desde hace 33 años don Roberto se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas que le afectan al cultivo , el inicio esta actividad por si solo , los planes hacia un futuro es poder diversificar su cultivo . Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para poder sacar una buena producción  y vender a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Roberto Busto is 45 years old and lives with his wife, who helps him with the household expenses, in the San Juan neighborhood. They have three children. One is 22 years old and already married and one is a 19-year-old student who helps with the farm work. They also have a 12 year old who is a student. Mr. Santos would like to improve his family’s living conditions. Mr. Santos has worked in agriculture for 33 years and finds pests and lack of money to be the hardest parts. He got into this business by his own efforts. In the future, he plans to diversify his crops. With the loan money, he will buy fertilizer and supplies so he can get a good harvest and sell at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar insumos y fertilizantes

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married and has one child. She lives with her family at Sefwi, in the western region of Ghana. She is now 25 years old. She runs a clothing shop that sells women's and children's wears, like blouses, skirts, lingerie, and underwear. She has been in business for seven years now.

She is constrained by funds in running the business. She needs ta loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up its progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality wears in large quantity to upgrade her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of women's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Maria De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: María Lorena Q. Martínez ,  Yelba María López N.  y  Gabriela Auxiliadora Martínez B..

 El grupo solidario María de Fátima, es formado  según la cercanía de sus negocios y por su confianza entre ellas, tienen pequeños negocios en la comunidad de Villa Betania, perteneciente a la ciudad de Masaya.Las tres miembros tienen mucha confianza entre ellas.

Doña María Lorena Q. Martínez , es madre de dos niños pequeños de 5 y 2 años, vende repostería de maíz durante el día, ella la compra en un taller de repostería donde le dan buen precio, además vende refrescos, su esposo trabaja como guarda en Managua y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Tiene 2 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y consigue ayudar en el presupuesto familiar.

Doña Yelba María López N. es la coordinadora del grupo, ella fue elegida por ser líder del grupo, muy responsable en sus pagos. Ella vende ropa ambulante en Tipitapa donde ya tiene muchos clientes, es mujer sola con una hija adulta que le ayuda en el negocio. Ella sueña con mejorar su casa y tener mas grande su negocio.


Doña Graciela Auxiliadora al igual que su otra compañera de grupo vende repostería de maíz, que se conoce como “cosa de horno”, además ofrece refrescos, café, leche, etc., tiene dos años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Es madre de un niño pequeño de 2 años Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Ella sueña con mejorar la casa porque en los inviernos se le inunda un poco, con los créditos ella ha comprado por mayor la repostería consiguiendo mejores precios.
texts.en:
Photo, from left to right: María Lorena Q. Martínez, Yelba María López N. y Gabriela Auxiliadora Martínez B.. The solidarity group María de Fátima is formed from the closeness of their businesses and for their confidence in each other. They have small businesses in the community of Villa Betania, in the city of Masaya. The three members have a lot of confidence in each other.

Doña María Lorena Q. Martínez is the mother of 2 small children, who are 5 and 2 years old. She sells corn pastries during the day. She buys it in a pastrymaking shop, where they give her good prices. She also sells soft drinks. Her husband works as a guard in Managua, and he helps her with the expenses of the home. For two years she has been in this activity, and manages to help with the family budget.

Doña Yelba María López N. is the coordinator of the group. She was elected to be the leader of the group. She is very responsible in the payments. She sells clothes on the street in Tipitapa, where she already has many customers. She is a single woman with an adult daughter who helps her with the business. She dreams to improve her house and have a bigger business. Doña Graciela Auxiliadora, like her other colleague in the group, sells corn pastries, that are known as “cosa de horno”. Also, she offers soft drinks, coffee, milk, etc. She has been doing this activity for 2 years. She is the mother of a small boy who is 2 years old.
