Lucy Mbaika Musymi has been selling clothes for two years in Emali, where most of her customers are low and middle class earners. She earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000 from the business. Lucy is married to Gibson, a soldier, and they are blessed with four children who are now adults.

Lucy was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and she is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000, which she plans to use to buy more stock of clothes for sale. She will reinvest the anticipated profit back into the business. Lucy hopes to expand her business and be self-sufficient. She is very hardworking and loves her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes

loans.name: Posiano

texts.en: Posiano is a thirty eight year old married man with four children living in his own house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been welding doors, windows and cases for three years. He started with two million UGX and now has working capital of seven million UGX. His challange is the lack of enough capital and  his vision is to have four branches in the Rwenzori region. Posiano needs the loan to relocate his workshop.

loans.use: To relocate his workshop.

loans.name: Abdunofe

texts.en:
J. Abdunofe, a 33-year-old married man who lives with his three children and wife, has owned a sheep-breeding business for the past three years. Because sheep-raising and selling is profitable, he has become a very successful businessman. Abdunofe, whose family members always help and support one another, works very hard and spends his weekend time with the sheep, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. He now wants to expand his business and buy more sheep and so is requesting a loan of $1500 USD. He thanks all lenders for their support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase sheep in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Jephaney

texts.en:
Jephaney G., from the village of Capayangan, Banisilan, Cotabato, is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jephaney owns and operates a service-based business providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members, with her husband as the driver. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jephaney joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capita, she is requesting her third loan of 5000 PHP to purchase tools needed to provide service. Jephaney plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed to provide service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools for his shop and also to hire a student

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi E., married to a farmer and the mother of seven children, was educated through senior high school. For the past eight years, she has been making and selling soap in her village to help her husband with the household expenses and school fees. In the photograph, Esi is shown collecting palm oil, a key ingredient in soap-making.

Esi is determined to grow her business and so needs a loan from Kiva to help her increase her soap-making production. With the resulting increased sales volume and earnings, she will reinvest money into her business, but her ultimate priority is to save enough to put her children through university.

loans.use: to increase her soap-making production.

loans.name: Ma. Jesse

texts.en:
Ma. Jesse is 57 years old and married  with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ma. Jesse buys and sells surplus television sets in the Philippines. Ma. Jesse requested a 16,000 Philippines pesos loan amount through NWTF to buy surplus television sets to sell.

Ma. Jesse has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ma. Jesse would like to earn more income to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase surplus televisions to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, age 46, runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the village of Jasaan Misamis Oriental. She buys and sells canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in her store. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. She is widowed and has nine grown children.

Earlier this year, Victoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack food items. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Victoria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack food items

loans.name: Maira Marisa

texts.es:
Maira, tiene una pupuseria, vive con su esposo y dos hijas D. 20 y 18 años D. edad, Inicio el negocio con su hermana, quien se ofreció a enseñarle la preparación D. las pupusas, no tiene un horario fijo.
Ella quiere comprar material para hacer las pupusas, como compra D. quesillo, chicharrón, tomates, cebollas y bebidas, la inversión le permitirá fortalecer la pupuseria cumpliendo las expectativas D. los clientes, y produciendo más.
El objetivo es hacer aumentar el negocio, ser una empresaria con potencial para su negocio, también darle a su familia una vida confortable.
texts.en:
Maira owns a pupuseria.  She lives with her husband and her two daughters who are 20 and 18.  She started her business with her sister who offered to teach her how to prepare pupusas.  She does not work fixed hours.

Maira would like to buy ingredients for making her pupusas such as 'quesillo' (soft cheese), 'chicharrón' (fried pork skins), tomatoes, onions and drinks.  The investment will allow her to strengthen her pupuseria, meet her customers' expectations and produce more.

Maira's goals are to increase her business, to be a businesswoman who has potential for her business and also to proviD. her family with a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy 'quesillo' (soft cheese), 'chicharrón' (fried pork skins), tomatoes, onions and drinks

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo est un homme âgé de 41 ans. Il est marié å une couturière. Ils ont 3 enfants.   
Kodjo a travaillé comme commerçant depuis 2010. Il a une cafétéria pour toutes personnes à quelques kilomètres de Lomé. Il achète des produits de restauration au Grand Marché de Lomé et travaille avec un employé. 
Kodjo a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du riz, de l’huile, de spaghetti et de l’ail. Il veut satisfaire la demande croissante, assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants et participer à la charge de la famille.
texts.en: Kodjo is a 41 year old man.  He is married to a seamstress. They have 3 children.  Kodjo has worked as a merchant since 2010. He has a cafeteria open to everyone a few kilometers from Lome.  He buys restaurant supplies at the main market in Lome and works with one employee.  Kodjo requested his first loan from WAGES to buy rice, oil, spaghetti, and garlic.  He wants to meet growing demand, guarantee a better future for his children, and participate in supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 47 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, 1 of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.   Judy has a food vending business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 6 years.  

Judy has requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.  In the future, she would like to save more money.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Wellington

texts.en: Wellington has operated his cereal store in Naivasha for the last two years. He buys cereals in bulk directly from farmers and then sells them at the local market. He is 48 years old, married to Susan and they have two school-aged children. He was introduced to Kiva's partner, KADET, by one of KADET's field officers and this will be his third loan. He repaid all of his previous loans on time. Wellington plans to use the requested loan to buy more bags of maize and beans to sell in his store. In the future, Wellington hopes to grow his business and become a large supplier of cereals in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and beans for sale

loans.name: Edenelson

texts.es: Edenelson  vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 1 y 2 años. Él desde que salió de su pueblo natal en el departamento de Bolívar, buscando oportunidades de mejorar su bienestar, encontró mediante la venta de suéteres una opción de ingresos inicial;  así fue como inició con un pequeño capital y con mucho esfuerzo,  con el que posteriormente logró comprar una motocicleta, para hacer sus entregas a domicilio. En la actualidad distribuye su mercancía y también utiliza su vehículo para ofrecer el servicio de transporte.  En su vida de negocio acudió a muchos prestamistas informales y pagó intereses onerosos, así que varias veces se descapitalizó y volvió a empezar, porque estuvo muy cerca de perder su motocicleta. En la actualidad esa es cosa del pasado y ha logrado construir un pequeño capital de trabajo, el cual se esfuerza cada día por cuidarlo, aunque con el gran desafío de   muchas veces no poder responder a sus clientela oportunamente,  porque la recuperación de este una vez vende a crédito, no es suficiente para ser oportuno en sus ventas. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprará sabanas, toallas, suéteres y mercancías,   encargadas por sus más aplicados clientes. Con éste préstamo planea iniciar el crecimiento de su capital de trabajo para obtener más ingresos y en un futuro no muy lejano lograr ahorros para comprar su vivienda, pues en la actualidad vive en casa familiar y sueña con vivir con su familia independiente, construyendo más bienestar de manera autónoma.    Edenelson está muy satisfecho con las dos actividades que desarrolla porque en días pasados aumentaron sus ganancias en un 33% y esto le ha dado un gran entusiasmo para continuar trabajando fuertemente hasta lograr su sueño.
texts.en: Edenelson lives with his partner and their two children (ages 1 and 2 years old) in the municipality of Soledad. Ever since he left his native village in Bolívar province, Edenelson has been looking for opportunities to improve his well-being. He found selling sweaters to be one option for earning money initially. This is how he started - with a little capital and a lot of effort. Later, he was able to buy a motorcycle in order to make home deliveries. Now, he uses the motorcycle both to distribute his merchandise and to provide a transport service. In the course of his business life, he came upon many informal lenders and paid expensive interest rates, so that several times he lost money and had to start again because he was very close to losing his motorcycle. Now, this is a thing of the past and he has succeeded in building up a small working capital, which he takes care to protect every day. However, it is a challenge that many times he cannot respond to his customers opportunely because when he sells on credit, he does not recuperate his money quickly enough to do so. He will use this credikiva (the first loan he has received through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) to buy sheets, towels, sweaters, and other merchandise for his most faithful customers. He plans to use this loan to initiate the growth of his working capital so that he can earn more income and, in the not-too-distant future, save enough to buy a house. Currently, he lives in a family house and he dreams of living independently with his family to increase their well-being and autonomy. Edelnelson is very satisfied with his two businesses because recently, he has increased his profits to 33%, which has made him very enthusiastic about continuing to work hard to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy sheets, towels, sweaters, and merchandise in general

loans.name: Egna

texts.es:
Egna (35 años) está casada y es madre de 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 ya son mayores y tienen su propia familia mientras que  2 aun son menores y viven con ella y su esposo en su casa propia que pudo comprar con arduo trabajo.Egna tiene lleva ya un año en la actividad de la venta de periódicos, trabaja también en un canal en el sector de servicio pero ese trabajo solo lo hace por tres horas mientras el resto del día se dedica a la venta de periódicos por las calles de la ciudad. Esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposo con quien le gusta trabajar ya que se complementan bien y además les agrada pasar tiempo juntos.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que no tiene que depender de nadie para poder ponerse un horario de trabajo ya que la otra actividad solo lo hace en tres horas, lo que no le gusta es que tiene que caminar mucho para poder vender todos los ejemplares que tiene ya que no le gusta volver con diarios en las manos porque lo considera una pérdida. Ella espera poder más adelante empezar a vender frutas y bebidas en su casa esta ubicada en una zona estratégica porque está al frente de un parque el cual es visitado frecuentemente  durante las tardes por muchas personas en busca de bebidas para saciar su sed. Este es el tercer préstamo entre Egna y la institución MFP, Le gusta trabajar con este grupo y se siente cómoda ya que todos son responsables y sobre todo son unidos.Con el préstamo solicitado 1300 soles, espera poder implementar algunos artículos y materiales para empezar con la venta en su casa.
texts.en:
Egna, 35, is married and the mother of four children: two adults that have their own families and two minors still living with her and her husband in her own house that she was able to buy thanks to arduous work.

Egna has been selling newspapers for a year.  She also works as a cleaning lady but that’s only for three hours while the rest of the day she spends selling newspapers throughout the city streets.  She does this activity alongside her husband.  She enjoys working with him because they complement each other well and they enjoy spending time together.

What she likes about her work is that she doesn’t have to depend on anyone to set her work schedule since her other job is only for three hours.  What she doesn’t like so much is having to walk so much to sell all the issues she has because she doesn’t like to return with unsold issues since that represents a loss.  

She hopes later on to start selling fruit and soft-drinks at home which is located in a strategic spot across from a park and during the afternoons it’s quite crowded with people looking for beverages to slack their thirst.

This is the third loan between Egna and MFP.  She likes working with this group and feels comfortable because everyone is responsible and, above all, very united.  She will use the requested 1300 soles to buy a few items and materials to start the home-based sales business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and other items necessary to start a home-based business.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.es: Cresencia tiene 63 años, radica en Huancayo al lado de su esposo desde hace más de 20 años en su casa que es propia. Desde su juventud se ha dedicado a la agricultura  de las cuales  siempre ha cultivado papa y maíz principalmente. En muchas ocasiones  por las condiciones climáticas y la inestabilidad de los precios en el mercado le perjudicó en su economía. Fue así que por recomendación de unos familiares decidió cultivar flores y criar vacas en su establo; consiguió en el municipio de su municipalidad un puesto de ventas del mercado de su ciudad y desde entonces vende sus propias cosechas, Desde entonces sus ventas se han incrementó poco a poco y tiene mayores márgenes de ganancias porque no tiene intermediario, pues es productora y comerciante. Su esposo también trabaja junto con ella en estas tareas ya que con tantos años de matrimonio han formado bien a sus 4 hijos que ahora son personas mayores. Por el crecimiento de sus ventas le es muy necesario producir más flores por lo que necesita tener más capital para sembrar. Para Crecencia es su tercera solicitud de crédito que tiene, las otras 2 anteriores es donde ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos y prudente en la buena inversión que realizó para el crecimiento de su negocio. En esta ocasión, el dinero que solicita, lo destinará en la compra de semillas de flores y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Cresencia is 63 years old, and has lived in Huancayo with her husband for more than 20 years in her own house. Since her youth she has done agricultural work, primarily growing potatoes and corn. On many occasions, weather conditions and instability in market prices have been detrimental to her finances. For this reason, and on the recommendation of some of her relatives, she decided to grow flowers and raise cows in her stable. 

From the government office of her municipality, she got a sales stall at her city's market, and from then on she sold her own harvests. Since then her sales have increased little by little and she has a larger profit margin because there is no middle man, since she is the producer and vendor. Her husband also works with her in these labors. Through their many years of marriage, they have raised 4 children who are all grown.

Due to the increase in her sales, she needs to produce more flowers, and for this she needs more capital for planting. This is Cresencia's third loan request. Through the previous 2 she has shown herself to be punctual in her payments and prudent in her investments for the growth of her business. In this case, the money she requests will be used to purchase flower seeds and sacks of manure.

loans.use: to purchase flower seeds and sacks of manure

loans.name: Severino

texts.en:
“You will win through ambition and perseverance,” is the expression of a 50-year-old man who is engaged in raising poultry, such as ducks and chickens. He believes this is true because most of the highly successful people he knows are ambitious and persevere. He hopes that someday he will be one of those people. Through his ambition and perseverance, he hopes to lift his family from the difficulty of life.

Aside from his poultry business, he is also engaged in farming. He is able to work in both of these occupations through his perseverance. He dreams of expanding his poultry business so he is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 to buy ducks and chickens. Part of the loan will also be used to build a shelter for his poultry.

He hopes to win this battle of improving their living conditions and in satisfying this gift of life that God has given to him.

loans.use: to buy ducks and chickens.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Kossiwa est une femme  âgée de 31ans. Elle est mariée à un commerçant. Elle a deux enfants.
Kossiwa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale dans sa boutique à Bè-Kpota. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Kossiwa a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des marchandises. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kossiwa voudrait agrandir son commerce.
texts.en: Kossiwa is 31 years old and married to a salesman. The couple have 2 children. Kossiwa has been in sales since 2007 and sells food products from her shop in Bè-Kpota. She buys her products in Lomé and is requesting her first loan from WAGES so that she can restock. Kossiwa would like to expand her business in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Las Hijas De Dios Group

texts.es: Las integrantes del grupo invertiran el credito en mercaderia para sus negocios con el fin de seguir creciendo. La coordinadora del grupo María Elena ademas de vender ropa realiza comidas y es en la compar de granos básicos que invertirá.
texts.en: The members of the group will invest the loan in merchandise for their businesses in order to continue growing.  The coordinator of the group María Elena, in addition to selling clothing, makes meals and it is in the purchase of staple foods that she will invest.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, blouses and other items of clothing.

loans.name: Nicolas De Tolentin

texts.es: Nicolas de Tolentino de 58 años de edad trabaja como guarda de seguridad en la Univesidad, solicita su 3er préstamo para remodelar una habitación en su casa, ya que el sueño de este señor es darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, el es un señor muy reconocido en su comunidad y en  su centro de trabajo por las relaciones que tiene con todo el personal y estudiantes, es un hombre trabajador y con mucha honestidad que ha sacado adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo.
texts.en: Nicolás de Tolentino, 58, works as a security guard at the University.  He’s requesting his third home improvement loan to remodel one of his bedrooms since his dream is to provide his family with better living conditions.  He’s very well known in his community and at work because of the relationships he has with all the personnel and with his students.  He’s a hardworking, very honest man who’s raised his family with much effort.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a single man operating his own rental house. He’s worked in this business for three years. Edward has a side job as a grocer, which provides another source of income. He describes his greatest business challenges to be transportation and accessibility during rainy seasons. His highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Edward will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase supplies to run the rental house more efficiently. Edward aspires to open his own green grocer shop in the future. He joined Yehu because they understand their clients.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his rental house

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn, a married mother of 17 children, is 48 years old and a resident of Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. Merlyn, a hardworking, responsible woman who found herself needing to sell seafood to help her husband support the household, has been selling fish for more than five years. She goes out every morning at 5 a.m. to buy fresh product directly from the fishermen and then resells it in her local market or door-to-door in neighborhoods near the market. Preferred by customers because of the quality of her products, she earns about Php 4,600.00 each month.

A member of GDMPC for more than 3 years, Merlyn is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to buy more fish to sell in the market. The profits arising from the loan will go toward the education of her children and to sustain the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a 29-year-old married lady.  She sells clothes to earn a living.  She has been in the business for five years.  Besides, she does farming for extra income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and save her money.  This is because she can easily access a business loan because she is a member of a group registered under Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each other's loan.  

She has requested for a loan of 100,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is a 44-year-old business man. He is married to Elizabeth who is a housewife. He has been a lab technician for the past three years earning a monthly income of KES 8,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Douglas will use the loan to buy chemicals and medicines for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a chemist which will help him to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and medicines for the laboratory

loans.name: Aveave

texts.en:
Aveave, a 53-year-old married mother of five, plants and harvests taro for sale. With six years of experience in this business, Aveave is requesting her first loan for WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the enterprise.

In 2011, Aveave joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks.

SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is), and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score."" For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.en:
Victoire is a 38-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of five and fourteen years old. All of her children are in school, and her husband sells a variety of goods.

For the past twenty years, Victoire has been selling cassava. With her earnings she has been able to develop her business and meet the needs of her family.

Victoire is requesting this loan so that she can purchase more cassava to sell at a profit. With her profits, she will save for her family and pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 53 years old and is married to Margaret. They are blessed with two children. He has been in the farming business for the past ten years. He has a monthly income of KES 8,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. John will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig-rearing, which will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca de 61 años de edad, vive en Yalaguina municipio de Estelí, es comerciante tiene una Pulpería, tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y son independientes. El capital con que comenzó su negocio fue gracias a la venta de 2 vacas que su padre le heredo. Fue comprando producto poco a poco así mismo fue creciendo su clientela, con este negocio mantuvo su hogar y la educación de sus tres hijos. Sus clientes fijos a diario la visitan son los pequeños beisbolistas ya que se encuentra cerca de uno de los estadios de Beisbol.     
Ella realizo el crédito para compra de productos tales como jabones, detergentes, granos básicos, pan , jugos, agua embotellada, gaseosas galletas, leche, huevo. Pues son alimentos que sus clientela busca a diario y que muchas veces se vuelven escasos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Francisca, age 61, lives in Yalaguina in the Estelí municipality.  She is a merchant, and she has a grocery store.  She has three children who are  independent adults.

The money used to start the business was thanks to the sale of two cows that her father bequeathed her.  Little by little she bought products, and her clientele was growing.  With this business she supported her household and paid for the education of her three children.  Fixed customers visit the store daily.  They are young baseball players because her business is close to one of the baseball stadiums.

She got the loan to buy products like soap, detergent, basic grains, bread, juice, bottled water, soft drinks, cookies, milk, and eggs.  These are the items that her customers look for every day.  They are often scarce in her community.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergent, basic grains, bread, juice, bottled water, soft drinks, cookies, milk, and eggs.

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Lina Marcela una mujer de 18 años, vive cada segundo de la vida, todos la conocen por su sonrisa que la caracteriza al igual que su preguntadera porque todo lo quiere saber pero muy poco responder. Una persona que detalla la vida y aprende de ella, pues la vida le enseñó a que el pasado nos ayuda a no cometer los mismos errores o mejorar cosas en el presente; claro está que de los errores se aprende y hay que caer para poderse levantar aun con mas fuerzas.
Esta mujer tiene varias aspiraciones para su vida y tiene como proyecto de vida ser una profesional en su carrera, trabajo pero sobre todo como persona, que quiere sobresalir por sus conocimientos ante los demás hacer sentir orgullosa a su madre quien además de darle la vida es una mujer de admirar, quien le ha enseñado a sus hijas el verdadero significado de la unión familiar y de superar los obstáculos siempre teniendo aspiraciones, sueños, metas, de jamás dejar de estudiar de llenarse de conocimiento de experiencias vividas, conocer el mundo conocer a las personas y aprender de ellas.
Lina es una niña alegre, responsable, sencilla de pensamiento abierto, hiperactiva, ágil, jamás se queda quieta siempre da más de lo que le piden, solo pide una oportunidad más para seguir estudiando y seguir creciendo como persona y profesional.
texts.en:
Lina Marcela, 18, lives every second of life.  Everyone knows her for her characteristic smile as well as for all the questions she asks, because she wants to know everything but not respond to anything.  She's a person who explains life and learns from it.  Life has taught her that the past helps us to not make the same mistakes, or to improve things in the present.  It's true, we learn from our mistakes and it's necessary to fall to be able to get back up with even more strength.

This woman has several goals in life.  Her life project is to be a professional in her field, in her work but above all as a person who wants to stand out in the eyes of others because of her knowledge.  

Lina wants to make her mother proud.  Her mother, in addition to giving her life, is a woman to admire.  She taught her daughters the true meaning of family unity; of overcoming obstacles; of always having aspirations, dreams, and goals; of never stopping studying; of filling themselves with knowledge and lived experiences; of knowing the world and people and learning from them.

Lina's a happy, responsible, modest girl.  She's open minded, hyperactive, and flexible.  She's never still.  She always gives more than she's asked to.  She asks only for another opportunity to continue studying and growing as a person and as a professional.

loans.use: to get a technical education in graphic arts and advertising

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther  is 63 years old and has 6 children. She has been a farmer for more than 40 years and is always said to be a very resourceful person. Even though Esther  is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya.

Esther  started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills.

Esther ’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights."

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 27 years old, married with one child who is attending nursery school. She has been a treasurer of a savings and credit group called Mary Gorret Kiangunyi for the last four years. She started her business in 1998 with only one piece of welding machine and one person. Currently, she has two welding machines and employs four people. She is planning to open up another branch in Nairobi where the demand for metal works is relatively high. Her average sales per month range from USD 300 toUSD500. She expects to increase her sales when she gets another machine from USD 500 to at least USD 700.

loans.use: She would like to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice's business is cosmetic retailing. She has been a very good client of the Kraban Support Foundation. She has participated in all of our TEACH programs and has graduated from the Basics to the Advanced stages of the programs. She wants a loan amount of $800 from Kiva.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in the purchasing of more inventory to replenish his grocery store

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Evangelina has run a small grocery store for the past 20 years. She started this business because, as a single mother, it was very difficult to find a job that allowed her to care for her three children. She has never relied on anyone else, managing to raise and educate her children on her own. She started out selling just a few products and through her hard work was able to expand her inventory and grow her business.

Today, Evangelina hopes to further expand her business and meet her customers's demand with additional merchandise. For this, she's requesting a loan in the amount of $550 to be repaid over a period of 6 months. She thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 20 años Evangelina se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, inició su propio negocio porque es madre soltera y para ella era muy difícil conseguir un empleo y de alguien cuidara a sus tres hijos. Nunca ha contado con el apoyo de nadie peor de esta manera ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y pagar sus estudios, empezó vendiendo muy pocos productos y gracias al buen trabajo que realiza pronto logro incrementar su variedad y mejorar su negocio.

Ahora Evangelina desea darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio y para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes está solicitando un préstamo de $ 550 dólares, mismos que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Ella sabe que con tu ayuda mejorará mucho su negocio y agradece sinceramente el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Phạm Thị Nhuận, 40 years old, is living a happy life with her husband and 2 children in the village of Tiên Dược, Sóc Sơn district. When they got married, they were empty handed. Ms Nhuận knew about TYM fund when it opened a branch in her village in 1994 but she did not have a chance to participate because her children were still too young. In 2000, she applied for a loan of 50 USD to buy a pig and chickens. 3 years later in 2003, she built a nice cozy house with the money that she made from raising pigs and chickens. Since the day she became a member of the fund, she got a lot of support from her husband. He's in charge of the weekly payment and frees up her time for her to participate in the group activities organized by TYM fund: cultural, letters & arts. She is respected and trusted by her peers. She is the group representative for TYM branch 1 in Sóc Sơn. She's requesting a loan of 950 USD to renovate the facilities, buy 3 pigs and 500 chicks to take advantage of the Tết (new year) rush. Right now, the monthly revenue for her family is about 125 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Phạm Thị Nhuận, 40 tuổi, đang có một cuộc sống hạnh phúc với chồng và hai con tại xã Tiên Dược, Sóc Sơn. Khi mới xây dựng gia đình, do đông anh em, hoàn cảnh gia đình khó khăn nên anh chị ra ở riêng chỉ với 2 bàn tay trắng. Mặc dù biết Quỹ TYM hoạt động tại địa phương từ năm 1994, nhưng vì con còn nhỏ nên chị chưa có cơ hội tham gia. Năm 2000 chị tham gia vào Quỹ và xin vay 50 USD dùng vào đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Năm 2003 chị đã xây được ngôi nhà cấp 4 khang trang, rộng rãi bằng số lãi thu được từ việc kinh doanh nói trên. Kể từ khi tham gia Quỹ, chị Nhuận luôn được chồng hỗ trợ trong việc trả tiền tuần, đặc biệt anh luôn tạo điều kiện về thời gian để chị tham gia các hoạt động của Quỹ như sinh hoạt cụm, giao lưu văn hóa văn nghệ … Chị luôn được chị em tín nhiệm bầu vào ban quản lý cụm. Hiện nay chị đang là cụm trưởng của chi nhánh 1 Sóc Sơn. Dự định của chị là vay 950 USD để sửa sang lại chuồng trại nuôi bò, mua 3 con lợn và 500 con gà thịt để phục vụ cho dịp Tết Nguyên Đán 2008. Hiện tại thu nhập của gia đình là 125 USD/tháng.

loans.use: Repair the cage, buy 3 pigs and 500 chicks

loans.name: Lauteria Frías

texts.en:
Lauteria, 38, is an active, experienced, goal-oriented and committed businesswoman. She has a degree in Education Sciences. She has two children, a 19-year-old girl and a boy, age 11. The girl goes to the university in Santo Domingo, the capital, and the boy attends school in the community. Her husband is a mechanical engineer. Six years ago, Lauteria took out a loan from our organization to open a cafeteria. She invested the funds in some frying pans, an oven, a gas tank and ingredients to prepare food. She says that God has helped her operate the business wisely so that she could manage to have profits. She is now able to improve her children's education and pay transport for her daughter to go to Santo Domingo to the university three times a week.

Now she is looking forward to doing things even better and running business in a way that better satisfies her customers’ needs and earns new clients. She plans to rent a small site for the cafeteria and not have to operate the business within her house. She also wants to introduce new dishes into the menu.

She has applied for a second loan to invest in the rent of the new site and ingredients to keep operating the business. That way, Lauteria will continue producing food for her clientele and keep on improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To rent a small site for her cafeteria and buy ingredients

loans.name: Said

texts.ru:
Said M. is 24 years old, has a college education and is an economist-programmer by profession. He is married with 2 children. Said currently works at “ITM Tajikistan.” He also owns a business that sells SIM cards and cards to refill mobile phone balances.

Said plans to use his loan to purchase SIM cards and cards to refill balances on mobile phones. His business helps mobile phone users to get the services that they need as there are a lot of people in Tajikistan that use cell phone services. Said plans to pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Муминов Саид, возраст – 24 года, образование высшее, по специальности – экономист - программист, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Саид в настоящее время работает в компании «ITM Tajikistan». Также он имеет диллерский центр по продаже сим-карт и карт для пополение баланса мобильного телефона. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести сим-карты и карты для пополнения баланса мобильных телефонов. Диллерский центр помогает пользователям мобильной связи приобретать сим-карты для мобильных телефонов, а также карты пополения баланса, так как на сегодняшний день в Таджикистане оочень много человек пользующиеся услугами сотовой связи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of SIM cards and refill cards

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 51-year-old Mary M.. She is single with three children, aged 7, 13, and 15. Mary runs a livestock business, and requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional cows and poultry.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on Kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. Who or what are ‘kuku’, you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

Firstly, they require little start-up capital: you can start with one or two and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional cows and chickens.

loans.name: Mohammad Aslam

texts.en: Mohammad Aslam lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has 2 children. He is an educated man. Mohamman has a bakery, which he has owned in for 10 years. He now has 10 years of good experience and involvement in this business, and has good contacts with restaurants and with local people. He would like to expand his business, so he has requested an individual loan to increase his inventory. He would be happy to make a good income to support his family and improve has business.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his bakery

loans.name: Foday

texts.en: Foday is a professional mechanic.  He owns a workshop in Makeni town and also provides transport services to the public.  Foday would like to diversify and expand his workshop by opening a shop selling spare parts.

loans.use: To diversify his business to include auto parts for sale in addition to offering mechanic services

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. sells fruit. She is married and has four children. Her business is doing very well and she wants to increase her sales.

She is asking for $225 as additional capital to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Koffi Lanyo

texts.fr:
Koffi Lanyo A. was born on May 13, 1969, in Gblainviém in Zio prefecture. For lack of financial means, he quit secondary school and went into agriculture. Married, he is the father of seven and has a nephew in his care. His wife, thanks to her commerce in charcoal, also contributes to meeting family expenses. Having become a renowned agriculturalist by successfully incorporating animal husbandry in his farm, he figured out how to manage the initial loan, which he repaid without incident. In addition, he has an orange tree plantation in his native village. Dynamic in his work, he is requesting a new loan to buy a motorbike, which will make it easy for him to get about, because he intends to extend his cultivated area and to improve his poultry production. He is thinking he will make his business more profitable to increase his bottom line in order to better his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Koffi Lanyo est né le 13 mai 1969 Gblainvié, dans la préfecture du Zio. Par manque de moyens financiers, il abandonna ses études secondaires et s’est lancé dans l’agriculture. Marié, il est père de sept (7) enfants, il a à sa charge un neveu. Sa femme, grâce à son commerce de charbon de bois, contribue aussi aux dépenses familiales. Devenu un grand exploitant agricole de renommer par sa bonne association d’élevage à la culture végétale, il a su bien gérer le premier crédit qu’il a remboursé sans incident. En plus, il a une plantation d’oranger dans son village natal. Dynamique dans ses activités, il sollicite un nouveau crédit qui servira à acheter une moto qui lui facilitera ses déplacements, car son intention est d’étendre sa surface cultivée et améliorer son élevage de volailles. Il pense rentabiliser plus ses activités afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires pour le mieux être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
Camila is a member of the "Las Golondrinas" ("The Swallows") group-lending organization. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She earns a living making and selling food, from a remodeled room in her house where her guests come each day to eat. They're mostly local people or passers-by from nearby neighborhoods. Thanks to a recommendation from a friend and without any other requirement, she received a loan from Manuela Ramos when she most needed it. That's how she was able to contribute to her family's household expenses and especially to the school fees of her 2 children. It was that requirement that drove her to start the business making and selling dishes typical to this area. Thanks to her perseverance and drive to get ahead, she's managed to create a business.

With the S/.1000 (1000 Peruvian soles) loan, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy bulk supplies of rice, sugar, pasta, (bunches of) bananas and cooking oil, all of which are becoming increasing expensive, so that she has large inventories of basic products, just like she had her own store. All will be used to make the food that she provides to her customers.

Camila, 52, is a happy and enthusiastic woman who, together with her husband, wants in her humble way to contribute to the progress of the community that has given her the chance to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Camila Ramírez Ramírez, es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Golondrinas”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, en un ambiente acondicionado especialmente en su propia casa, ubicada en el jr Ramón castilla Nro 1388 donde diariamente acuden su comensales, que son moradores de la propia localidad o transeúntes de lugares cercanos. Gracias a la invitación de una amiga ella obtuvo un préstamo sin mayores requisitos en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, en el momento que mas necesitaba, y de esta manera poder aportar económicamente en los gastos de la casa, sobretodo en la educación superior de sus 2 hijos. Esta necesidad la impulsó a iniciarse en el negocio de la preparación de comida tipo menú en el mercado “La paradita”, gracias a su perseverancia y ganas de salir adelante ha obtenido lo que ahora tiene.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 a ser pagados en 4 meses implementará su negocio comprando arroz, azúcar por sacos, fideos en paquetes, plátano en racimos y aceite a granel ya que sus costos cada vez son mas elevados y a ella le conviene tener en cantidad como su propio almacén, para la preparación de la comida que ha diario ofrece a su clientela.

La señora Camila tiene 52 años, es una muy mujer entusiasta y alegre que junto a su esposo y con la humildad que demuestra quiere contribuir al progreso de la comunidad que le dio la oportunidad de salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of products for food business.

loans.name: Yormuhammad

texts.ru:
Yormuhammad H. lives in Nurek. He is married and has 6 children. He works in agriculture and grows vegetables. Yormuhammad sells his harvest at the market. He has been in this business for 20 years and earns decent profits. Yormuhammad would like to take out a loan to purchase fertilizer. In addition, he is getting ready for planting and would like to purchase high quality seeds. Yormuhammad will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хакимов Ермухаммад житель города Нурек.Женат , имеет шестерых детей. Занимается земледелием. Выращивает овощи . Готовый урожай продает на рынке . Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 20 лет. Дело имеет неплохой доход. В данный момент хочет получить кредит и закупить удобрения. Кроме того он готовиться к засеву и хочет купить качественные семена. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Mashallah

texts.en: Mashallah D. is 50 years old and sells different supplies in a small village of the Satli region. He started his business in 2000. He is married and has 2 sons. Mashallah also works as a teacher in a local school, but his salary is too small to cover even basic family needs. His store is the main financial source for his family. Now he would like to expand his business and purchase more supplies for his store. For this purpose he applied for 1000 USD.

loans.use: To expand his business and purchase more supplies for his store

loans.name: Chab

texts.en:
Mr. Chab L. (shown in the picture on the left with his group members) was selected to be the group leader by members of his group who are requesting a loan from Maxima. In the group there are three families including his. All the group members live along National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Chab L., 49, and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Khun, 47, married in 1979 and have seven children: four sons and three daughters. Four of their children are married and live outside the family home. One child has full-time employment and other two children study in local schools. Chab has been a provincial officer for twenty-eight years, while his wife sells porridge at home. Now she wants to create another business selling grocery items. Therefore, Chab is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to purchase grocery items for his wife to sell.

Mr. Chanthy Khon, 26, and his wife, Mrs. Manuch Cheav, married in 2004 and have one son and one daughter. Chanthy has been a motor taxi driver for one year, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for five years. Chanthy is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to roof his house. Mrs. Kim Chhum (show in the picture on the right), 54, is a widow with seven children: two sons and five daughters. Three of her daughters are married and live outside the family home and the other four children study in local schools. Kim has been raising cows for many years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to roof her cow pen and her house.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for re-sale and repair their house

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 28 años, soltero, es propietario de un motocarro, él mismo lo conduce y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde tiempos atrás.  Vive independientemente, se siente feliz porque gracias a su herramienta de trabajo está logrando poco a poco lo que desea.  Su objetivo es tener un taller mecánico de motos y motocarros, para dedicarse a fondo a este negocio, ya que estudio para eso. Para ello, necesita seguir trabajando, pero su motocarro no está en buenas condiciones, necesita comprar repuestos para repararlo, por lo que necesariamente estima del préstamo que solicita para lograr su propósito. Apoyemos a este joven, ejemplo para muchos que quiere salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jorge is 28, single and owns a motorized cart; he drives it himself and has worked transporting passengers for a while. He lives independently and feels happy because thanks to his working tool he is achieving his small wishes. His goal is to have a mechanic shop for motorcycles and motorized carts and do this full time, because he went to school for it. To do this, he needs to keep working, however, his cart is not in good condition, he needs to buy repairs to fix it and appreciates getting the loan he requests. Let’s support this young man, an example for many who wish to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy repairs to fix motorized cart

loans.name: Casani Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Mercedes M. Calisaya ingresó a la institución el año 2004, su actividad es la venta D. articulos para el hogar en su pequeña tienda, es viuda, por lo que su negocio es el único ingreso económico que percibe, en esta ocación destinará el crédito para refaccionar su casa.
La Sra. Gertrudis se dedica a la venta D. comida  en un comedor popular dela zona El Tejar, una populosa zona D. La Paz, Bolivia, como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta en su tienda D. abarrotes, la señora es una persona responsable y puntual con sus pagos, la señora es muy antigua en la institución por lo cual es seleccionada para ingresar al programa Kiva.
La señoras son personas emprendedoras que tienen una visión a futuro muy amplia.
texts.en:
Mercedes M. Calisaya joined the community bank in 2004. Her activity is selling products for the home in her her small store. She is a widower, thus her business is her only source of income. With this loan she will refurbish her house. Gertrudis works selling food in a popular diner in the El Tejar zone, a busy zone in La Paz, Bolivia. As a secondary activity she sells groceries. She is a responsible person and punctual with her payments. She is a long time member of the institution which is why she was selected to participate in the Kiva program. The women are entrepreneurial women that have a vision of a bright future.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital and reburbishment of home

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma vive en casa de sus suegros con su hija en la calle Ángel Dávalos de la Zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz ; la actividad que realiza es la venta de productos de belleza marca Yambal y productos Bata. Con esta actividad ella mantiene a su hija y puede cubrir sus necesidades de alimentación y estudios ya que esta separa da del esposo por  varios años.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, así poder comprar más mercadería y  mejorar sus ingresos.

El historial de pagos de Vilma es muy bueno y por lo tanto influye muchísimo para su calificación y aprobación de un  nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma lives with her daughter in her in-laws’ house on Ángel Dávalos Street in the Alto San Pedro district of La Paz city; she sells products from the beauty line Yambal and the Bata catalog. With this work she supports her daughter and covers food and school expenses, since she has been separated from her husband for many years. The loan she is asking for is to increase her capital so that she can buy more merchandise and improve her income. Vilma’s payment history is very good, which qualifies her for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita B. V. D. T. is seventy-three years old. She lives in downtown Pucallpa, Peru in the Amazon River basin region of the country. Margarita doesn’t have a husband but does have four children. She is also a member of the Talented Women communal bank and has taken out small business loans through her group for seven years.

Margarita uses her small business loans to pay for maintenance costs to rooms she rents out monthly to pensioners. She is pictured in the stairwell of her guesthouse, because she cannot climb the stairs well to show the rooms she plans to renovate on the third floor. Margarita is currently requesting 1,000 Nuevo Soles to make repairs to the rental units in her home. She will repay her loan in monthly installments over the course of four months.

loans.use: to make repairs to the rental units in her home

loans.name: Comunidad Unida 5 & 6 Group

texts.en: Margarita G. M. is one of the members of group 6 in the "Comunidad Unida" (United Community) Bank of Hope. This loan is also being taken by group 5 in the same bank, for a total of 10 borrowers. These groups are located in Brisas del Ozama, a community located on the eastern part of Santo Domingo, very near the Ozama River, one of the largest in the country. During rainy season, this river is a serious threat to these people`s houses. Margarita sells clothes as a business. With her new loan she wants to increase her business even more. Elize hopes that she one day will be able to buy a nice house to live in. She is also very preoccupied about the future of her children. Please help us support these ladies` hard work. Thank you!

loans.use: purchase new merchandise to refurbish their businesses

loans.name: Vuong's Group

texts.vi:
Vương Thị Nhạn sinh năm 1976,( mã số: 010117050027) chị ở cùng chồng và hai con. Chồng chị là lái xe có thu nhập ổn định, bản thân chị ở nhà bán quán bia hơi. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng: 4.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chu kỳ vốn này chị vay mức: 3.132.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng bán giải khát( bia, nước ngọt,..). Cùng vay vốn với chị còn có:
 Nguyễn Thị Phiên sinh năm 1969, ( mã số: 010117050026) gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp. chồng chị đi làm có thu nhập ổn định, chị đi chợ bán hoa quả có thu nhập theo ngày. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 4.500.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị vay mức: 3.132.000 vnđ để đi chợ.
 Nguyễn Thị Lệ sinh năm 1968, ( mã số: 010117050025) Vợ chồng chị có ba đứa con. Chị làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi gà, chồng làm thợ xây, thu nhập bình quân khoảng 4.000.000 vnđ /tháng. Chị tham gia vay mức vốn: 3.132.000 vnđ để đầu tư thức ăn cho gà.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vuong T. N. (ID: 010117050027), born 1976, lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is a driver with stabL. income, and she stays at home selling draught beer. The average income of the family is about VND4,000,000 per month. In this loan cycL., she wishes to borrow VND3,132,000 to invest in the beverage shop (beer, soft drinks). Other borrowers in the Group include:

- Mrs .Nguyen T. P. (ID: 010117050026), born 1969. The family's main business is farming. Her husband is employed with stabL. wages. She trades fruits at the market to get the daily income. The average income of her family is about VND4,500,000 per month. She wishes to borrow VND3,132,000 to trade.

- Mrs. Nguyen T. L. (ID:010117050025), born 1968. Her family has three children. She farms and raises chickens. Her husband is a construction worker. The average income is about VND4,000,000 per month. She wishes to borrow VND3,132,000 to buy foods for chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for petty trades

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is forty-two years old. She is married and has three little kids who are in basic school. Comfort lives with her husband and children in a community called Nkwaateng. Nkwaateng is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, a quite appreciable number of the women are involved in palm oil production. Comfort is one of these women who actively produce palm oil. She has been in business for five years. Her husband is a daily savings collector in the community.

Comfort buys palm nuts from the farmers in her community; processes them in her house to produce the oil and sells it at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from palm fruit which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (the oil) is skimmed off and reboiled to expel its water content. Comfort desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying palm fruit in bulk to be able to supply to more customers. She also trades in "kenkey," one the favorite local dishes, to supplement her income.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to scale up production to serve larger market and eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Courage Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure palm fruit in bulk

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar S., 32, operates a small grocery store providing daily necessities such as staple foods, soda, cleaners, etc.  Married with four children between the ages of four and nine,  Sahar started the business to help her husband pay for their children's education as well as the household expenses. 

Sahar is always looking for ways to increase business and attract new customers. With the $1000 loan she is hoping to receive, she will be able to buy more supplies for her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her grocery store

loans.name: Trust In God Group

texts.en:
This is Esther P., Madinatu K., Hanna Davis, Josetta Decker, and Yomie Lumpkin. They named their group Trust in God. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each to enable them to give a boost to their businesses.

Esther P. (right) is the leader of this group. Esther is thirty-eight years of age. She was born in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown. She is single with two children who are in nursery and class one. Esther has been in business for three years now. She sells soap.

loans.use: Invest in her soap-selling business

loans.name: Feruza

texts.ru: Косимова Феруза-молодая женщина 28-ми лет,замужем,имеет 1-го ребенка.Она занимается розничной продажей детской одежды и игрушек.В месяц 2 раза Фируза ездит за товаром в город Истаравшан,где расположен оптовый рынок.Сейчас начало летнего сезона,поэтому она решила взять кредит и расширить свой ассортимент.Также Феруза копит деньги для открытия новой торговой точки,где будет торговать её муж.Более 2-х лет Фируза кредитуется в нашей организации и благодарна нашим кредиторам за поддержку её бизнеса.
texts.en:
Feruza K. is young 28-year-old woman, who is married and has one child. She is involved in retail sales of children’s clothing and toys. Twice per month, Feruza travels for her goods to the city of Istaravshan, where a wholesale market is located. With the summer season starting now, Feruza decided to obtain a loan and expand her goods assortment. Feruza is also saving money in order to open a new store for her husband to run. Feruza has been a working with our organization for over 2 years and is grateful to our creditors for supporting her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of goods assortment

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en:
F. Zebo is an enterprising woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver and his salary isn't stable, so sometimes debts would accumulate. To help her husband, Zebo decided to start her own business, designing and making national dresses for women. She began after her first child was born and started with a small machine she already owned. Now she has a small workshop and two employees that help her cover the demands of her clients. The good service and fine quality she offers has made her business grow into a small company.

Zebo wants a loan of 4800 Somoni to buy materials and repair her sewing machine so she can fill her customer's orders. The loan will help her business grow and raise the quality of life for her family. Zebo sincerely thanks you for your help.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of fabrics

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
T. Hoàng Thị (1424040561) is a 38 year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, T. owns & operates a business venture raising cattle for sale.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 18 years and earns approximately 2,100,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. T. is requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND to be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 6th loan taken out by T. from TYM Fund.  She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Apollonia

texts.en: Appollonia A., 38, is married with 4 children.  She has experience in the sewing business.  Appollonia sells to the general public 7 days per week.  She has no previous loans with SPBD.  Appollonia expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Appollonia’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sewing machine and cotton materials.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 53 years old and a resident of Barangay Wigan Cordon, Isabela. Her husband Leon P. works as a farmer in their village. He used to plant upland rice in their village since their place is also considered mountainous one. The couple is grateful for having a family that works together for the progress of their lives.

Virginia has a small piggery in their backyard that adds to the family's income. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5000 to maintain her hog raising business. Considering the profit it may bring to her family is why Virginia wants her business to become more progressive.

Virginia plans to send her younger children to school. She really hopes that she can obtain the loan because it will be of big help to her family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is a member of the Tupendane borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is 32 years old and married, and is the mother of 3 children ages 4, 10, and 14 years old. She also cares for others 2 dependents.

Zaituni started her own food business selling snacks 6 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 30,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Zaituni's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 250,000 Tsh to buy more commodities like rice and wheat. With the additional profit that she gains from the use of these loan funds, Zaituni hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, wheat, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
Y. Akbar is a clothing merchant from Khujand, Tajikistan. He started his small business 7 years ago, and though much hard work, he has been able to develop it into quite a successful enterprise. His wife (pictured) is also engaged in this business.

Akbar has the qualities it takes to succeed as an entrepreneur. Goal-oriented, hard-working and punctual, he is a natural business man. Funding from IMON International has been instrumental in helping Akbar build his business. His first loan was for US$ 2500 and since that time he has benefited from one additional loan while establishing a great credit history. He has requested a loan of 1000 USD to add to his available working capital.

The ability to purchase large quantities of inventory in bulk saves time and expense for him. Akbar appreciates the availability of funding through IMON International. It allows him to take advantage of good opportunities and focus on growing his business so that he is able to adequately provide for himself and his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchasing  new clothing for resale

loans.name: Ivetti Nelly

texts.en: Ivetti is a member of The Orchids Village Bank. Ivetti is single and is the youngest of 8 siblings. She used to live with her parents and she studied sewing and design, which led her to a career at a workshop for many years. Ivetti has begun to sell her services in altering and repairing clothing. She is not now able to sew because she just suffered the loss of her father. He was 84 years-old when he died due to heart problems. It has been a very difficult time for her. Ivetti needs a new loan of 1,000 soles to purchase linen and threads for dressmaking, and other articles of clothing. Her dream is to have a dressmaking workshop. Click to read about Ivetti's first loan and second loan.

loans.use: To purchase linen and threads for dressmaking, and other articles of clothing

loans.name: One World I Group

texts.en:
Finda is a 28-year-old illiterate single mother of two children, aged 2 and 5 years. She’s currently supporting her two children along with one orphan.

Finda is a widow and is involved in bread-making, a business which she has been in for the past two years. Her challenges have been seriously with the lack of financing. She’s successful in attracting her customers by means of good speech and the use of adequate recipes required for bread-making.

Finda dreams of improving her business to sustain her three children and also to educate them properly.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, baking powder, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: Phin S., 31, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She is a professional decorates handicrafts. Since 1999, she has been using beads and other materials to make flower on woman clothes to earn a living and typically making US$2.5 each day. Decorates dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wears it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and its price is expensive too. Most of the people prefer hand made than machine made. She said she knows how to decorate from her mother and she has started doing that business since she was not married yet. Her husband stays at home helping his wife. Phin S. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase silk and beads to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase silk and beads.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: A. Afi est née en 1954 à Adja au Mono (au Bénin). Mariée à BOTOKOU Sévérin, un revendeur de moutons, Afi est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par les deux conjoints. Afi n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour aider son mari dans les charges de la famille, Afi s'est mise depuis dix ans déjà, à vendre des objets de poterie (canaris, etc.), de même que les plantes de la médecine traditionnelle. Afi fait ses approvisionnements à Cotonou et les vend à cocotomey. Afi est à son premier crédit à ALIDé. Dans le but d'agrandir son activité et de construire plus tard une baraque pour la vente de ses produits, Afi sollicite ce premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Afi was born in 1954 in Adja in Mono (Bénin). Married to BOTOKOU Sévérin, a sheep seller, Afi is the mother of 5 children, some of whom some are enrolled in school. The two spouses share responsibility for supporting the family.

Afi never went to school. In order to help her husband support the family, 10 years ago, Afi began to sell pottery objects (big clay pots called 'canaris', etc.), as well as traditional medicinal plants. Afi stocks up in Cotonou and sells in Cocotomey. She is on her first loan from ALIDé. Wishing to grow her business and later on, build a shed to sell out of, Afi is requesting this first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 30 'canaris', and 8 sacks of leaves and tree bark

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Luz y Esperanza II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando.
Virginia, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de mercadería de ropas, pero como no le fue muy bien y ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por su ella misma y su pareja, emprendió su propio  negocio de venta de bandejas, para lavar ropas. Virginia nos cuenta, que para realizar sus ventas, se levanta muy temprano, para recorrer por diferentes calles y así visita a sus clientes, que ya la conocen. 

Posteriormente, en las quincenas y fin de mes, solo se dedica a cobrar a sus clientes, juntamente con el apoyo de su pareja. Sus ventas le va muy bien y se siente muy orgullosa por el trabajo que realiza, y con su carisma y buena atención que le caracteriza. 
Con el préstamo de S/. 1,300.00, quincenalmente comprará 60 bandejas, en diferentes tamaños y colores, para así satisfacer a sus clientes.

Hoy se siente muy feliz del  servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a mujeres como ella, que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Virginia belongs to the Luz y Esperanza II Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 37, in a common law marriage, and has one dependent child who goes to school. Virginia previously worked selling clothes, but that did not go very well for her. Facing the necessity of contributing economically to the household and motivated by herself and her life partner, she set up her own business selling basins for washing clothes. Virginia tells us that in order to make her sales she gets up very early to travel different streets. She visits her customers; they already know her. Later, midmonth and at the end of the month, she only works at collecting from her customers. She does this with her life partner. Her sales are going very well.
