She is proud of the work she does with her characteristic charisma and good service. She will use this loan for 1,300 PEN to buy basins in different sizes and colors. She will do this every two weeks to satisfy her customers. She now feels happy with the service she offers. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for supporting women like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes they continue doing this for a long time, and that they help lots of enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy quantities of wash basins

loans.name: Arlen Danya

texts.es: La señora Arlen L. García, es casada con un niño de 1 año y medio de edad. La señora Arlen L. se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa usada. Cabe señalarse que ella ya tuvo crédito con nosotros y lo pago bien, ahora está solicitando debido a que desea aprovechar las ventas del mes venidero, ya que la gente usualmente compra ropa y calzado.  Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 6 años, este negocio lo empezó con el que ahora es su compañero de vida, con el que le ha brindado el apoyo  para vender y hacer crecer el negocio. Cabe señalarse, su compañero de vida es Lic. En Computación, el cual aporta a los gastos familiares a través de su trabajo. El crédito será invertido en la compra de una paca de ropa seleccionada, principalmente pantalones azulones. Su meta siempre ha sido establecer un gran negocio de pacas seleccionadas que pueda estar ubicado en el mercado y que pueda vender al por mayor y al detalle, para ganar más y brindar facilidades económicas a su hijo en el futuro.
texts.en:
Arlen L. García is married and has a 1½-year old child. Arlen L. dedicates herself to being a traveling saleswoman of used clothing. It is worth pointing out that she has previously had credit with us, that she repaid in a timely manner. She is now requesting another loan to take advantage of selling for the summer season, given that people usually buy clothes and shoes during this time. She started in this line of work 6 years ago, in partnership with the person who is now her husband. He has provided her with support in selling her product and in growing her business. Her husband is a computer specialist, who supports the family with his income. The loan would be invested into the purchase of select clothing, primarily blue jeans. Her goal has always been to establish a good business in the market, and to be able to sell both at wholesale and retail. This would allow her to increase her earnings, and provide future financial security for her child.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome S. is from the city of Catadman, Ozamiz Ctiy. She is 32 years old, married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Salome owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, soft drinks, junk foods and etc., in the local community. Salome has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Salome joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salome is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Salome from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily D., 41, is striving hard so that she can have her sandal making business be at the same level as it was before.  Her business was badly affected when Typhoon Ketsana struck Metro Manila last September living their home flooded with water.   Married to Angelito D., they are blessed with four children. Together, she and her husband strive hard to manage their business so that their family can have a better life.  They have been selling sandals and slippers for eight years now.

Emily has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow seven times in CCT’s Cooperative.  The reason why she has been consistent in paying her dues is because she has used almost all the money she borrowed to buy raw materials for their sandal making business.  Their business now lets them earn a profit of PHP 5,200 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used as a source of added capital by buying the raw materials needed for the expansion of their business.

Emily hopes that the extra profit that they will gain will let them save money so that they can finance their children's college education someday. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy the raw materials needed for the expansion of their business.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan Francisco J. B. es un agricultor del Municipio de Pueblo Nuevo quien se dedica a la producción de hortalizas como tomates, papas, chiltoma y pepinos, etc.  El solicita un crédito en la agencia de Ceprodel para la asistencia técnica de sus cultivos como es la compra de abonos foliares y fungicidas para obtener un mejor rendimientos en estos.

El Sr. Juan J. se ha dedicado a la agricultura toda su vida y a adquirido mucha experiencia lo que le a ayudado a seguir trabajando en esto y creciendo en la producción. El espera que con el crédito asista bien sus cultivos de chiltoma que tiene y obtener mejores ganancias y de alguna manera mejorar su situación familiar. 

El es casado y no tiene hijos, su esposa es maestra y da clase en una escuela de primaria en la misma comunidad donde ambos viven.

Este es el crédito numero 4 que Don Juan J. solicita en un periodo de de 2 años y dijo  que estos créditos le han ayudado a mejora sus producciones y con las ganancia ha logrado adquirir mas terreno aptos para la producciones agrícolas y así aumentar su negocioy por ende su consiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco J. B. is a farmer in Pueblo Nuevo; he grows tomatoes, potatoes, peppers, cucumbers, etc. He is requesting funding from Ceprodel for technical assistance for his crops in the form of leaf fertilizers and fungicides to improve his crop yields. Juan J. has been a farmer all his life and has much experience, which has helped him to continue to work and to have his production grow. He hopes the funding will help his pepper crops particularly so that his profits will increase and thus his family's standard of living will also increase. He is married and had no children. His wife is a teacher at a local elementary school. This is his 4th loan in a 2-year period and he stated that the loans have helped him improve his crops and the profits have allowed him to buy more farmland in order to enlarge his business and, thus, improve his living condition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers and fungicides.

loans.name: Medius Kankuze's Group

texts.en:
Medius is 51 years old, single, and the mother of five children aged between ten and twenty. All her children go to school. The family owns a five-roomed house where Medius lives with eight people. She also takes care of additional family members. She has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family eats three meals a day. Her biggest monthly expenses are utility bills, school fees, medication and feeding the family.
Medius owns a retail shop selling all types of merchandise. She sells on a retail basis only. She works seven days a week and serves an average of 40 customers a day. She has been in this business for over ten years. Her main challenges are seasonal changes and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place.
Medius has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for three years and is now on her seventh loan. She has always worked with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for her retail shop. She hopes to see her business grow, and start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise such as soap, sugar and salt

loans.name: Maria Goreth

texts.pt:
Maria Gorethi Bassamandla M. nasceu no Distrito da Manhiça, Provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 40 anos de idade, solteira e mae de 3 filhos de 21, 13 e 11 anos de idade, todos vaõ a escola. Fez 10ą classe e 2 anos de formação de Professores. Vive na casa propria com os seus filhos, e sustenta a mae enviando generos alimenticios. 

Saiu de Manhiça Para Boane pela transferencia dos serviços, local onde fixou sua residencia e vive neste Distrito ate agora. Trabalha como docente, é do quadro do Ministerio da Educaçaõ amais de 15 anos. Faz cerca de 8 horas de trabalho diariamente, naõ possui nenhum empregado, aufere um salario de 5.565.00mt por més, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento e areia) para rebocar a sua residencia. Os empréstimos anteries foram de 10.000.00mt os dois, ambos para a mesma actividade.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este emprestimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residencia para oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua familia.
texts.en:
Maria Gorethi Bassamandla M. was born in the Manhiça District, Maputo Province, south of Moçambique. She is 40 years old, she is single and she has three children of ages 21,13 and 11. All her children go to school. She went to school until 10th grade and she did 2 years of teaching school. She owns her home, where she lives together with her children and she supports her mom by sending her food. She left from Manhiça to Boane because she got transferred. Here is where she made her home and where she has lived ever since. She has been working as a teacher and has been part of the Education Ministry for more than 15 years. She works for about 8 hours each day, she does not have any employees, she earns a monthly salary of 5.565.00mt which she uses for her home's expenses and she even gets to save a little bit on her bank account. Maria has never had loans in other banks. She heard about Hluvuku through some co-workers who are also clients of this institution. This is her third loan and she is requesting 12.000.00mt which she intends to use to purchase construction material (cement and sand) to put plaster on her home. The other loans she requested in the past were of 10.000.00mt each, both for these same activity. She promises to pay this loan so that she can access further loans. In the future she would like to be able to request more loans to finish her home and offer her family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcahse construction material

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
Abu Bakarr was born in 1972, and he started school five years later, but his father died when he was in class five.  No family member was willing to continue to support his schooling after the death of his father, so he became a dropout.  

At the age of fifteen, he decided to join his uncle in hawking costume jewelry.  Later a friend who admired his courage decided to consign some goods to him.  After 8 years, he has been able to set up his own small jewelry business.  He is determined to expand his business with this loan if he is successful and to send his 5 children to school

loans.use: To buy jewelry for resale

loans.name: Alioza Marinlyn

texts.es: Alioza tiene 43 años, hace algún tiempo se tuvo que separar del padre de sus 3 hijos ya mayores, y con el menor vive  en la casa de su madre, en un barrio populoso ubicado al sur de la ciudad.Su labor cotidiana es aplicar los bordados de las chompas tejidas que le  provee una  fábrica reconocida. Recoge una vez a la semana  las prendas y  después tiene que bordar en la parte delantera de las chompas, flores o paisajes de la sierra, que son muy solicitados en otros países. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que se mantiene muy ocupada y  es beneficioso, porque le pagan regular  por cada bordado a crochet  y también de acuerdo a los detalles de las agujas, dependiendo de la complejidad y el tiempo empleado. Cuando tiene mucho trabajo su hija la apoya, ya que cuanto más bordados realiza, mayores son sus ganancias. Y de ese modo quiere brindarle una educación  superior a su hija.Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, y  ratifica su compromiso de pagar las cuotas  establecidas oportunamente, porque su deseo es seguir contando con posteriores préstamos que le permitirán continuar  trabajando. Además  en su banco comunal se siente a gusto porque todas las integrantes  son responsables.Con el dinero que solicita, Alioza  comprará lanas de diversos grosores  y colores, para que su trabajo sea de un buen acabado y obtenga cada vez  mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Alioza is 43 years old. She has been separated from the father of her 3 grown children for some time. She lives with her youngest child in her mother's house in a populated neighborhood located south of the city. She works daily doing embroidery on knit sweaters that are produced by a well-known factory. She collects the garments once a week and later applies the embroidery to the front of the sweaters, including flowers or the landscape of the mountains. These sweaters are in high demand in other countries. She likes this work very much, since it keeps her occupied and is profitable because they pay for each embroidered item according to the details of the needles, the complexity and the time spent. When she has a lot of work she supports her daughter, since the more embroidery she does the higher her earnings. In this way she wants to provide a college education for her daughter. This is her 7th loan from MFP, and she affirms that she is committed to making her payments according to the set schedule, because she wants to continue to take out loans that will allow her to continue working. In addition, she likes her communal bank because all of the members are responsible. With the money that she requests Alioza will buy wool of various thicknesses and colors, so that her work will provide a good finish to the product and she will have better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy materials for embroidery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional commodities for her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: M. Joseph is a 42-year-old business man who is married with five children. He operates a retail shop at Kamuwunga Landing site. He mainly sells items like sugar, rice, maize flour, cold drinks and phone credit. He is using the loan to purchase these items for sale. He is a hardworking businessman whose dream is to expand his business and transfer to Lukaya town. He hopes to purchase a plot of land, construct a house in Lukaya town and to live a better life with his family.

loans.use: To purchase stock for sale to meet customer demand

loans.name: Kadidia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadidia Dembélé est âgée de 37 ans, mère d’un  enfant, elle vit dans une famille nucléaire à Fana Guegneka II un des quartiers la ville de Fana, Région de Koulikoro République du Mali.
Kadidia est électricienne à la Société Énergie du Mali. En plus de cette profession, elle exerce le commerce d’habillements et de chaussures depuis maintenant plusieurs années. 
C’est dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires qu’elle décide de collaborer avec l’institution. Elle est à son premier prêt individuel avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des chaussures et des habits à Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente sur place au niveau des entreprises professionnelles et à son domicile, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle compte avoir 100.000FCFA de bénéfice au cours de son cycle de prêt qui servira à couvrir ses dépenses personnelles et payer l’intérêt du prêt.
texts.en:
Ms. Kadidia Dembélé, aged 37, is the mother of one child and lives in a nuclear family in Fana Guegneka II, a district in Fana City, Region of  Koulikoro, Republic of Mali.  She is an electrician at the Société Énergie du Mali (energy company of Mali).  Aside from this profession, she has been operating a business selling clothing and shoes for several years now. In her search for supplemental financial resources, Kadidia decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first individual loan with the institution's loan program.  She intends to use her loan for buying shoes and clothing in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesale merchants.  She sells locally at professional enterprises and out of her home.  Her customer base is composed of women and men.  Kadidia expects to have 100,00 francs CFA of profit over the course of her loan cycle that will be used to meet her personal expenses and to cover the loan interest. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shoes and clothing to sell

loans.name: Rafiqan's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqan, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over twenty-five years. Her husband's name is M. Y.. He is involved in a quilt selling business. His selling is not limited to their area, he also supplies the quilts to different cities such as Islamabad and Lahore and generates income. He has been in this profession for the past fifteen years. He maintains a good reputation amongst his customers because of his good dealing and good quality quilts. 

To share the financial burden with him, a very talented Rafiqan operates a business selling decoration pieces. She specifically sells flower objects, such as flower strips and flower vases, in the gift shops and earns income. She earns approximately PKR5,000 every month, which helps her to pay for the utilities. 

Rafiqan is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s business. He will be able to purchase the quilts in bulk and sell them to more customers and generate a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase quilts in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Loung

texts.en:
Mrs. P. is a 24-year-old married woman and mother. She has been working as a garment laborer for years and earns a suitable salary to help control all her family’s financial problems. She has another financial earner in her husband, who is a construction worker, working around his community, earning $2 each day. This couple helps each other in order to generate money to support their two school-aged kids. 

P. plans to earn extra income by investing in a new business line out of her home. Because she doesn't have capital, Mrs. P. decided to pursue a loan to buy piglets to raise in a stall she has already established behind her house.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Mambo from Kenya!

Anthony is a dairy and tea farmer living in western Kenya.  He's 31, and has been farming for 4 years.  He sells his milk at the market, and his tea leaves to the local factory.  In the future, he hopes to purchase higher quality dairy cows and increase his production of milk to 50 liters per day.  He also hopes to build a high quality structure to house his dairy cows.  

He cites a few business challenges: the lack of good roads to the market, and poor prices that fluctuate often.  

Anthony has 3 children between 7 and 24.  He says this loan will help him pay for family needs.  He thanks Juhudi for providing access to this loan, and assures us he will repay well so as to have access to additional loans in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucia de 41 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas en disolución), ella tiene una papelería-ferretería (local donde venden no solo papelería, sino herramientas, artículos, para la mejora de una casa). 

Para que Lucia pueda mantener su casa tuvo que comprar papelería para vender a sus conocidos y vecinos del sector, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo surtir su negocio con artículos de ferretería, vende papelería, chapas de puerta, goma, pinturas etc. 

Para incrementar mas los artículos de venta de su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos. En el futuro quiere ampliar el local para poder exhibir mejor sus artículos.
texts.en:
Lucia is 41 years old and lives in “Fortín de Guayaquil” a suburban area with dirt roads and eroding hills). She has a paper goods-hardware store (where she sells not only paper goods, but also hardware, and home improvement items). In order to maintain her home, Lucia had to buy the paper goods store so that she could sell to her neighbors and acquaintances in the sector. Little by little, and with some effort, she was able to diversify her business with hardware. She sells paper goods, door knobs, glue, paint, etc. She wants to buy notebooks with the money from this loan, in order to increase her inventory. In future she would like to expand her shop so that she can display more items.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en: Thoa T. K. T. is 53 years old. She is alone. She has broken her leg. She has a beverage store and her main income is profits from sales. She has an income of about 2,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2004 and has always repaid punctually. She wants to borrow money form SEDA forever because, then, she can keep saving money. In her last cycle, she borrowed 7,630,000 VND and has completely repaid this amound. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,930,000 VND to expand her store.

loans.use: to expand her store

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Guadalupe H. S. tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con su hija, por las mañanas doña Guadalupe se levanta muy temprano para preparar las golosinas y venderlas a los vecinos de su residencia,  tiene 5 años de realizar este tipo de actividad y en las tardes se prepara para salir a vender la ropa en las aldeas y colonias aledañas a San Lorenzo, es una persona que trabaja mucho para sacar adelante
a su familia.
 
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en mas mercaderia para lograr obtener mayores ganancias.
 
su mayor sueño es ver graduada a su hija de la universidad.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe H. S. is 58 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her daughter. Each morning Guadalupe rises very early to prepare her sweets to sell to her neighbors. She’s been doing this for five years and in the evenings she goes out to sell clothing in the villages and areas surrounding San Lorenzo. She is a person who works hard to move her family ahead. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in more merchandise so that she can generate more income. Her greatest dream is to see her daughter graduate from university.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es: Casilda, de 33 años de edad, convive con su pareja y juntos tienen tres hijos en etapa escolar. Residen en la ceja de la selva peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tiene su propia casa. A Casilda siempre le ha gustado escuchar las orientaciones que recibía por parte de su familia, ya que con ello empezó a practicarla en la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo y comercialización de café y cacao. Recuerda que se inició cultivando café, pero al poco tiempo notó que su producto tenía mucha demanda, desde luego que siguió con esta actividad, pero con el pasar de los años decidió introducir un nuevo producto agrícola, que es el cacao, con la finalidad de que pueda captar más clientes. Hoy su negocio agrícola, como fuente principal, está dando buenos frutos económicos, además viene tomando un buen posicionamiento sólido en su localidad, ya que el producto que ofrece es de calidad total, es mas sus compradores potenciales se van satisfechos con los  productos que los ofrece, no contento con ello, hace poco abrió su pequeña tienda en donde vende bebidas para sus comensales. Generalmente trabaja con su pareja y juntos hacen un buen equipo de trabajo, pero en temporada de cosecha tienen a cargo de sus peones, para que de esa manera le puedan facilitar la extracción de su producto final. Usualmente su productos lo vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad y su rutina diaria  es a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su negocio de bebida, introduciendo nuevos productos básicos para el hogar familiar. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando durante las fechas establecidas, además con su grupo comunal, le esta yendo de la mejor manera. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos, con el propósito de que le dé un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Casilda is 33 years old and lives with her partner and they have three children of school age. They live in the brow of the Peruvian jungle located in Quimbiri where she has her own home. Casilda has always enjoyed listening to advice from her family and through them she began agriculture, specifically cultivating and selling coffee and cocoa. She remembers starting with coffee crops but in a short time she noticed that her product had a lot of demand and she continued her job but as the years passed, she decided to introduce a new crop, cocoa, so that she can have more customers. Today her agricultural business is her main source of income and it gives her very good revenue, she has a good status in her area since her products are of very high quality and her potential customers are satisfied with the products that she offers. A little while ago she opened a small store where she sells beverages for her compatriots. Casilda usually works with her partner and they make a good working team but during harvest season the farmhands are in charge so they help extract the final product. The crops are usually sold in areas where people gather. Her daily routine is to leave at 7:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening. Her plans for the future are to expand her beverage business by introducing new products like basic household goods. This is Casilda's second loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and she is committed to pay the quotas during the established time periods as she enjoys her communal group. With the loan, Casilda plans to buy merchandize and manure so that she can give the proper care to her cocoa and coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandize and manure to take care of the cocoa and coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, meat, cooking oil, tomatoes, salt, seasonings, etc.

loans.name: Amigos (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudadela Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amigos.
Este es un grupo de personas que se han propuesto salir adelante, por lo que decidieron unirse aprovechando que se llevan muy bien. Ellas se dedican a diferentes actividades, (comercio, ventas, producción y  servicios,).

La señora Felisa tiene 48 años y espera que todo le salga bien para estar con el Banco Comunal por muchos ciclos mas, le ha gustado por que en ningún otro lado dan los créditos sin tantos requisitos como  lo hace la Fundación Espoir, y por las facilidades de pagos.
Ella mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 32 años, de esta relación procreo 6 hijos todos mayores de edad. Nació en Calceta donde creció junto a sus padres y hace 8 años se vino a vivir a Portoviejo junto a su esposo e hijos.

Ella y su marido tienen una tienda de víveres de consumo, también venden empanadas y bolos que ella fabrica, su negocio esta frente a un colegio y los estudiantes compran mucho de sus productos, también sus vecinos compran los víveres para su consumo diario. Trabajan  todos los días desde la madrugada ya que tienen que ir al mercado a comprar verduras y otros productos frescos para la venta y cierran su negocio en la noche, los productos para su tienda los compran en Portoviejo al por mayor y esto le deja muy buenas ganancias.

Este crédito lo van a emplear en aumentar más su negocio, para comprar más productos.
 
Sus sueños son comprar un terreno y construir una casa para traer a su mama a vivir con ella.
texts.en:
The Amigos communal bank meets every two weeks in the Eloy Alfaro citadel, within the city of Portoviejo, the Manabita capital, known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarinds.

This group of people, who are determined to get ahead, decided to band together because they get along well with one another.  They each have different trades (merchant, sales, production, services).

Felisa is 48 years old and hopes that all will turn out well for her so that she can stay with the communal bank through many more cycles.  She likes it because other sources have many more requirements for loans than Fundación Espoir and they do not offer the easy terms of payment.

She is 48 years old and has been in the same relationship for the past 32 years.  They have six adult children.  She was born and raised in Calceta and moved to Portoviejo eight years ago.

She and her husband have a pantry store and also sell empanadas and rolls that she makes.  Their business is located across from a school and the students buy many of her products.  The neighbors also buy their daily groceries there.  They work every day starting at dawn, because they have to go to the market to buy vegetables and other fresh products to sell.  They close their business at night.  They buy their products in bulk in Portoviejo and this generates good profits for them. 

They will use the money from this loan to buy more products so that they can grow their business.  Their dream is to buy some land on which to build a house and to bring Felisa’s mother to live with them.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. He has been farming for the last five years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces milk, maize and vegetables, which he sells locally. He is 37 years old and married with four children who are between the ages of 1 and 13. Two of the children are currently attending school.

Charles has requested this loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to start poultry farming. He says the extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children and improve the livelihood of his family. 

His primary challenges are lack of enough animal feeds and diseases.

loans.use: To start poultry farming

loans.name: Aurora Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Aurora porque la persona que inicio el grupo y reunió a las integrantes es la Sra. Aurora, está ubicado en el Estado de Morelos México el grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes.La Sra. Aurora es integrante del grupo tiene 55 años estudio hasta el 6º   año de primaria,  es repostera  y tiene un total 4 hijos,  2 mujeres y 2 varones. Ella se dedica a la venta de pasteles y gelatinas negocio que inicio hace 20 años, solicita el préstamo para surtir su negocio, al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente feliz de la posibilidad de tener más mercancía, ya que su tienda es pequeña, también espera que con las ganancias, pueda remodelar su casa porque le hace falta pintura y acabados.
texts.en: This group is called "Aurora," because the person who started up the group and gathered together the members is Aurora.  The group is located in the state of Morelos, Mexico, and has 12 members.  The member Aurora is 55 years old and completed her education through the 6th year of elementary school. She has a total of 4 children: 2 girls and 2 boys. She is a pastry chef, and works in a business selling cakes and gelatins that she started 20 years ago.  She requests a loan to buy supplies for her business.  At the time she applied for this loan, she felt happy about the possibility of having more merchandise, since her store is small.  In addition, she hopes that with the earnings she can renovate her house, because it lacks paint and other finishing touches.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren A. is a 48-year-old woman who lives with her husband and four children in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. Her oldest son works for the security agency, her second oldest son is a plumber, and her youngest son is disabled and studies at a special school. Her daughter works as a server in a cafe.

Byambasuren operates a small food shop next to the local school. She started her food-trading business in 2003 and has gained significant experience since then. For the future, she plans to buy a plot of land where she can build a house for her family and operate her shop next to her home. Byambasuren is a modest person; she says, "I am planning to start building a wooden house." She is requesting a loan of 400,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase more food products to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Centro Apaxco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama CENTRO APAXCO porque a si se llama el lugar de donde son originarios sus integrantes, esta ubicado en el Estado de México,  el grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Celina Rodríguez es integrante del grupo tiene 63 años de edad, estudió hasta la primaria, su ocupación es comerciante venta de abarrotes, su negocio lo inició hace aproximadamente 21 años y solicita el préstamo para surtir mercancía  y poder darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella está muy contenta con su crédito porque así podrá lograr todos sus proyectos ya planeados y comprar una recámara. Además está trabajando para asegurar su futuro, pues a su edad ya no la contratan en casi ningún lugar y ella quiere conservar su negocio para su vejez.
Observaciones: las señoras se encuentran en el siguiente orden viendo la foto de derecha a izquierda:
1.- Gudelia V. C..
2.- Celina R. P..
3.- Claudia H. P..
4.- Maria Teresa A. Gudiño.
5.- Yazmin Cortes P..
6.. Ma Luz A. R..
7.- Maria Guadalupe M. C..
8.- Mariluz M. M..
9.- Ana Maria H. C..
10.- Ma Guadalupe A. R..
11.- Tomasa Evelina C. Montoy.
12.- Angela Zuñiga M..
texts.en:
This group is called Centro Apaxco because all of the members are from the town of Apaxco, which is in the state of Mexico. The group is made up of nine members. 

One member, Celina R., is 63 years old and has a primary school education. Her business is grocery sales and she has been in business for approximately 21 years. She is seeking a loan to stock up on merchandise and offer better service to her customers. She is happy about the loan because it will enable her to finish the projects she has already planned and buy bedroom furniture. She is also working to provide security for her future. At her age, it is impossible to find employment, so she wants to keep running the business to provide for her old age.
 
In the photo, the members of Centro Apaxco appear in the following order from right to left:

1.- Gudelia V. C..
2.- Celina R. P..
3.- Claudia H. P..
4.- Maria Teresa A. Gudiño.
5.- Yazmin Cortes P..
6.. Ma Luz A. R..
7.- Maria Guadalupe M. C..
8.- Mariluz M. M..
9.- Ana Maria H. C..
10.- Ma Guadalupe A. R..
11.- Tomasa Evelina C. Montoy.
12.- Angela Zuñiga M..

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 52 años, vive con su esposo  y su hija en su casa propia. Desde hace 1 año vende pollos, que ella misma cría, pues cuenta con una granja dentro de un terreno cerca de su casa. Periódicamente vende estos animales en las ferias y las ganancias son administradas por un familiar de confianza, por lo que se ha convertido en su socio. Con el tiempo la venta de pollos ha ido en aumento, ya que tiene mucho cuidado en la crianza. En  adelante desea ampliar su granja e intensificarse en la crianza de éstos animales. Es el crédito número 14 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en mejorar la infraestructura de su granja.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 52, lives with her husband and her daughter in her own house.  For one year she has been selling chickens that she raises.  She has a farm on a piece of land close to her house.  She periodically sells these animals at the fairs.  Her earnings are managed by a trustworthy relative, who has become her partner.

With time the chicken sales have been increasing because she takes great care in taking care of the chickens.  Later, she wishes to expand her farm and increase the breeding of these animals.

This is her 14th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  Also, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  She is grateful to all of the people who will be the lenders of the loan she is requesting.  It will be very useful to the progress of her business.  She will use the loan she is requesting to improve the infrastructure of her farm.

loans.use: To buy materials to restore the infrastructure of her farm

loans.name: Lucina

texts.es: Lucina G. R. de 51 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Panchimalco, en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella vive junto a su esposo y dos hijas mayores de edad, una de las cuales le ayuda con  el negocio. Lucina posee una tortillería desde hace 10 años, en el cual ha trabajado arduamente por el bienestar de sus hijas, así mismo posee una tienda y una pupusería, negocio de mucha importancia para ella ya que son estos los que le permiten contar con todo lo necesario para vivir.  Lucina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda compra maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas y pupusas, así mismo queso chicharrón y frijoles,  esto debido a que cuenta con muy buena clientela, y ella desea poder atender a más clientes, puesto que en muchas ocasiones por falta de masa no ha podido atender a mas personas, es por ello que solicita el préstamo el cual le permita comprar más materia prima y así vender más y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Lucina G. R. is 51 years old, and lives in Panchimalco, in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and two older children, one of whom helps with the business. Lucina has had a tortilla store for 10 years, and she has worked hard for the well-being of her daughters. She also has a store and a café. The businesses are very important to her because they allow her to have everything she needs to live. Lucina requests a loan so that she can buy corn to make tortillas and maize dumplings, as well as cheese, pork crackling, and beans. She has a good clientele and wants to be able to have more clients. Many times she cannot take on more clients because the she lacks dough. Because of this, she is requesting this loan so that she can buy more raw materials, sell more, and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, pork cracking, and other products

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María es una pequeña  comerciante  venta de frutas y verduras que ha crecido gracias a su tenacidad y apoyo de la institución tiene quince años de haber establecido su negocio, iniciando con pequeñas compras de mercadería, hoy en día con AFODENIC sus niveles de venta aumentaron al ofrecer más variedad en sus productos.
También los fines de semana hace ricas sopas el cual vende en su casa de habitación. Con este nuevo crédito comprara verduras y un caballo que ayude al acarreo de las compras como de las ventas ambulantes que falta le hace.
 Este sería su segundo caballo el que ayude a facilitar el acarreo de las compra de frutas y verduras espera comprar más cantidad para comprar a un precio accesible ya que están caras y el cliente compra menos lo que espera mejorar para captar nuevamente su clientela.
texts.en:
María is a small businesswoman who sells fruit and vegetables.  Her business has grown thanks to her tenacity and the support of AFODENIC.  She has been in her business for fifteen years.  She started out buying small amounts of merchandise.  Now, with the help of AFODENIC, her sales levels have increased and she offers a greater variety of products.  On weekends, María also makes rich soups which she sells from her home.  

María will use this loan to buy vegetables and a horse which will help her carry her purchases and the products that she sells as an itinerant street vendor.  This will be her second horse to help her carry her fruit and vegetables.  She hopes to buy a larger quantity of products so that she can buy at an affordable price since they are expensive and she can't buy much.  She hopes to improve this situation so that she can re-attract customers.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables as well as a horse which will help her carry her purchases and the products she sells

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna E. was born in 1977. She lives in Koti village, Ijevan area. Ruzanna is married and has 3 children, who are already going to school. 

Ruzanna and her husband are engaged in animal breeding and land cultivation. On their farm they breed cows, pigs, turkeys and chickens. They grow wheat and potato plants as well. Thanks to their occupation, they support their family and also bought a truck, which they use to transfer fodder to their farm, to transport cows to mountains in summer months, and to bring firewood to their home. 

Ruzanna asks for an 800,000 AMD loan to buy some calves and a sow, which will allow Ruzanna to develop her farm and to increase her family’s income in the future.

loans.use: To buy some calves and a sow for her farm

loans.name: Nhim

texts.en:
The man appearing in the picture above, Nhim S., age 30, resides in a village located near Phnom Penh city. He currently owns a truck that he uses to provide transport service for a fee. He has a partner in his wife who stays at home to do housework. The couple married a few years ago, but they do not have a child yet. 

From the business, Nhim S. is able to generate an average of US$ 10 per day to cover family expenses. Recently, his truck has often broken down and his income has also been affected. That why Nhim S. is applying for a loan to be used to mend his broken-down truck.

loans.use: To mend his broken-down truck

loans.name: Hussein

texts.ar: حسين في عمر 25 سنة اعزب يعمل في محل لبيع الالعاب والادوات المنزلية كريستال وغيره يحب عمله وله فيه نحو 5 سنوات يحب عمله ويسعى الى تطويره بشكل دائم طموح ويحب ان يؤمن مستقبل جيد له ولعائلته التي تدعمه دائما يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى زيادة البضائع في محله حيث انه يبيع الالعاب والخرضوات والأدوات المنزلية يتميز عمله بالانفراد في قريته حيث له زبائن من جيرانه ومحيطه
texts.en: Hussein is 25 years old and unmarried. He works in a shop selling toys, household appliances, crystal ware and other such items. He loves his work and has been doing it for 5 years. He is ambitious about its development. He wants to secure a good future for himself and his family, who are always supportive of him. With this loan he wants to buy more inventory for his shop where he sells toys, household appliances and groceries. His is the only such shop in his village and he has customers from his neighbors and those around him.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory for his shop

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: Loice is currently in a business of selling beer, onions and tomatoes. She is 39 years old, married to a soldier, with four children and all of them go to school. Loice borrowed a loan to stock more beer, onions and tomatoes to sell. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more beer, onions and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Diogene

texts.en:
Diogene is 30 years old. He has two children who are two months and five years old.The elder child goes to school while the young one hasn't begun school yet.

Diogene sells second-hand bags and it's a year now since he began selling these bags. He is requesting a loan to buy more bags for sale and with the profits he plans build a house.

loans.use: to purchase used bags for resale.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo S. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. He is 46 years old. Romeo is married and has nine school-aged children. 

To make a living, Romeo sells bananas and coconuts for copras (dried coconut meat used in oil production). Romeo has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Romeo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Romeo is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts and bananas. This will be the first loan taken out by Romeo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and bananas

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona , 50 years old, is currently in business of selling food. The loan will pay to stock more food. Married to a businessman, she has four children who all go to school. Her future goal is to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to stock more food.

loans.name: Samhart

texts.en:
Miss. Samhart S. (pictured here), 23, is single. She lives with her sister and parents approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Samhart is a fast food seller. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her sister to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her sister to drive to work.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Vanessa works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Vanessa is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional sidecar for her motorcycle transport business.

Vanessa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sidecar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in construction supplies to finish building his home which is already at an advanced stage

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
La señora Pabla ya ha tenido un crédito con KIVA el cual pago puntualmente y lo utilizo para invertir en el negocio de papelería.
       Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía de cuadernos, lápiz, plumas, colores y varios artículos escolares, una copiadora más grande. Ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario para la invertir en el negocio. 
Con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas de negocio de papelería escolar  pagar el crédito, con la  pensión gubernamental que recibe será para los gastos familiares y gastos de sus tres hijos que tiene ya que es viuda.  
Desea invertir en el negocio y tener la mercancía antes de que empiece el ciclo escolar y así sus clientes podrán encontrar en su tienda los útiles escolares que les pidan a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pabla has already had a loan with KIVA which she paid off on time. She used it to invest in her paper store business. 

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy merchandise such as notebooks, pencils, pens, crayons and various school items as well as a bigger copier.         She doesn't have the capital she needs on her own to invest in her business. With the earnings she obtains from the sales in her school supplies business she will pay off the loan. The government pension she receives will be for family expenses and the expenses she has for her three children, since she is a widow.
  
She wants to invest in the business and have the merchandise before the school year starts. IN this way, her customers will find the school supplies their children need in her store.

loans.use: to invest in buying merchandise.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married with two school-age children. She is 29 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Emma is a farmer. She plants and harvests pineapples to earn a living. She sells pineapples in the local open market. She has been doing this for two years. Twice a year, she earns approximately PHP 48,000 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase crown, a planting material for pineapples.

Emma has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Emma hopes to purchase a hectare of land to be used in pineapple production.

loans.use: To purchase planting material for pineapples.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira is married with children. She owns a business in the central market of Gafurov region where she sells fabrics for sewing national women's dresses. Shoira has been in this trade for about eight years. Her business has seen considerable growth since she modernized her vending facility using loans from IMON International. Shoira has been partnering with our organization for about eight years. Shoira is requesting a loan of 13,000 TJS to increase her assortment of inventory and boost her sales. She is ready to continue working hard to see her business grow and thrive. Her ultimate goal is to provide a better life for her family. She also plans to invest part of her profit in doing some basic remodeling of her apartment. She did not have any problems with previous loan repayments. We hope the current loan will also be repaid without any delinquencies, and we are excited to promote the further expansion of Shoira's enterprise. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; este banco comunal pertenece al Distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia Carmen;  tiene 50 años D. edad y es casada la socia tiene 3 hijos D. 22, 15, 11; la socia se dedica  ala administarcion y atencion D. su tienda D. abarrotes, la soca tambien tiene un garaje que alquila , ella no tiene automovil y este espacio lo alquila a terceros para que D. este modo sea un ingreso extra ara ella, la soica desea invertir el credito en la compra D. mercaderia, ella desea compra al por mayor, arroz, azucar, fideos, harinas, leche en cajas entre otros. La  socia requiweree el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. productos D. primera necesidad como arroz, azucar entre otros.

La socia agradece y valora el prestamo que se le otorgara para poder mejorar sus calidad D. vida y la D. sus familia.
texts.en:
Carmen, 50, is a member of the “Illary III” communal bank that belongs to Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is married and has three children who are 22, 15 and 11 years old.  She runs a grocery store and she also has a garage that she leases out.  She does not own a car so she leases the space out to third persons to earn extra income for herself.  

She wants to use the loan to buy merchandise at wholesale: rice, sugar, noodles, flour, boxed milk, etc.  She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of basic need items like rice and sugar, among others.

She is grateful for and values the loan she’ll get to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman with five children; three have graduated from school, while two still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop selling to her neighbors and passers-by. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop and slaughter house in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase goats for slaughter for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for slaughter for resale

loans.name: Jean Christophe

texts.fr:
Jean Christophe est né au Rwanda, il a 35ans. Il est marié et il a 3 enfants de 2 à 5 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Il a fait 6 ans des études secondaires.
 
Jean Christophe est propriétaire de restaurant et il fait aussi un petit commerce de quincaillerie. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter les matériels pour renouveler son restaurant (ciments, tube 30/30, tôles métallique et payer la main d’œuvre).
 
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est minimiser le prix. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Christophe voudrait renforcer son business de quincaillerie et  être le distributeur des matériels de construction. Avec les profits il voudrait améliorer le bien être de sa famille et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Christophe was born in Rwanda. He is married and has three children, from 2 to 5 years old. Four of the children are in school. He completed 6 years of secondary school.   

Jean Christophe runs a restaurant and also sells hardware store products. This loan cycle is his first one with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy supplies (cement, 30/30 tubes, sheet metal) for renovating his restaurant and for covering the cost of labor. His strategy for the growth of his business is to minimize prices. 

In the next few years, Jean Christophe would like to be a major merchant in his region and to be the distributor of construction supplies. With the profits, he would like to improve the well-being of his family and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies (cement, 30/30 tubes, sheet metal) and to pay for labor

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a business man aged 61. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last 25 years, he has been doing farming to earn a living. In the next 5 years, he wants to be the supplier of fruits in his region. His dream is to buy a piece of land and use it for farming. He is requesting for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy cows and manure. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business with his previous loans.

loans.use: To buy cows and manure

loans.name: Aurelio Angel

texts.es:
Aurelio es un señor de 63 años de edad, el cual vive con su familia, en la comunidad de Canalette, en la región de Upala, San Carlos en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta provincia ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas, una de las principales zonas ganaderas del país especialmente a través de la producción del cantón de San Carlos. Además en la provincia se asientan las plantas procesadoras de leche de la Cooperativa de Productores de Leche Dos Pinos, propiedad de miles de productores de leche. Además en la zona alrededor de la ciudad de Alajuela se ha asentado gran cantidad de empresas manufactureras de exportación. En Alajuela operan las zonas francas de El Coyol, Saret, Montecillos y Bet. 

Desde hace varios años que Aurelio se dedica a la porcicultura, para continuar su negocio, le hace falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados.  El proyecto le es muy interesante.

Actualmente Aurelio está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢600.000 (seiscientos mil colones) para  darle mantenimiento a su chanchera y comprar engorde de cerdos. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio, ya que su meta es poder continuar con su trabajo donde pueda mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Aurelio es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Canalette, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su cuarto préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Aurelio, 63, lives with his family in the Canalette Community in the region of Upala, San Carlos in the province of Alajuela.  This province is the top national producer of coffee and cane sugar.  It also produces basic grains (rice, beans, corn), fruit, vegetables and tubers.  And, it is one of the main livestock farming areas of the country, especially the San Carlos Canton.  The province also has many dairy plants belonging to the Dos Pinos Dairy Producers Co-op which owns thousands of manufacturers.  Around the city of Alajuela there are many export companies.  In Alajuela the free ports of El Coyol, Saret, Montecillos and Bet are in operation.

For several years Aurelio has been involved in raising pigs.  In order to continue his business he needs the basics for it to take off and benefit the neighbors of the community.  The project is very interesting.

Aurelio is currently requesting a micro-loan in the amount of 600,000 CRC to maintain his pig farm and buy pigs.  With this loan he hopes to be able to expand his business, continue working and improve his family's lifestyle.

Aurelio is a member of the communal bank Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Canalette.  It is one of the 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  This will be his fourth loan which he hopes will help both him both personally and economically.  He is an active member of the communal bank.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Josephine A's Group

texts.fr:
Mariée, Joséphine est mère de 4 enfants, tous scolarisés. 
Joséphine est une commerçante, elle vend des sacs de charbons qu'elle distribue dans les quartiers de sa zone de résidence à ceux qui en besoin; ce qui lui facilite l'écoulement. Elle fait surtout des ventes en gros, aux semi-gros et détaillants qui vont revendre pour y gagner un peu. Ses achats se font auprès des fournisseurs qui ont reçu l'agrément de commercialiser des produits forestiers. Joséphine s'est associée à Pulchérie pour obtenir son premier crédit à FINADEV afin d'augmenter son stock de provisions en vu d'une meilleure satisfaction des attentes de sa clientèle. Elle estime que le bénéfice généré par ce concours financier lui permettra d'améliorer sa participation aux charges du ménage et les conditions de vie de sa famille. 
Son plus grand projet est d'avoir sa propre maison et de soutenir ses enfants à faire les études supérieures.
texts.en:
Joséphine is married and the mother of four children, all enrolled in school. She sells sacks of charcoal that she distributes in the neighborhoods of her area to those who need it; this makes her sales easier. She especially sells wholesale, and to other retailers who resell it to make a little. Her purchases are made from suppliers who have a legal permit to sell such forest-derived goods. 

Joséphine joined Pulchérie to obtain her first loan from FINADEV in order to grow her inventory and better satisfy the expectations of her clientele. She expects that the income she generates with the help of this loan will permit her to contribute more to supporting her household and improving living conditions for her family. 

Her greatest dream is to have her own house and to be able to support her children while they attend institutions of higher learning.

loans.use: to buy 50 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Solia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huayoccari en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Solia; La socia tiene 30 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 10, 9, 5 años de edad; la socia trabaja con el comercio minorista de verduras, la socia es muy trabajadora, ella viaja llevando las verduras que producen sus terrenos y las que compra a sus vecinos al por mayor a uno de los mercados en la ciudad del Cusco y los reparte a todos sus clientes para que le cancelen en dos partes o algunos en una sola parte, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de abono para la tierra, ella producirá maíz y requiere comprar abono para fertilizar sus terrenos, una vez estos le produzcan maíz en choclo ella los venderá en la ciudad de Arequipa y de Juliaca que son los que le pagan mejor. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de abono para fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo de maíz.



La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Solia, 30, belongs to the “Virgen del Carmen” communal bank located in Huayoccari District in Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.  She’s married and has three children who are 10, 9 and 5 years old.  

She is a vegetable retailer.  She is very hardworking.  She takes the vegetables grown in her fields and that she buys from her neighbors at wholesale to one of the markets in the city of Cusco distribute to her customers who pay her in two payments or some of them in one payment.  She needs to invest the loan in the purchase of manure for her land.  

She will grow corn and needs to fertilize the land.  Once corn is produced on the cobs she’ll sell it in the cities of Arequipa and Juliaca which is where they pay the best prices.  She is asking for the loan to buy manure to fertilize her corn crops.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments according to the payment plan.

loans.use: to buy manure for her corn crops.

loans.name: Rangua

texts.en:
Rangua is 28 years old married to Yiasi and together they are blessed with three school-going children. Rangua operates a motorcycle business and also an Agrovet (animal care) business at Kajiando. He has been in this business for the last four years and gets an income of KES.10,000 per month.

He was introduced to KADET  LTD by KADET staff. He has a good credit history and is applying for his second loan of KES.60,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use KES.40,000 to expand the motocycle business, and the next KES.20,000 to expand his Agrovet and phone charging businesses. He will use the anticipated profit to open another Agrovet outlet at Bissil.

Rangua hopes to become the best transport provider along the Kajiando to Bissil road. He is very hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: To expand his motorcycle business as well as his Agrovet (animal care) and phone charging businesses.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is married and 29 years of age. She is very supportive and sews clothes to financially support her family. 

She is very good in her work and receives regular orders every month. The income she earns helps to pay her utility bills and other daily expenses. 

She is the mother of a son and a daughter. Neither of them has yet to start his/her education due to financial constraints.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her brother-in-law’s business of selling cigarettes, betel leaves and cold drinks etc. With the loan, he will buy cold drinks, cigarettes and betel leaves in large quantities that will allow him to sell in larger quantities and increase his profits. He started his business 4 years ago and he is confident that after the loan investment he will be able to upgrade his business.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Farzana.

loans.use: To buy cold drinks, betel leaves and cigarettes to sell.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is 27 years and married to his wife Mwanakombo. They are blessed with two girls who both attend school. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.

For the past seven years, Omar has operated a fish selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the months of June and July.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), he wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Tulimubumwi Mbumbai Womens Group

texts.en: Joy, a 58 year old woman is married and has 6 children living in Bundibugyo,Uganda. She owns a fresh food retail shop in Bundibugyo town.She has some challenges which are hindering her business to grow, such as inadequate capital for expansion,inflation and high transport costs. Her major goal is to educate her children and to move her business to a more permanent location. Joy needs a loan to buy tomatoes,oranges,cabbages and carrots.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes,oranges,cabbages and carrots

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is a 50-year-old married mother with five children, four of whom are dependents working on her plantation. She is a farmer in a flat area of the Ponhea Krek district, where crop farming is common. She supplements her income by growing cassava. Mom has been in this business for 30 years. With her current business, she earns around 30 U.S. dollars per day and can save less than 5 U.S. dollars per day. 

Having been with VisionFund since 2010, Mom has regular income and now is applying for her second loan with VisionFund. She wants to buy cassava seedlings for her plantation. With this loan, she hopes to increase her yield of cassava so as to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Romina

texts.es: Romina, de 24 años es una joven trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su mamá Norma, su papá Oscar y sus 3 hermanos a los que quiere mucho, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Tambo. Ella es una joven ejemplar, pues realiza varias actividades durante el día. Por las mañanas trabaja en una botica, donde atiende a personas con algún malestar. Eso lo realiza de lunes a viernes, que son días de mucha saturación, pues a medio día aprovecha la buena ubicación que tiene frente a una escuela, para vender los ricos anticuchos a base de carne de pollo y corazón de oveja; que solo ella lo sabe realizar. Pero como aún estudia la carrera de enfermería por las noches, tiene que solventar algunos gastos de sus estudios y los de su familia. Por ello también se dedica al trasporte público, como taxista. Esta actividad lo realizan los fines de semana, ahí según cuenta obtiene buenas ganancias. Además es una de las pocas mujeres que lo realiza.  Su próximo objetivo es estudiar la carrera de psicología y es optimista en conseguirlo. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, y se siente contenta por ello, pues aprendió el valor de la responsabilidad, eso lo demuestra con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Romina, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de los trámites para obtener su licencia de conducir, además pronto sacará su título de enfermera; para ello también necesitará un poco de dinero.
texts.en:
Romina, 24, is a young, hard-working woman. She lives in the company of her mother, Norma; her father, Oscar; and her three brothers, who she loves very much. They live in their own house in the locality of Tambo. Romina is an exemplary young woman who performs various jobs each day. In the morning, she works in a drugstore where she tends to people with different ailments. She does this from Monday to Friday, which are very busy days since at midday she takes advantage of her good location in front of a school to sell delicious kebabs of chicken or lamb's heart, which only she knows how to make.

Since she is still studying nursing at night, Romina has to cover expenses for her studies and some for her family. For this reason, she provides transportation to the public, as a taxi driver. She does this job on weekends and earns good money doing so. She is also one of the few women who does this type of work. Her next goal is to study psychology and she is optimistic that she will achieve it.

This is Romina's second loan through Microfinanzas Prisma and she feels happy about it because it has taught her the value of responsibility, which she has demonstrated with her punctual loan repayments. When Romina receives this loan she will use the requested money to pay for the paperwork to obtain her driver's license. She will also get her nursing license soon and she will need some money for that too.

loans.use: to pay for the paperwork to obtain her driver's license and nursing license

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is 31 years old and lives in Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is married and has one child.  Gia has a pig business and sells pigs for a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

She has requested a loan of PHP14,500 to purchase more pigs to sell.  Gia has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Gia hopes to have capital savings in her business in order to take care of their daily needs and for the future of her child.  Gia is a hardworking mother and an honest person.  Gia is a MIGS member of PMPC.  She has a happy family and takes good care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to sell

loans.name: Alfonso Policarpio

texts.es:
El Señor Alfonso tiene 66 años de edad, pero el nos comenta que es un joven de 21años por el espiritu y las ganas que el le pone cada dia para salir adelnate, está divorciado desde hace ya 5 años, vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad por su población de origen afroperuano, por sus danzas y por su exquisita comida así como también es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, en esta ciudad vive Alfonso.
 
Alfonso se dedica actualmente a su oficio de albañil desde hace ya quince años, además no solo se dedica a ello sino también repara instalaciones eléctricas, realiza instalaciones sanitarias, es como llamamos en Perú una persona mil oficios, el cree que le va bien en su negocio gracias a su responsabilidad y buena labor que realiza en cada uno de sus trabajos, así como también es cumplido en los plazos  de entrega de sus trabajos y por ello sus clientes lo recomiendan y aprecian mucho su labor.

Alfonso esta mas que agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo el podrá comprar herramientas para su trabajo, ya que actualmente el tienen que alquilar sus herramientas, o pedir prestado a algún vecino de su barrio, con esta mejora tendrá herramientas podrías y ya no tendría que alquilar o pedir prestado las herramientas y con ello tendría más ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida, para así en algunos meses lograr su más grande sueño:” Crecer como microempresario”
texts.en:
Alfonso is 66 years old but he comments that he feels like a 21-year-old because of his spirit and the effort he puts into getting ahead every day.  He’s been divorced for five years now and lives in the city of Chincha, a city with an Afro-Peruvian population known for its dances and its delicious cuisine; it’s also the birthplace of some great stars of Peruvian sports.  This is the city were Alfonso lives.

Alfonso has been working as a bricklayer for fifteen years but he also works repairing electrical installations and installs sanitary facilities. He is what we call in Perú: “una persona mil oficios” [man of a thousand jobs].  He believes that he does well in his business thanks to the responsibility and good work he does in each of his jobs as well as because he delivers his jobs on time so customers recommend him and appreciate his work very much.

Alfonso is more than grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their great help he will be able to buy tools for his work since he currently has to lease or borrow them from neighbors.  With this improvement, he will own tools and will no longer have to rent or borrow them thus earning more income and improving his quality of life so that in a few months he can attain his greatest dream: “To grow as a micro businessman.”

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Shohsanam

texts.ru: Шохсанам молодая трудолюбивая девушка. Она живет со своими родителями. У нее свой бизнес, и в бизнесе ей помогает  сестра.  Она занимается торговлей сухого и вареного гороха. От данного бизнеса она имеет хороший доход. Она хочет получить займ в размере 5 000 сомони для оптового закупа гороха. Она надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку. Cпасибо большое!
texts.en: Shohsanam is a hardworking young woman who lives with her parents and operates her own business.  Her sister helps her with the business.  Shohsanam sells dry and cooked peas, an activity that brings her a good income.  She would like to receive a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni (TJS) in order to make a bulk purchase of peas.  She looks forward to your help and support.  Thank you very much!

loans.use: to buy peas.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura is a volunteer Camfed learner guide and an entrepreneur who is into poultry project which started in March this year 2015.She is living with her husband and one child in Mudzi district. Her work involves running the poultry project at her home stead in order to pay rentals and other family expenses like groceries. She also volunteers as a Camfed learner guide, leading life skills development sessions with students at the local secondary school. Laura is requesting KIVA loan in order to construct a big fowl run more chicks and feeds. With the profit, she is planning to assist disadvantaged children with school going costs items such as uniforms and stationery as well as improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: To construct a big fowl run more chicks and feeds

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
My name is Bernarda, I have had my little market for 9 years and I have a good clientel. Since I was widowed, I dedicated myself to this store and my business grew. Now I generate earnings enough to cover the costs of my business and the expenses it takes to maintain good health.

Loan Use: cheeses, sodas, bread, eggs, milk, confectionaries and others. 

Mi nombre es Bernarda, tengo 9 años de tener mi mercadito del que tengo una buena clientela, desde que enviude me dedique a vender y mi negocio crecio, ahora me genera ingresos para suplir los gastos de mi negocio y los gastos para mantener una buena sallud.

loans.use: Compra de quesos, refrescos, pan, huevos, leche, confites y otros.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: "Auntie" Vida is a trader who sells clothes and shoes. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and was trained in the TEACH lending program. A KIVA loan in the amount of $800 will allow her to increase her stock and grow her business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Alma Idalia

texts.es:
Alma is a young mother who has had to work to raise her 11 year old son. She has never had help from her partner to support her child or to pay for his education. As she therefore needed to ean money but also have time to spend with her son, Alma decided to start her own business selling gifts and souvenirs which, fortunately, has gone very well.

Lately her client base has grown and she now needs a loan of $275 to buy merchandise so that she can offer more variety to her clients so that her business can continue to grow. She promises to repay this quanity over a period of 4 months. Your help will be very useful to the development of her business and to the wellbeing of her family. Alma and her son thank you very much for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.
