Alma es una joven madre que ha tenido que trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a su hijo de 11 años de edad, ella nunca contó con el apoyo de su pareja para el sostén y educación de su hijo, ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso y disponer de tiempo para atender a su pequeño, Alma decidió abrir su propio negocio con la venta de regalos y novedades, en el que afortunadamente le ha ido muy bien.

Últimamente los clientes se han incrementado y necesita de un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que destinará a la compra de más mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Tu ayuda será de gran utilidad en el desarrollo de este negocio y en el bienestar de esta familia, Alma y su hijo agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Bahadur

texts.en: Mr. A. is a vulnerable low income person. He is married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Bahadur and his wife (she is shown in the picture) run the family business together. Bahadur sells milk in Saatli town, while his wife takes care of their only cow. The income from one cow is too low to support the family. In the Caucasus region the price of a good cow is about $800-1000 USD. But Bahadur has some of his own money to add to it. That’s why he applied for a $450 loan to buy one more pure-breed cow to make his monthly income higher.

loans.use: Mr. Abbasov would like to buy another cow for his farm.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
Fernanda makes cloth blouses and also embroiders them. She is 27 years old, has three children and belonds to the group called "Mujeres para Progresar 4," together with two other artisans, Catalina Hernández Hernández and Carmela Hernández Pérez. With their loan they will invest in the purchase of thread and fabric at wholesale prices, as now they have to travel two hours from their home in order to acquire their supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

FERNANDA hace blusas de manta y también las borda. Ella tiene 27 años, tres hijos y pertenece al grupo llamado Mujeres para Progresar 4, junto con doña Catalina Hernández Hernández (artesana) y doña Carmela Hernández Pérez (artesana). Con sus prestamos invertirán en la compra de hilo y tela al por mayor, ya que para adquirirlos tienen que viajar dos horas de donde viven.

loans.use: Purchase thread and fabric to create embroidered blouses

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
"My wife and I worry about the safety of our house, especially during the night since there is very few light in the neighborhood where we live. We also have small children for this reason we decide to install a gate and a fence for protection of all of us". I’m asking for $500 to install the gate and fence in my house.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi esposa y yo estamos preocupados por la seguridad de nuestra casa, sobre todo en las noches ya que hay muy poca luz en el fraccionamiento en donde vivimos, también tenemos hijos pequeños así es que decidimos poner un portón y hacer una barda para protección de todos”.Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para poner un portón y una barda en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Install a gate and a fence.

loans.name: Juriah

texts.en: Juriah is a 36-year-old woman who owns a small shop where she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice and many other things. She can usually earn US$44.50 a month, mostly due to the amount and variety of goods she has in stock. Her husband S. has no regular income, so she has to work hard to pay for her children's tuition. Juriah currently needs a loan of US$150 to increase the inventory stock in her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory for a grocery store

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Mrs. Im S., 40, is a mother of four children in school, and works selling various kinds of vegetables to the people in her area, making on average of $4.50 each day in revenue. Her husband works on his plot of farmland growing crops and also driving a horse cart to transport passengers, earning typically about $2 each day. Mrs. Im S. hopes to use this loan to reinvest in her business and to buy another plot of farmland to expand her crops.

loans.use: To reinvest in her business and to buy another plot of farmland to expand her crops.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en: Sanobar S. was born in 1963 in the Asht region and she is married and has five children. She supports her family by her home business of making and selling the national bread, lepeshky. Mrs. S. repaid a previous loan that she took out to improve her business. Now, Mrs. S. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $625.00 to buy more flour and increase her production.

loans.use: To buy flour and increase production.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. is a trader who sells rice, cassava, and plantains. She also prepares food for sale. She is married and has two children. She wants to increase her income to help support the family’s financial needs.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to purchase more stock and food items for her food production and sales.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more stock and food items for her food production and sales.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Veronica S., who is married and has two children, aged 5 and 8. In 1999, Veronica established her grains business and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, maize, and cocoa in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of maize, rice, and cocoa.

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru:
Mavchuda K. is 46 years old, married and has secondary education. Her children are already grown up and have their own families and businesses. After the collapse of the Soviet Union Mavchuda lost her job and went into entrepreneurship to sustain the same quality of life. She has more than five years of experience in her field of work. She began taking out loans at MicroInvest last year and has proven to be a well disciplined and responsible client. In the future she plans to go into wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Камолова Мавчуда – 46 лет. Замужем, образование среднее. Дети уже взрослые и заняты своими делами и семьей. После распада Советского Союза Мавчуда осталась без работы и начала заниматься предпринимательством для поддержания уровня жизни. Имеет опыт в этой сфере более 5 лет. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» в прошлом году и за это время показала себя ответственной и дисциплинированной клиенткой. В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: To start selling wholesale

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
For 9 years Diana has acted in small roles in national television shows. However, after her daughter was born, she had to work less time in that activity. She decided to put a small grocery store in her house. Her new business has been open for one month. The loans she has requested have served to stock her store. She would like for her store to grow and she would also like to continue acting.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 9 años, Diana se dedica a la actuación con papeles pequeños en series nacionales. Sin embargo, luego que nació su hija, tuvo que apartarse parcialmente de esta actividad, por lo que decidió poner una bodega en su casa. Su negocio recién tiene un mes, es así que los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para montar su bodega. A ella le gustaría que su bodega crezca más y seguir dedicándose a la actuación.

loans.use: To buy products that she needs for her small grocery store

loans.name: Ama Abozou-Mondom

texts.fr:
Born in Kara on December 31, 1975, Mr. Ama Abozou-Mondom A. is single and has no children. He has had his own business since 2005. He completes construction projects and is paid once the entire project is finished. This way of doing business sets him apart from other business owners, who insist on being paid for part or all of a construction project before it is even started. His services are thus in greater demand than those of his competitors. However, he sometimes lacks working capital, especially if the construction project he is working on is a large one. He has already received and repaid one loan. He is requesting this second loan in order to finish a construction project consisting of renovating a parking lot.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né à Kara le 31 décembre 1975, Monsieur A. Ama Abozou-Mondom est célibataire sans enfant. Il est un entrepreneur qui exerce depuis 2005. Il reçoit des chantiers qu’il exécute entièrement et se fait payer après exécution complète. Cette façon de procéder fait qu’il se différencie des autres entrepreneurs qui se font payer partiellement ou entièrement avant l’exécution. Il est alors plus demandé que les autres entrepreneurs. Ainsi il lui arrive parfois d’avoir une insuffisance de fonds de roulement surtout si le chantier est assez important. Il avait eu recours à un premier prêt qu’il a bien remboursé. Il demande ce deuxième prêt qui lui permettra de finir un chantier de réhabilitation d’un parking.

loans.use: Renovating a parking lot

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte M. is 38 years old. She is married with five children. She lives with her family at Obuasi in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She is a merchant who has been selling used shoes and plastic utensils such as plates, buckets, bowls, etc. for the past six years.

Charlotte is requesting a loan to augment her working capital so as to buy more stock of used shoes and plastic materials to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to raise more income to support her family. Charlotte is a member of a community group called St. Pauls Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes and plasticware

loans.name: Mary I.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Mary N.. She is married and has four children aged between 20 and 8. In 2006, Mary established her Café/mama lishe business. She opens her business six days a week, and 9 - 12 hours a day. She is assisted by her husband. Mary requires a loan in order to purchase more rice, sugar, salt, and cooking oil in bulk. In the future, Mary plans to expand and establish another business. She thanks you for your support.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is 'restaurant' or 'café', you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don't even appear in the Lonely Planet's budget guide, but if you're looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar,  salt and cooking oil in bulk

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
Don José tiene 44 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Canadá, es casado y le tienen dos hijos de 8 y 15 años de edad, los cuales estudian la primaria, su esposa es ama de casa.
El Sr. José trabaja en una institución privada prestando sus servicios como servicio de seguridad, en donde trabaja las 24 horas de día y noche y luego descansa un día, le ha tocado hacer la lucha ya que los trabajos están escasos en el país y tiene que subsistir con su familia, tiene una experiencia laboral de diez años. El préstamo que esta solicitando es para infraestructura en la construcción de un muro en frente de la casa para tener un poco de seguridad con su familia.  A futuro es mejorar en la economía, brindar a sus hijos estudios.
texts.en:
Don José is 44 years of age, lives in the neighborhood of Villa Canadá, is married, and they have two children, an 8 year-old and a 15 year-old who are in primary school. His wife is a housewife. Señor José works in a private institution working in security where he works for 24 hours and then has a day off. He has struggled since jobs are scarce in the country and he has to support his family. He has 10 years of work experience. The loan that he is asking for is for the foundation for the construction of a wall in front of his home to have a little bit of security for his family. In the future, his goals are to improve in savings to provide his children with schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a wall

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Hola nosotras somos el grupo de las mujeres emprendedoras estamos formadas por 5 integrantes, Bertha S. soy la coordinadora del grupo, tengo 49 años, La Sra. Sara Patricia H. tiene 29 años de edad, la Sra. Dina Luz O. tiene 37 años de edad, la Sra. Maria V. de 40 años de edad y la Sra Edis N. de 35 años de edad, todas contamos con el apoyo de nuestros esposos para el sustento de nuestros hogares, tambien nos ayudan nuestros hijos en el trabajo, tenemos 5 años de concernos y nos llevamos muy bien, creo que hemos formado un laso amistoso muy fuerte como si fueramos una familia, todas vivimos en la colonia Fraternidad Ismael Acosta en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, nuestro rubro de ventas son las golosinas, venta de ropa, perfumes y achinerias, todas tenemos una fiel clientela ya que estos tipos de productos son de mucha demanda en el mercado, nosotras hemos buscado solicitar un credito para invertir mas en nuestros negocios para que nos queden mayores ganancias.
nuestro proposito es invertir en nuestros negocios para mejorar la atencion a sus clientes y tener mejores ingresos y darles mejor futuro a nuestros hijos.
texts.en:
We are a group of businesswomen made up of five core members: Bertha S., 49 years old (I am the coordinator for the group); Mrs. Sara Patricia H., 29 years old; Mrs. Dina Luz O., 37 years old; Mrs. Maria V., 40 years old; and Mrs. Edis N., 35 years old. Our husbands support us by helping out at home and with the kids. We have known one another for five years and we all get along very well, having created a strong bond of friendship akin to family. We all live in the Fraternidad Ismael Acosta neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. We sell sweets, clothing, perfumes, and sundries. Our client base is very loyal and our products are in high demand in the market. We are applying for a loan which we will invest in our businesses in order to improve our customer service to increase our profits so we may provide a better future for our children.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to produce foodstuffs and buy clothing, perfumes, and sundries

loans.name: Francisco Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge  vive en la calle Santa Bárbara de la ciudad de La Paz junto a su esposa y su hija menor de 10 años de edad.  Su esposa trabaja como cocinera en una pensión.
 
Jorge es chofer  de transporte publico en  el sindicato “Simón Bolívar”,la movilidad es de su propiedad

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de batería y llantas.
 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Jorge lives on Santa Bárbara road in La Paz with his wife and his young 10-year old daughter. His wife works as a cook in a boardinghouse. Jorge is a public transportation driver with the “Simón Bolívar” union; he owns the car he drives for work. He will use the loan to buy a battery and tires. This is his first loan with Impro; the assessment carried out qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix his car, which he uses in his capacity as a public transportation driver.

loans.name: Lorena Haymeth

texts.en:
Lorena Haymeth L. R. lives in Pucallpa, Peru – the bustling capital of the Ucayali department in eastern Peru. The region is characterized by the meandering Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon. The weather is scorchingL. hot and humid almost everyday and during the wet season, the city receives daiL. thunderstorms and rain showers. Lorena lives in the city on Martin Olaya Street with her husband – a taxi driver – and her two sons. Lorena has been taking out loans through the Talented Women communal bank for four years to support a clothing sales business that she runs out of her home.

Lorena is currentL. requesting a Kiva loan of 2,000 Nuevo Soles that she will use to purchase pants, blouses and LaCoste polos which she plans to offer to her clients for sale. Lorena will repay her loan in monthL. installments over the course of four months.

loans.use: To purchase pants, blouses and LaCoste polos

loans.name: Estela Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Estela Ofelia se ha destacado en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua por tener su propio negocio de venta de frutas y verduras tales como granadillas y papayas las cuales son comercializadas por ella misma con el propósito de llevar el alimento a su hogar compuesto por sus cuatro pequeños hijos.

La razón que ella atraviesa hoy en día es que requiere del capital financiero para la compra de las verduras y frutas y por esto es que ha decidido esperar en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con este crédito y así salir adelante en su negocio por medio de sus grandes esfuerzos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estela Ofelia has shined in her local market of Managua because she has her own business. In her business she has fresh fruits and vegetables. She also has other fruits as papayas which she sells commercially. With this income that she makes, she takes it home and uses it to feed her four small children.

Her current loan is to acquire more money so that she can purchase more fruits and vegetables. She has put her hopes on Ceprodel and hopes they give her the necessary credit go move ahead in life.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun H., 30, is married and lives in the Battambang Province with her husband and six children. All of their children are in school. Mrs. Sun H. and her husband are fish sellers at the market and earn a combined income of around USD $6 per day. She is asking for a loan to buy more fish to resell.

loans.use: To purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 47-year-old Salma K. from Mwanza. She is married. Salma has been running a poultry ("kuku") business since 1992. Raising kuku is a popular microbusiness in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. "Kuku" means "chickens" in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital: You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. Salma works at the business for 9 hours a day, 7 days a week. She currently earns about $200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to purchase more chicks to raise and resell. In the future, she plans to open another business. Salma thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed noncreditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase chicks to raise and resell

loans.name: Kondowulay P.

texts.en:
Kondowulay P. K. was born in Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. He is in his early thirties, married with two children. Kondowulay runs a guest house in Kabala town with a small bar.  In his bar, he sells both hard and soft drinks. With previous SMT loans, Kondowulay has been able to build two more structures onto his guest house to add to the two he previous had. Loans through SMT have made tremendous impact in the life of Kondowulay. 

Having repaid the last loan successfully, he is now requesting a new one in order to further strengthen his business. With the profit he makes from the loan, he will be able to make his monthly repayments, feed himself and his children and wife, and send the children to school.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Fredelyn

texts.en:
Fredelyn M. is one of the participative members of HSPFI. She lives in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, Misamis Oriental, Philippines. She is married with four children. Traditional gold mining is common where they live and most residents do this as another source of income. Fredelyn buys gold from traditional miners and processes it into jewelry. She is been in this business for almost a year. She then sells the jewelry in the city.

Fredelyn joined HSPFI micro-finance program and she was granted a loan of PHP 8,000. Right now, Fredelyn needs an additional capital of PHP 11,000 to cater for neighboring villagers who drop in at her house to sell grams of gold.

Fredelyn believes that this is a great opportunity for her family to improve their living. She also aims to open up a little jewelry shop soon. That is why, she is soliciting KIVA lenders once again to help her fulfill her dreams for her family.

loans.use: to procure  additional raw materials  for her jewelry business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: 01-Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
"Đông Ngô Thị, a 56 year-old resident of Thanh Hoá, is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 01-Đông Hải (16-04-01).

Đông, married with two adult children, raises livestock. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Đông has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Đông joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Đông has repaid a previous loan of 1.626.900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women that was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell, and she is now requesting a new loan of 1.626.900 VND to be used for the same prupose. The loan will be her third from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Đông plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Ngô Thị Sâm is a 54-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2. Lê Thị Kỳ is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her fishing business.

3. Ngô Thị Tính is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her fishing business.

4. T. Thị Thơm is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

5. Lê Thị Lý is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

6. N. Thị Lý is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raiseand sell in future.

loans.name: Fidavs

texts.ru: Мирзоев Фирдавс проживает в городе Душанбе.  Женат, детей не имеет. Возраст  26 лет. Фидавс более 4 лет занимается услугой маршрутного такси. У него имеется собственная машина. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы отремонтировать свою машину, т.к. это является единственным источником дохода.
texts.en:
Fidavs M. lives in Dushanbe. He is 26, married, and has no children. Fidavs has been a minibus taxi driver for over 4 years. He owns his own minibus. He is requesting a loan in order to do repairs on the vehicle, as it is his sole source of income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
O. Trần Thị owns and operates a business selling agricultural equipment--primarily farming machinery and supplies--to local farmers. She is 31 years old, married and has one school-age child. They live in the town of Quảng Xương. O. has been in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2003, O. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. O. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. O. is now requesting a loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her sixth loan from TYM Fund. O. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

No. 1415030379.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies to sell

loans.name: Asega

texts.en: Asega O., 52, is married with five children. She has many years of experience in the fishing  business. She sells to the villagers and general public, two days per week. She has had five previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~165 USD).  SPBD loans are Asega’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge, net, cooler and fishing equipment

loans.name: Copo De Nieve Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Copo De Nieve” pertenece al centro focal Santiago II, a la fecha el grupo esta formado por catorce integrantes, que trabajan de forma responsable hace nueve años aproximadamente.
La mayoría de los miembros de este  grupo  se dedica a la confección y venta de ropa, por ejemplo realizan tejido artesanales de chompas y mantas, confección de polleras, confección de ropa deportiva algunas de ellas tienen tiendas de barrio. Ahora ellas necesitan comprar materia prima para ampliar su producción, de este modo mejorar sus ingresos para el bien se sus familias.
texts.en:
The association “Copo De Nieve” belongs to the focal centre 'Santiago II', and at the moment this group has four members who have been working together for around nine years.

The majority of the members of this group dedicate themselves to making and selling clothes. For example, they weave handcrafted sweaters and ponchos, make skirts and sportswear, and some of them have their own stores in their neighbourhood. Now they need to buy basic materials to increase their production and in this way improve their income for their families' wellbeing.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic materials/COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo C. H. vive en el departamento de La Libertad en el occidente salvadoreño.  Sin contar con la preparación adecuada ni educación formal, Guillermo mostro siempre un interés y talento para la fotografía, talento que se convirtió en su negocio, con el que ha sacado adelante a su esposa y tres hijos, quienes ya dan señales de compartir su pasión por la fotografía.  Guillermo solicita un préstamo para comprar nuevo equipo de trabajo, pues el equipo con el que cuenta actualmente, se ha vuelto obsoleto en comparación a las nuevas tecnologías. Guillermo está seguro que al adquirir este nuevo equipo, abrirá consigo muchas puertas y oportunidades para evolucionar su pasión, y su vida.
texts.en:
Guillermo C. H. lives in the district of La Libertad in the western part of El Salvador. Without adequate preparation or education, Guillermo always showed an interest and talent for photography. His hobby turned into a business that has helped him get ahead, along with his wife and three children. His kids are already showing an interest in their father’s passion for photography.

Guillermo is requesting a loan to buy new equipment for his business, since his current equipment is obsolete when compared to the new technology. He is positive that this investment will open many doors and opportunities to help him develop, both in his passion and in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new photography equipment

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en:
Bashorat B. is forty-three years old and married with two children. She has been running her own small business for three years. She rents a store in the local market where she sells daily foodstuffs. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She is very friendly and polite, which attracts customers. She is requesting $800 to increase the range of the goods she sells. She needs to be able to provide for her children's needs and to pay their school fees. She promises to repay her loan without any delay and thanks everybody who decides to support her.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a wider range of goods and to increase her stock

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
Constantina tiene 59 años, vive con su hermana en su casa propia. Ella es docente de profesión, su amplia experiencia de 30 años en esta actividad le ha permitido  adquirir habilidades en la enseñanza. Hace 3 años se jubiló, pero su vocación sigue vigente, por tal motivo decidió dictar clases particulares y sus alumnos actuales son los hijos de sus amistades y vecinos, quienes conocen de su trayectoria y esmerada labor en la educación. Adicionalmente, comparte con su hermana una tienda de abarrotes, negocio que implementaron en su casa. Constantina menciona que mientras tenga fuerzas para hacerlo, seguirá enseñando, pues ama su profesión. Por otro lado, según aumenten sus ventas, irá surtiendo su tienda de comestibles con más y variados productos.
Esta es la tercera oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy dispuesta a seguir trabajando con mucha responsabilidad en su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de libros para actualizar sus conocimientos. También incrementará los productos de su tienda y adquirirá sacos de abono, pues empezará a sembrar legumbres en algunos terrenos de cultivo que posee.

loans.use: Compra de libros e inversión en otros negocios

loans.name: Los Tres Amigos Group

texts.es:
el grupo Los Tres Amigos son personas muy simpaticas y amables, tienen varios años de conocerse y son muy unidos, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:
el sr. SANTOS GABRIEL I. tiene 6 años de dedicarse a la venta de carnes de res y pollo, tambien vende verduras, actividad la cual realiza de manera ambulante.-  actualmente tambien se esta dedicando a vender, ropa americana ya que los dias de mayor venta para las carnes son los dias sabados y domingos,  en el transcurso de la semana se dedica a vender ropa.
El Sr. I. es casado y de principios cristianos, con su esposa solo han tenido una hija y depende a un 100% de ellos, su esposa se dedica a vender tortillas de maíz.
la sra. MARIA VICENTA I. se dedica al comercio, vende helados, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 1/2 años, ella vende los helados por caja y tambien al detalle, es casada y su esposo es el que le ayuda a vender el Ice Cream en conos, del matrimonio solo depende un hijo, mismo que le ayuda a conducir en el vehiculo cuando salen a vender ropa a diferentes comunidades y cacerios circunvecinas a quebrada Larga.
el sr. JUAN MANUEL NUÑEZ el se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, hace mas de un año que lucha con su propio negocio en el cual le ha ido muy bien,  actividad que realiza de manera ambulante, en la aldea que reside y en comunidades circunvecinas a la misma.
don juan es soltero y no depende nadie de él, con los ingresos que recibe desde que se dedica al negocio él ha podido construir su casa de habitación.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante con sus familias y sus negocios.

loans.use: compra de ropa americana, fardos de peluches, platanos, yuca, cajas de ice creams, cajas de conos para ice creams

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 30-year-old single man living with his mother and brother. He has been working as a home painter since 2002 to earn income. Today, Ibrahim is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new tools for his work to be able to satisfy the needs of his clients and continue earning a good income for the family.

loans.use: buy new tools

loans.name: Lesvia Patricia

texts.es: Patricia nació el 31 de marzo de 1967 en Guatemala tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos uno de 17 otro de 12 y el menor de 7 años, tiene 8 años de vender comida ( Tacos Mexicanos) y 10 años de trabajar con FAPE. Inicio con un capital de Q500.00 y poco a poco fue incrementando sus ganancias y ahora le solicita a FAPE un préstamo por la cantidad de  Q 4,000.00 invertir mas en su negocio de comida y obtener mejores ganancias ya que quiere darle un mejor estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Patricia was born on March 31, 1967 in Guatemala. She is 42 years old, is married and has 3 children -- ages 17, 12 and 7. She has been selling food (Mexican tacos) for 8 years and has spent 10 years working with FAPE. She started with a capital of Q 500.00 and gradually increased her profits and now is asking FAPE for a loan in the amount of Q 4000.00 to invest more in her food business and get better returns because she wants to give a better education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Venta de Refacciones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to use as a taxi

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
La  Sra. BLANCA se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser pastelitos, tacos, tajaditas de minimo verde, pollo, refrescos etc. tiene quince años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, Blanca comienza a vender a las cuatro de la tarde, tiene clientes fijos y por la mañana se dedica a la venta de ropa,  como ser venta de pantalones de varon y de dama, blusas, trajes de niño, Blanca vive en la colonia Flor del Campo zona 2 y es una persona sociable, amable y preferida por sus clientes, es conocida en la colonia por su amabilidad, lo cual le ha ayudado a tener buenas ventas. así mismo con sus negocios ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos ya que su esposo fallecio y no ha tenido mas ayuda que la de su trabajo.
Blanca invierte mernsualmente $1,178.70, y vende $ 1,530.40 obteniendo una utilidad de $351.70. ahora necesita invertir en la compra de ingredientes para la venta de golosinas como ser maseca, pollo, tomates, limones, refrescos y otros ingredientes.
Blanca necesita el credito para salir adelante con su negocio y su hogar.
texts.en:
Blanca sells delicacies like little cakes, tacos, slices of green plantains, chicken, and soft drinks, etc. She has been doing this for 15 years. Blanca starts selling at four in the afternoon. She has regular customers. In the morning she sells clothes like pants for men and women, blouses, and children’s outfits. Blanca lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood Zone 2. She is a gregarious and kind person, and her customers prefer her. She is known in her neighborhood for her kindness, which has helped her to have good sales. She has been able to get her children ahead through her businesses. Her husband died, and she has not had more help than that of her work. Blanca invests $1,178.70 monthly, and she sells $1,530.40. That gives her a profit of $352.70. She now needs to buy ingredients like corn flour mix, chicken, tomatoes, lemons, soft drinks, and other ingredients. She needs the loan to get ahead with her business and her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tortillas, pork, beef, chicken, bananas, shortening, butter, oil, spices, vegetables, salsas, soft drinks, and juice

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is currently in the business of selling local alcohol at home and is requesting a loan to purchase crates of beer and sodas to sell. Rose is 22 years old and is married to an office messenger. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase crates of beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Yein

texts.en:
Mrs. Yein P. is a villager in Niel village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 4-hectare field of land on which she grows rice. On this farm, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed or fertilizers, or to pay for the plowing of the land. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan.

Her husband, Mr. Norn Sam Oeurn, is a teacher in the local school. This couple has four children, two of whom are laborers and help with their mother’s work, and the others attend the local school. Her husband is shown on the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed & fertilizers, and to pay for the plowing of the land.

loans.name: Martha Ines

texts.es: Doña ,Martha es madre de familia de cinco hijos, tiene 54 años de edad, su negocio que empezó hace siete años vendiendo ropa de segunda mano, luego comenzó a alquilar un cuarto para entradas económicas y cubrir parte de los gastos con el dinero del alquiler. Sus préstamos han sido para invertir mas en su negocio, y con las ganancias ir haciendo mejoras en su casa, que poco a poco ha venido mejorando con ayuda de sus hijos que trabajan, aun falta repellar las paredes y poner piso para un mejor bienestar como mejor higiene de su familia. Con este préstamo comprara paca de ropa el cual espera incrementar las ventas ya que cuando trae varias pacas nuevas sus clientes le compran varias piezas por buenas, y accesibles en costo, además tiene poco inventario por que esta esperando la aprobación del crédito para ir a comprar varias paca ya que solo tiene sabanas y fundas. Tiene dos hijos  aun estudiando el cual espera apoyarlos para que terminen su ciclo de estudios con el propósito que encuentren un mejor por venir a futuro.
texts.en:
Martha, 54, has five children and seven years ago she began to sell used clothing. Afterwards, she rented out a room to earn additional income to partially cover household expenses. Her loans have been used to invest in her business and the profits therefrom have been used to make some home improvements which, with help from her employed children, she has been able to accomplish little by little. She still needs to replaster the walls and to install flooring for better hygiene and well-being of her family. With this latest loan she intends to buy bundles of clothing so that she can increase her sales because when she brings new bundles of clothes her customers buy several articles because they are still good and at reasonable prices; besides, she has little inventory available because she's waiting for the loan to be approved to go buy several bundles; currently all she has left in stock are sheets and pillow cases. She has two children that are still in school and she hopes to be able to support them until they finish their schooling so that they can have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy several bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Salama 2 Naigaga Merab Group

texts.en:
N. Merab is forty-eight years old and is married with six children and three siblings schooling.

Merab has been in a bakery business for over twenty years. She is using the loan to purchase bakery ingredients like milk, wheat flour, baking powder, sugar, etc., to expand her business.

Merab is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase bakery ingredients to expand her business

loans.name: Jon-Jon's Group

texts.en:
Jon-jon T. is from the village of Rizal. He is 34 years old. Jon-jon is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI/Kiva. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jon-Jon T.'s Group.

Jon-jon is married and has 5 school-aged children. He owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Jon-jon has been involved in his business for over 16 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jon-jon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jon-jon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jon-jon is requesting a new loan, his third, of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is married to a painter and they have five children. Her eldest child is 15 years old. Her children are still young and they are dependent on her. Kehinde is 45 years old and she is hard working. She sells foodstuffs like rice, beans and garri (cassava flakes). She sells for long hours to enable her to support her home. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to expand her business and family life. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Abass

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abass M.  est âgé de 35 ans, marié  et père   de 2 enfants.  Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants, avec plusieurs autres ménages, dans le quartier Médine de  la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école, il débuta  très tôt le commerce auprès de son père qui tenait une boutique. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, il évolue seul  en optant pour  le commerce d’articles  divers et  d’huile alimentaire depuis maintenant 12 ans. 
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices, il  a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui,  il est à  son 3ème prêt individuel. 
Il compte utiliser ce prêt,  pour acheter, une barrique d’huile. Il  s’approvisionne sur place et effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de supporter ses charges familiales et de faire un peu d’économie.
texts.en:
Mr. Abass M. is 35 years old, married, and has 2 children. He lives with his wife and children, along with several other households, in the Médine area of the town of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended school, he began working very early on with his father, who owned a store. After several years of apprenticeship, he developed his own business, choosing to sell various items and cooking oils, which he has done for 12 years now. With the goal of increasing his working capital in order to realize higher profits, he turned to Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners), with whom he is on his 3rd individual loan. He intends to use this loan to buy one barrel of oil. He gets his supplies in the area and makes his sales in cash, at retail, and on credit to a clientele composed of women and men. With this loan, he plans to realize a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA. This profit will allow him to provide for his family and save a little bit of money.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking oil

loans.name: Jared

texts.en: Jared O. O. is forty and married with six children. His business is in a busy market in an up-coming middle-class estate known as Mambo leo in Kisumu. He makes and sells suits, dresses, and uniforms to the local people including the parents of school children. Jared says that business is good but there is a lot of competition. He is using his loan of Kes.60,00 to buy materials to make more clothes to sell. He hopes to build his own store and also to give his children a quality education to the university level.

loans.use: materials

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria D. is a 31 year old married woman who supports her family by producing juice and buying and selling livestock. She lives in Prk Daisy, Brgy Tampalon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her 40 year old husband, Jose Erlito, who helps his wife deliver the finished product.They have 4 children who are between the ages of 4 and 11 years old.

Victoria has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 17,000.

Victoria is now borrowing Php 11,500 so that she can expand her businesses. This will be her 6th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 10,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Victoria aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional business capital

loans.name: María Grimanesa

texts.es:
La  señora  María Grimanesa  Ávila es socia del banco comunal  Mujeres Luchadoras hace diez años,  vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca en una casa arrendada con su esposo que es chofer de un taxi, su ultima hija que se divorció con quien comparten los gastos de la casa, sus otros dos hijos son casados y viven en otro sector de la ciudad.  Cuenca está ubicada al sur del Ecuador a una altura de 2500 msnm, urbe conocida como la capital cultural y deportiva del país y considerada por los  ecuatorianos como una de las ciudades  más bellas.

María Grimanesa vende caldos,  tamales, humitas, chaul afán y otros platos que realiza bajo pedido  y los aprendió a base de  su imaginación en la cocina,  lleva siete años  en esta actividad de domingo a domingo sin regirse a un horario fijo;  con el  nuevo crédito comprará  carnes, arroz, choclos, hojas, harinas,  etc. para la preparación de su exquisita comida.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un negocio más grande y también  una casa propia.
texts.en:
María Grimanesa Ávila has been a member of the communal bank Mujeres Luchadoras for ten years. She lives in the city of Cuenca in a rented house with her husband who is a taxi driver. Her youngest daughter, who is divorced, shares the household expenses. Her other two children are married and live in another part of the city. Cuenca is in the south of Ecuador, at an altitude of 2,500 meters above sea level. It is a city known as the cultural and sports capital of the country and considered by Ecuadorians to be one of the most beautiful cities. María Grimanesa sells soup, tamales, humitas, fried rice and other dishes to order. She learned using her imagination in the kitchen. She has been doing this activity for seven years Sunday to Sunday without a set schedule. With the new loan she will buy meat, rice, corn, leaves, flour, etc. to prepare her delicious food. Her dream is to have a bigger business and also her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, rice, corn, flour, leaves, etc.

loans.name: C2256 Abadacogora Group

texts.en:
Josephine is the leader of this group which is called Abadacogora in the local language. This group consists of three people who have various business.

Josephine is 33 years old and is married with five children aged between 1 and 20. Her husband doesn't work and for that reason she works hard so that she provides all her children’s basic needs.

Josephine has an experience of seven years in her business of selling soft drinks and cakes in her region. She employs one person as a helper and runs her daily activities from 5 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day.

Josephine and her group are now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses through purchasing more products. This loan will help them to satisfy the demands of their clients.

Josephine will be using the extra money expected from her expanded business, to reinvest in her business and to save money for the future of her family.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Carmelita Morqueda Group

texts.en:
Carmelita M., aged 55, is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Carmelita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC which was successfully repaid, Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the seventh loan she has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Carine

texts.en:
From the town of Sta. Josefa, Carine M. is 26 years old, married, and has a six-year-old child. To make a living, Carine has been planting and harvesting rice for sale for over nine years now.

Carine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is now requesting a new loan, her fifth, of 13000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Carine plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila pertenece al  Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua hace 13 años y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones y aprendió a valorarse como persona.
Luzmila es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Luzmila compra cereales de los proveedores que le traen al molino de su hermano, Luzmila procesa los cereales en molino alquilado, sus productos los vende en los mercados, en oportunidades bajo pedido. Además Luzmila tiene un carro que alquila para realizar taxi en la ciudad, unidad que adquirió con ahorros y préstamo.
Luzmila necesita un préstamo de 1350 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada.
Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luzmila is part of the Communal Bank “Kusikuy”, which means “Rejoice” in Quechua. She has been a member for 13 years and what she enjoys most are the training classes in which she has learned how to value herself as a person.

Luzmila is in a common law marriage and has two children in school. She buys grain from the suppliers and brings it to her brother’s mill for processing. Luzmila rents the mill from her brother and then sells her products at the markets where, on occasion, she will accept orders. She also has a car that she acquired using her savings and the help of a loan. The vehicle is rented out as a city taxi.

Luzmila needs a loan of 1350 PEN to be invested in the purchase of wheat and barley. Her dreams include seeing her children become professionals and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat & barley

loans.name: Dionalin

texts.en:
Dionalin P. is from the town of Banga. She is 41 years old. Dionalin is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Dionalin owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Her wishes for the future are for her business to prosper and for her family to have better living conditions.

Dionalin joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionalin is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dionalin from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “DINAMICO”; La socia vive en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento D. Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Hilda; ella tiene 63 años D. edad y la socia es Viuda,  y ella se dedica a al comercio minorista, La socia tine su negocio D. compra y venta D. ropa, ella viaja cada 15 días o dependiendo a como le fue con su negocio a la ciudad D. Lima, ella va a las fábricas y en especial compra polos D. algodón, conocedora D. que Perú tiene el mejor algodón en el mundo, la socia trae polos, medias, ropas interiores y demás, para la venta en la ciudad del Cusco. La socia después D. la muerte D. su esposo a solventado todos los gastos del hogar con este pequeño negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y traer para la venta.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the communal bank called "Dinamico". She lives in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco, Peru. Hilda is 63 years old and widowed. To earn a living, she runs a small business buying and selling clothing. Every 15 days or so, Hilda travels to the city of Lima where she goes to the factories that specialize in cotton shirts. It is well known that Peru has some of the finest cotton in the world. Hilda brings shirts, socks, underwear and other cotton products to sell in the city of Cusco. After her husband died, Hilda was able to settle all of the household expenses with the income she earned from her small business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise to sell. Hilda values and appreciates the loans she's been given which enabled her to grow her business. She is committed to making the payments and complying with the payment terms.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her small business buying and selling cotton products.  The income from her small business has enabled her to support herself since the death of her husband.

loans.name: Jose Heliodoro

texts.es:
Don José trabaja en construcción, desde joven comenzó a ganarse la vida  trabando como ayudante de albañil en donde aprendió el oficio, hoy en día es su fuente de trabajo.
Con esfuerzo de el y de su esposa han logrado mejores condiciones de vivienda.
Su esposa trabaja de domesticas y ambos se ayudan.
A través del apoyo de Afodenic ha logrado las mejoras de construcción
Siendo de gran beneficio ya que no gasta en mano de obra ya que el mismo hace la obra.
Son nueve ciclos con afodenic, en donde esta contento por la oportunidad del financiamiento. Con el crédito anterior logro la terminación del baño e inodoro.
La obra que hará es un pequeño cuarto para lograr mejor comodidad con su familia.
Comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines. Y así comenzar.
texts.en:
José works in construction. As a young man, José trained as a bricklayer and now earns his living from such a profession. Both he and his wife have worked hard to improve their standard of living. José’s wife works in the domestic sphere and both help each other. With the help of Afodenic José has been able to make improvements to his house. José does not have to spend money on labourers to build for him, as he builds the house himself. This is his ninth cycle with Afodenic and José is happy with the opportunity that the loan provides. With the previous loan, he managed to finish building the toilet and bathroom. José needs to complete work on a small bedroom in order to improve living conditions for his family. He will buy: stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, roof purlins.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase: stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc panelling, purlins, etc., to make improvements to his house and living situation

loans.name: Wainha Womens Group-Jinja

texts.en:
M. Jesca, who belongs to the Wainha Women's group-Jinja, reckons that she has been able to succeed even in the hardest of situations that she has experienced as she operates her 19-year-old business. This 40-year-old married mother of four also credits her resolve, open mindedness and affable nature as winning attributes that she has relied upon in her tailoring business in Jinja Taxi Park-Jinja.  

Jesca says that after school she could not find a job so she was compelled to start this business. In a week she makes profits that add up to around $67 and with this loan she is expecting to buy more fabric and textile materials to make more clothes to sell.

loans.use: The purchase of more fabric and textile materials to make more clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Kipsang

texts.en:
Kipsang is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for the last five years and employs two farmhands. He is also a businessman.

He has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the income from this loan will enable him to provide for the basic needs of his family and pay school fees for his children. His primary challenges are lack of enough animal feeds and water. He hopes that in the future, he will acquire a dairy cow that produces at least 40 liters of milk daily.

Kipsang is 36 years old. He is married with six children who are between the ages of 2 and 14. Five of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es:
Francisco tiene la edad de 39 años,  casado con tres hermosos hijos, hoy en día trabaja como cadete de taxi. 
Anteriormente trabajaba en una ruta urbana, pero luego cambia trabajo logrando mejor ingreso lo que es de mucha ayuda para poder cubrir los gastos de su casa, su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa lo que es de gran ayuda.
Lo que quiere hacer atreves de este financiamiento es poder levantar un muro de concreto en la parte  de atrás de su solar, para mejorar la seguridad y mejor visión de su casa, ya que tiene cerrado con zinc. Y que es atraves de este préstamo que hará esta mejora ya que es a plazos que le permite poder cubrir este gasto.
texts.en: Francisco is 39 years old and married with three children. He works as a taxi driver. In the past he worked an urban route, but then changed to be able to increase his income. This has been very helpful in covering his housing costs. His wife makes a living selling clothing, which is also a big help. With this loan he wants to be able to erect a concrete wall at the edge of his backyard, in order to increase the security and his overall vision for the house. It will be sealed off with a corrugated metal wall. Using this loan he will implement these changes. He is able to cover the expenses through installment payments.

loans.use: He will buy construction materials to build a wall at the edge of his backyard, in order to increase the security of his home.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites S. is from the village of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao city. She is 34 years old. Marites is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport services in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for this activity.

Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luis D. L. C. N. es un hombre muy trabajador que con esfuerzo y ahorros D. mucho tiempo fue construyendo su casa pero no le alcanzo lo suficiente para terminar dicho proyecto. Ahora José recurre a L. institución para que se le apoye para comprar el material y pagar mano D. obra para que su casa queD. lista y así poder habitarL..
texts.en: El señor José Luis D. L. C. N. is a hard-working man who, with much effort and savings accumulated over a long period of time, was building his house, but he was unable to finish.  Now José is turning to the local lending institution for help in buying material and paying labor expenses, so that he can finish his house and live in it.

loans.use: Complete construction of his house.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean A. is from the village of Tipolo. She is 25 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Jean owns & operates a pig raising business. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Jean joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be her 10th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn C., 48, is a tailor, earning an income of USD 1 per day. C. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend USD 120 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 30 on other necessary expenses every month. 

C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Rosa De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: La presidenta del banco D. emprendimiento Rosa D. Guadalupe es la Sra. Vilma, casada tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, realiza el servicio D.  lavado D. autos , junto a su esposo, viven en la zona D. Huayllani  en anticrético, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra D. un motor para el lavado D. autos, para que así le sea mas fácil el lavado D. autos, y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, este banco D. emprendimiento este conformado por vecinas D. la zona  que viven hace varios años en la misma zona, cada una D. ellas tienen una actividad independiente trabajan D. lunes a viernes, se conocen bastante bien entre ellas en el grupo  existe la participación D. 2 varones D. igual manera son muy conocidos con su respectiva actividad .es un banco muy organizado dinámicos muy solidario.
texts.en:
The president of the Rosa D. Guadalupe Enterprising Bank is Vilma, who is married with 3 school-aged children.  She has a car wash, and together with her husband, lives in the Huayllani zone in a rental house.  Money from this loan will be used to purchase a motor for washing cars, making the job easier and offering better service to their customers.

The Bank is composed of neighbors who have lived for various years in the same zone.  Each of them has an independent work activity, working from Monday to Friday. They know each other very well. Among the group are 2 men who also are well known in their respective activities. The bank is very organized and dynamic, with much solidarity.

loans.use: TO BUY A MOTOR FOR A CAR WASH

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna J.  has a business  rice farming. It is her hope to expand her business, and a loan from CEVI will allow her to buy more seeds and fertilizers. With the additional income from a larger business, Rosanna will be able to provide enough food and other necessities for her family. Rosanna also grows coconut trees and chickens.

Rosanna has three children, and she plans to help fund their education with the additional income that the loan will provide. In the future, she hopes to continue expanding her farm and to take advantage of other business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Hassan

texts.ar: حسن في عمر 33 سنة يعمل في اعادة تجديد السيارات (حداد) له في عمله 10 سنوات يحب عمله متزوج يعمل بجد ونشاط دائم التجدد والتطور يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء كمية جديدة من الحديد لإعادة تصنيعه واستخدامه في العمل يريد ان يطور عمله فهو يتميز بالدقة والنشاط في العمل وهو يبدع في إعادة تجديد السيارات
texts.en: Hassan is 33, married, and works in the refurbishment of cars as an iron smith. He has been doing this for 10 years and loves his work very much. He is always enthusiastic about developing his business. With this loan he wants to purchase a new batch of iron to use in his work. He is well regarded for his attention to detail and enthusiasm. He is innovative and skilful in car refurbishment.

loans.use: Purchase a new batch of iron

loans.name: Olpha Kwamboka

texts.en:
Olpha Kwamboka, aged 28, is married to Philip and they have two children. They live in Noonkopir. Olpha runs a retail shop located in Kitengela market, which is a busy market. Most of her customers are females. She earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She has never borrowed from any other MFI. She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD and she intends to buy more stock of sugar, maize meal and sweets.

If the loan boosts her business, she plans to start a wholesale shop. Olpha is a hardworking lady.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, floor and sweets for sale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa C. is from the village of Miputak. She is 39 years old. Rosa is married and has five children. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a food stall, from which she sells a variety of foods. Rosa has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials for her food vending business. This will be Rosa's sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her food vending business

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
As a married parent of 1 child, Melva works hard to support her family.  She has a transportation (tricycle) business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming and selling ice cream.  Melva is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her transportation (tricycle) business.

Melva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her tricycle

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: Honorine est née en 1969 et est mariée à un transitaire nommé Eugène. Honorine a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et qui sont tous à sa charge. Il y a près de cinq ans que Honorine et sa famille se sont installées à PK11, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Honorine vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les diverses charges de la maison. Pour y arriver, Noudégodo Honorine mène comme activité la vente de liqueurs, de fruits et divers autres produits (conserves, lait, mayonnaise, beurre, huile d'arachide, amuses gueule, etc.), ce qui l'aide à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Noudégodo Honorine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et aussi à Lomé au Togo, et les revend à Sèmè-Podji. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Honorine sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est de renforcer davantage son activité afin d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en:
Honorine was born in 1969 and is married to a freight agent named Eugène. She has to support her five children, who all attend school. Honorine and her family have been living for almost five years in PK11 in Sèmè-Podji. She helps her husband in taking care of the various expenses of the family. To manage it, Honorine sells liquors, fruits, and various other products (canned food, milk, mayonnaise, butter, peanut oil, snacks, etc.) which helps her provide for herself and her children.

Honorine gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin, as well as in Lomé, Togo. She resells in Sèmè-Podji. With the goal of bolstering her business and meet customer demand, she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. She ambitions to bolster her business in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy liquors, apples, oil, and other various items

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun P. is skilled at cultivating different kinds of crops. She can plant her crops in both the dry and the rainy seasons. She earns about $1.50 USD each day from her farming business. Because the rainy season is coming, Chhun P. would like a loan to hire a machine to plow her farmland, and to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides to protect her crops. Her husband also works with her on the farm. She is blessed with two children who still live under her care.

loans.use: to hire a plow and to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson, age 39, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 16 years. He and his wife, Teresia have four children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one his friends and this will be his fourth loan. He has repaid all his previous loans dependably and in good time. He plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Jackson hopes to become a leading farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lissette Del Carmen
