texts.es: Lissette  del Carmen tiene cuarenta y tres años de edad. Su grupo familiar lo conforman: su mamá y dos hijos Carlos y Luis, quienes se encuentran estudiando;  mientras que Lissette en compañía de su mamá se dedican a su actividad productiva dentro de la panadería que tiene instalada en su misma casa de residencia;  ya son varios años de experiencia con los que cuenta dedicada a este negocio y los frutos que ello ha dejado son muchos, prueba de ello es que como madre soltera ha crecido sóla  a sus hijos y ayudado económicamente a su mamá, dándoles hogar digno, alimento y educación.  Ahora Lissette como todo emprendedor desea reinvertir aún más a su panadería dado que su pan francés y dulce está siendo mas demandado por su exquisito sabor, textura y tamaño, sin olvidar el precio accesible del mismo, su mayor deseo es ampliarse repartiendo el pan ya no sólo a sus vecinos cercanos quienes llegan a comprarlo a la puerta de su casa, sino que como su reconocimiento a lo largo de todo este tiempo es de que su pan es de muy buena calidad, desea hacerlo llegar a colonias vecinas tratando de generar a mayor volumen de ventas, mas ganancias y mejorar así la calidad de vida de todos los miembros del hogar y ofrecer a sus hijos una educación académica superior y que pueda ser esto lo que ella les herede . Por ello ha decidido solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito con el que pueda comprar mayor cantidad de harina, levadura, huevos, mantecas, leche y azúcar del que normalmente usa.-
texts.en:
Lissette del Carmen is 43 years old.  Her family group consists of her mom and her two sons, Carlos and Luis, who are both in school.  Lissette and her mom work in a bakery which is located in their home.  They have years of experience in this business and the rewards that it has created are many.  Proof of this is that, although she is a single mother, Lissette has brought up her sons single handedly and also helped her mom financially, providing them with a decent home, food and education.

Like all entrepreneurs, Lissette would like to reinvest even more in her bakery since her French breads and sweet breads are becoming more and more in demand owing to their delicious flavor, texture and size, without forgetting their affordable price.

Lissette's biggest wish is to expand her business by providing her bread not only to her neighbors who come to her door to buy from her but, as it has become known over the years that her bread is very good quality, she would also like to deliver it to neighboring districts in order to generate more sales, more profits and, thereby, improve the quality of life of all her household members.  She would also like her children to go to college and for this to be her inheritance to them.  For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL with which she can buy larger quantities of flour, yeast, eggs, butter, milk and sugar than she normally uses.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, eggs, butter, milk and sugar

loans.name: Nazareth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nazareth es una luchadora incansable pues desde muy joven ha buscado la manera de salir adelante a través de diferentes oficios, entre ellos, como asistente en una peluquería en la que aprendió todo lo relacionado con este oficio hasta que desde hace algún tiempo decidió volar sola y crear su propio negocio, Stilo y Belleza, y aunque esta emprendedora trabaja más de 11 horas diarias todos los días de la semana es consciente que esta es la manera de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 

A sus 45 años de edad, Nazareth es madre de 5 hijos y sueña con ampliar su negocio hasta convertirlo en una peluquería no sólo reconocida en Puerto Berrío Antioquia, sino también en los municipios cercanos.  

Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar artículos de belleza que pueda vender en su peluquería y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Nazareth is an indefatigable fighter, since from a very early age she has looked for a way to get ahead via different lines of work, among them, as an assistant in a hair salon. There she learned everything having to do with this type of work until, some time ago, she decided to fly solo and create her own business, Style and Beauty. Although this entrepreneur works over 11 hours a day, seven days a week, she is aware that this is the way to get ahead and improve the quality of life for her and her family. 

At 45 years of age, Nazareth is the mother of five children. She dreams of expanding her business and making it a hair salon that is known not only in Puerto Berrío Antioquia but also in the surrounding municipalities. 

Currently she needs a loan to purchase beauty items that she may sell in her hair salon and thus increase her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase beauty items for selling to her customers.

loans.name: Sisinia

texts.en: Sisinia is married and a mother of three school-age children. She is 49 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Sisinia is a farmer. She grows pineapple and sells to the local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She harvests twice a year and earns PHP 50,000 from this farming. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer for her pineapples. Sisinia has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Sisinia hopes to gain more profit and purchase land for pineapple production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 32 years old. He is married and they have three children. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past five years. He has applied for his second loan with KADET Ltd to purchase farm supplies, such as seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more animals. He has been a good client. He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farm. His dreams are to prosper in farming and be able to provide better lives for his children.

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El Sr. Vicente es una persona  muy trabajadora  y  responsable la  cual se dedica  a   la  venta   de     ropa  y  artículos  electrónicos   la  cual le permite   sacar  adelante  a su  familia,   las compras  las   realiza  en la  ciudad de  Eagle  Pass ya  que   obtiene  mejores  precios   que le permite  ofrecer a  sus clientes  precios   bajos,  es  por  ello que  en  este  momento requiere  de nuestra   ayuda  para  realizar  el tramite  de renovacion de  su visa  láser   ya  que  esta  por   vencerse, agrade    el apoyo  brindado para  la realizar  de  su proyecto.
texts.en:
Sr. Vicente is a hardworking and responsible individual. He sells clothing and electronics in order to support his family. Vicente purchases his merchandise in the city of Eagle Pass because he is able to obtain better prices, which in turn allows him to offer affordable prices to his customers. For this reason, he is requesting assistance with the renewal of his crossing visa which is about to expire.

Vicente is grateful for the support that has been provided so that he can complete this project.

loans.use: to pay for the renewal of his crossing visa.

loans.name: Monica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mónica de 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en casa de sus suegros, cuenta con todoslos servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace 2 años Mónica se dedica a la preparación y venta de salchipollo, salchipapas y gaseosas por las noches diariamente, su negocio loa instalado en las afueras de la casa donde vive,cuenta con su carrito sanguchero donde prepara estos alimentos para el consumo de sus clientes, cuenta con su clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para la compra de un refrigerador para que pueda contar también con bebidas heladas, para satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes y con esas ganacias podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Mónica trabaja con mucha dedicación para que poco a poco su familia se supere y logre sus metas.
texts.en:
Monica, 28, lives with her husband and children in her husband's parents' house.  The house has basic services and is located in Tambogrande, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Piura.  The local people make their living from farming, livestock-rearing and traditional crafts.

Monica has operated a catering business for 2 years, selling prepared food and cold drinks.  She works in the evening, every day, at a spot in front of her house.  She has a stand with a grill where she makes the food she sells.  She has many regular customers and the income from the business helps to support her family.

Monica is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 2500 new soles loan that she will use to buy a refrigerator for keeping cold drinks, something that her customers always want.  She will repay the loan from the extra income she expects to make.  She wants her family to have a better quality of life and she works hard to meet her goals.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her catering business.

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en:
Sylvester is married, with three children. His wife is a farmer as well. He has been doing farming for the past 10 years. He has been taught farming by his parents.  He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.  With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labour costs during rice production.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 31, married, and has two children. He has been a farmer for the past three years. He has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which he will use to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer. With the anticipated profits generated he plans to pay school fees for his children. 

He dreams of being a prominent farmer.

loans.use: buy farm inputs like seeds and ferilizer

loans.name: Yuri Anis

texts.es: La joven Yuri , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , ella lucha día a día con su mamá para poder tener una vida mejor , Yuri desde muy niña  se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras , los planes hacia un futuro es poder vender al por mayor y al detalle frutas y verduras  ; ya que ella con muchas dificultades logro ejercer una carrera en la universidad ,  gracias al apoyo que le brinda Afodenic , atrávez de fondo Kiva  , lo cual la ganancias de la inversión no solo la utiliza para pagar el mismo crédito sino también para los pasajes de su misma universidad .
texts.en: Yuri is a young woman who lives in Ticuantepe.  She and her mom work hard every day so that they can have a better life.  Yuri has been selling fruit and vegetables since she was a very young girl.  Her plans for the future are to sell fruit and vegetables wholesale and retail.  It was very hard but Yuri has managed to start studying for a degree at university thanks to support provided by Afodenic through their Kiva fund.  She will not only use the profits from her investment to repay her loan but also to pay her fares for traveling to university.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Walidaan Group

texts.fr:
le groupe existe il y'a environ 5ans. il composé de 14 femmes habitant le village. et qui font du commerce de détails(mil,arachides,légumes).

la dame khady,habillée en rose au milieu de la photo est la responsable du groupe.elle est mariée et mere de 04 enfants.elle a 38ans.

Khady, vend de l'huile a base d'arachide et des poissons séchés. elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine car elle a toujours pratiquée cette activée. 

avec son prêt elle va acheter de l'arachide, et des poissons séchés pour les revendre.

des profits générés par son activité,elle va assister son époux dans les dépenses familiales; augmenter son épargne pour avoir une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
This group was created about five years ago. It consists of 14 women from the same village whose trade is the retail sale of millet, peanuts, vegetables, etc.

Khady is the group leader. She is dressed in pink at the center of the photo. Khady is 38 years old and married with four children. She sells peanut oil and dried fish. She has a lot of experience in this activity, having done this all her life. 

She will use her loan to buy peanuts, as well as dried fish for resale. With the profits earned, she plans to help her husband with the family expenses and add to their savings in order to achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and dried fish.

loans.name: Santos Jose

texts.es: Santos José vive con su esposa él se dedica a la venta de artesanías desde hace cinco años, se inicio principalmente con una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. El desea tener módulos en el mercado en donde transitan muchos clientes y podrá obtener mejores ganancias. La mayoría de sus compras las realiza en Masaya en donde recibe los precios de estos productos de manera favorable. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar jarrones, flores plásticas, comales pintados, adornos de porcelana entre otros. El objetivo de Santos es obtener buenos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Santos José lives with his wife.  His business is selling handicrafts and he has been in this business for five years.  He started this business as a way of making income for his family.  He would like to have units in the market where there are a lot of customers and he can make better profits.  Santos  makes most of his purchases in Masaya where he receives his products at a favorable price.  He will use his loan to buy vases, plastic flowers, painted 'comales' (tortilla pans), porcelain ornaments, etc.  His goal is to obtain good products to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy vases, plastic flowers, painted 'comales' (tortilla pans) and porcelain ornaments

loans.name: 06.07.02- Đông Vệ Tp Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Viên operates a food stall selling tofu. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell. Viên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Viên is the group leader of the 2 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Viên is 33 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Viên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Viên has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Viên hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and improve the quality of her family life.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en: Hermenia is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children. Hermenia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and bananas. Hermenia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Hermenia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and bananas

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is 25 years old. He is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills.

For the past two years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business; his potential customers are neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate. Juma dreams of expanding his business and purchasing another motorcycle. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase another motorcycle for his transport business. He decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 34 years old and has one child, aged 10, who is currently in school. She works with her husband selling goods in a general store that they have run for eight years. 

She would like a loan to buy bread, soda, lotions, cooking oil, rice, beans and sorghum to sell in her store. Francine will use any profits to create savings for her future.

loans.use: To buy more bread, sodas, lotions and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in Uganda. She is married and has five children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Margret has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells various types of food. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more ingredients for her dishes, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another business. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for the food she sells at her restaurant.

loans.name: Yolanda Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Yolanda a sus 61 años es una gran comerciante quien se ha dedicado toda su vida a esta labor, actualmente labora desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m desde su casa o de acuerdo a los requerimientos de sus clientes. La señora Yolanda es una persona sola por lo cual debe trabajar para conseguir los ingresos para su propio sustento. La señora Yolanda requiere de la compra de mercancía para cumplir con los pedidos que sus clientes le han hecho para esta temporada de fin de año. El sueño de la señora Yolanda es tener su propio almacén.
texts.en: Yolanda, 61, is a great merchant who has dedicated her whole life to this trade. She currently works from 9 a.m. until 6 p.m. from her home or wherever her customers require. Yolanda is single, so she must work to earn money and be self sufficient. She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies to fulfill her customers' orders for the end of the year. Her dream is to have her own warehouse.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like undergarments for men and women.

loans.name: Zoir

texts.ru: Зоир занимается животноводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 15 лет. Он женат. Ему 44 года. У него четверо детей. Зоир берет кредит для закупа телят, чтобы увеличить количество скота.
texts.en:
Zoir works with livestock. He earns an income through breeding cattle. He has worked with this activity for 15 years. He is married and 44 years old. He has four children. 

Zoir takes a loan for the purchase of calves, in order to increase the number of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es: Valerio, un humilde campesino de oficio agricultor, habitante de Condega municipio de Estelí de oficio agricultor. Manifiesta la gran ayuda que fue para el haber sido beneficiado con el préstamo Kiva  el esta agradecido. Compro insumos para siembra de frijoles y maíz logro vender su producción a buen precio. Tiene como expectativa sembrar 2 manzanas de maíz. Esta vez esta solicitando el crédito para comprar una vaquilla , para aprovechar la  venta de leche pues otra de las actividades que realiza es la crianza de ganado que quiere impulsar para que genere ingresos y darle un mejor nivel vida a su famiia.
texts.en: Valerio, a humble peasant farmer who does agricultural work, is a resident of Condega in the agricultural municipality of Estelí. He is very thankful for the great help that came from being able to be be a beneficiary of a Kiva loan. He bought supplies to plant beans and corn, and he was able to sell his product at a good price. He expects to plant two acres of corn. He is asking for a loan to buy a cow so that he can sell the milk since another of the business activities he’s engaged in is the raising of cattle. He would like to boost his income and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Gertrude Fontaine

texts.fr: Gertrude une dame âgée de 26ans. comme activité, elle dispose d'une vente à emporter dans un quartier de la ville de 15 mois. elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. mais son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire toute sa clientèle qui est parfois obligée de se retourner vers la concurrence. Ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital .elle voudrait avec ce crédit pour augmenter les casiers de boissons  afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice. Les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille. elle a comme ambitions pour son activité de faire dans la vente en gros des boissons.
texts.en:
Gertrude is a 26-year-old lady. For fifteen month, she has been in business selling beverages to go in one of the city’s neighborhood. She boasts a good amount of experience in her domain, but her capital no longer allows her to meet customer demand, so her clients sometimes have to buy from competitors. This is due to her small capital.

With this loan, she would like to increase her stock of beverages to better meet her clients' needs. This will increase her sales as well as profits. The generated income will make it possible for her to takes better care of her family.

Her ambition for her business is to become a beverage wholesaler.

loans.use: to increase her stock of beverage cases.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 30 years old and has two children. Jacqueline is married and has two children who are in school.

Jacqueline is in the agricultural business, farming fruit bearing trees in the Philippines. Jacqueline requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other supplies for her business.

Jacqueline has been farming fruit bearing trees for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jacqueline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Marcia Reynalda

texts.en:
My name is doña Marcia and I have a store in which I sell plantains, corn and bananas. I have been working here for six years, my sales have grown and I have been able to help my husband with the family expenses. I am very happy because one of my children has finished High School and will soon be starting his career, because of which, we need more products in order to increase our earnings a little more.

Loan Use: buying bananas. 

Me llaman doña Marcia, tengo una bodega en la que vendo platanos, maiz y bananos. Tengo siete años de tener mi negocios el que ha crecido y me ha ayudado apoyar a mi esposo con los gastos de la familia, me siento muy contenta porque uno de mis hijos ya culmino su secundaria y pronto comenzara su carrera, por lo que necesitamos tener mas producto para mejorar un poco mas los ingresos.

loans.use: Compra de bananos.

loans.name: Elizabeth Akoh

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married mother of five surviving children out of seven. Her immediate goal is to provide health care for her family. She received training in pig farming, business techniques, and credit management organized by GHAPE, and has been having continuous training from experience-sharing at center meetings and on-the-spot supervision by group members. From her three previous loans she succeeded in providing 20 liters of manure daily and at least 1 pig every three months for meat in her community.

With a loan of $600 she plans to enlarge her farm by buying sticks to increase the size of the fence, adding piglets and buying pig-feed, renting farm-land and buying seeds. She will supply manure  (demand for organic manure far outweighs the supply in her community) and meat for food. 

She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Rear pigs and sell crops

loans.name: Fazil

texts.en: Fazil is a Displaced Person from the occupied Agdam district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is married, and has two children. He started his business in 2001, and borrowed two Normicro loans from Baku branch totaling $3500. Now he is willing to borrow $1200 to increase his variety of goods.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Bertha Alicia De Jes

texts.es:
Alicia is a single mother and her daughter is 3 years old. Because she had to support herself and her daughter, she decided to start a business where she could work and look after her little one at the same time. Since she liked sales, she decided to go into clothing sales, starting out by offering her products to relatives and friends, and little by little her customers increased through word of mouth. Today, with the increase in clients, she has several orders to fill and she is happy with the profits and better sales she is having.

Alicia is requesting a loan in the amount of $250 to buy merchandise in order to fill the orders she has at present. She will repay the loan in 3 months. She thanks you very much for the support you offer as she continues making her business grow, and giving her little daughter the opportunity to get ahead.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Alicia es madre soltera y su hija tiene 3 años de edad, el tener que mantenerse a ella y su hija la llevo a decidirse por tener un negocio ya que tenía que cuidar de su pequeña y como a ella le gustaba las ventas decidió incursionar en la venta de ropa, empezando a ofrecer sus productos entre familiares y amigos y poco a poco fue incrementándose sus clientes por recomendación, ahora con el crecimiento de sus clientes tiene varios pedidos que atender y se siente contenta por los logros y mejores ventas que está teniendo.

Alicia esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para comprar mercadería y poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene actualmente y ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindes para poder continuar con su negocio, hacerlo crecer y poder brindarle la oportunidad de sacar adelante a su pequeña hija.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Umu

texts.en: Umu B. is married with six children.  Her husband is also engaged in petty trading in the town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone. The couple is working hard to meet their family’s expenses.  Umu started her fish business with a small amount of capital from her husband and her previous loan.  She is able to purchase the fish from the wholesaler in cash and build her capital.  Umu said, “both of us are working hard to educate our children and to build a family home in the future".  She is requesting another loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase more fish for selling in her village.

loans.name: Fiso

texts.en: Fiso is a mother of six .  She is 40 years old and is married to a farmer from Salesatele. Her business is running a taro plantation; she is requesting a loan of $300 to buy some weed killer, fertilizers and kniver for her plantation.

loans.use: To buy gramoxone (a weed-killer), fertilizer, and knives for her plantation

loans.name: Teolith

texts.es:
Teolith belongs to the Mujeres Valerosas II ("Valiant Women II") community bank. She lives in Peru's San Martin region. She provides sewing services to the general public. Her husband helped her to start the business. Carrying out the work requires a temporary employee (in the busy season). Loans from Manuela Ramos have allowed Teolith to buy miscellaneous sewing supplies (threads, buttons, snaps, etc.), as well as cloth, because most of her orders are only for sewing and her customers provide the cloth for the outfits she makes.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.500 (500 Peruvian soles or about US$167), to be repaid in 4 months, Teolith bought cloth by the meter (at wholesale), buttons, snaps and other sewing supplies.

Teolith, 55, lives with her husband and their 2 children. In the future, she'd like to have her own dress shop in a local market with outfits she makes herself. She's very pleased with what she's been able to do because thanks to this business, she's been able to send her children to school.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Teolith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, con domicilio en el Jr. Manuel Arévalo Orbe Nº 344. La señora Teolith brinda servicio de costura al público en general. Para iniciar su negocio tuvo el apoyo de su esposo. Para realizar los trabajos encomendados requiere de un personal en forma eventual (temporada alta). El apoyo de Manuela Ramos por medio de los préstamos, le ha permitido comprar artículos de pasamanería (hilos, botones, cierres y otros para los acabados) asimismo compró tela para confeccionar ya que la mayor parte de su servicio es sólo servicio de costura y el cliente entrega la tela.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500.00 ($ 167.00), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró telas por metros (al por mayor), botones, cierres, y otros artículos de pasamanería.

La señora Teolith, tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, en adelante piensa tener su tienda de venta de vestidos que ella misma confecciona en el mercado de esta localidad. Ella está contenta con lo que hace ya que gracias a esto puede hacer estudiar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy supplies for tailoring business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is 38 years old and lives with his partner Maria Luisa who is 40 years old. The couple has 2 older kids who still live with them.

Mario began working at the age of 14 with a Korean person who taught him everything related to the repair of air conditioners.

When he turned 20 he was able to be go on his own and got his own shop, he is currently leasing the place. Today he has all the tools required to complete his job and at teh same time he is able to employ his brothers.

He repairs all kinds of electronics but his focus is on air conditioners, refrigerators and washing machines.

He needs a loan to purchase broken electronics so that he can fix them and re-sell them to a lower cost. This way he can increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario tiene 38 años y vive en pareja con María Luisa que tiene 40 años de edad. La pareja tiene 2 hijos ya mayores de edad pero que aún viven con ellos.

Mario comenzó a trabajar a los 14 años en un taller propiedad de un coreano en donde aprendió todo lo relacionado a la profesión de técnico en refrigeración.

Cuando cumplió 20 años logró independizarse y montó su taller propio que funciona en un local alquilado. Hoy día cuenta con todas las herramientas necesarias para realizar su trabajo y además le da empleo a uno de sus hermanos.

Repara todo tipo de electrodomésticos pero su punto fuerte lo constituyen los acondicionadores de aire, heladeras y lavarropas.

Necesita de un préstamo para la compra de electrodomésticos en desuso que repara y luego vuelve a vender a un bajo costo obteniendo de esa manera muy buenos ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase of used items such as air conditioners, washing machines, refrigerators, etc.

loans.name: Agip A 2005(Iii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year and six months. Betty is 25 years old and married with two children. She sells jewelery and cosmetics. With the extra business profits, she intends to cater to the welfare of her children. Sarah has a beauty salon. Margret sells raw foods in the market, while Robinah has a retail shop business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand current business.

loans.name: Murti

texts.en: Murti M. is 41 years old and has gone into business for herself because her husband is currently unemployed. To help support their family, she sells vegetables and tofu from her house. This business brings in $10 a day and allows her to earn a very small profit. She is a member of MBK and has applied for a loan of $150 to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers, and to repair her stall. She will repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell and to repair her stall

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
Señora Martha luz F. M. is an associate of the “Angels” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region , province of Picota, district of Picota. She is dedicated to the sale of articles of clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children, shoes and medicine in her house located at Simón Bolívar Nº 228, where she attracts a great number of clients.

She started the business selling groceries in her house. But it did not go so well, so she decided to change her activity to the sale of clothes in which she is having very good results.

The loan of 2500 soles which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of clothes for girls, dozens of jeans of different brands for ladies and gentlemen and dozens of shoes that will permit her to satisfy her clients in all their whims and to be always current with fashion.

She is 53 years of age, a native of Picota and has 2 children, both older and independent. She is known for being genteel, attentive with her clients, tranquil and fully confident in what she does. In the future she wants to transfer her business to her own house.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Martha luz F. M., es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Ángeles”vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, zapatos y medicina en su misma casa ubicada en el Jr: Simón Bolívar Nº 228. hasta donde llegan gran cantidad de clientes.

Se inicio en el negocio vendiendo abarrotes en su casa, no le fue tan bien, por lo que decidió cambiar de actividad por la venta de ropas en la que si esta teniendo muy buenos resultados.

El préstamo de S/. 2500.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá para surtir su negocio en la compra de ropas para niñas, pantalones Jean de diferentes marcas para damas y caballeros por docenas y zapatos por docenas que le permitirán satisfacer a sus clientes en todos sus gustos y estar siempre actualizada con la moda.

Ella tiene 53 años de edad, natural de Picota y 2 hijos, ambos mayores e independientes. Se caracteriza por ser gentil, atenta con sus clientes, tranquila y con plena confianza en lo que hace, mas adelante piensa trasladar su negocio a su propia casa.

loans.use: To buy clothes for girls, jeans of different brands for ladies and gentlemen and shoes in large quantities for sale in her clothing store.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is forty-three years old and the mother of five children. All her children are in school now. She sells cosmetics like face powder, body creams, deodorants, and necklaces, earrings, etc. Csmetics are very useful in the everyday life of the Ghanaian as they go to reduce bad body odour and sweat. Therefore, the demand for such products is high. Mercy wants to use her new loan to buy more products like face powder, deodorants, bangles, necklaces, earrings, etc. This will help her raise income to support her family and pay the children’s school fees.

Mercy is a member of the group called “Gye Nyame” (meaning Only God). Members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more costume jewelry and cosmetics

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret D. prepares a native food called ‘kenkey’, which is made with maize. It is very popular with the natives of her area. Margaret is divorced, with 2 children. Business is going very well, so she wishes to increase production and sales.

Margaret is running out of ingredients for her food production business, so she is asking for additional capital to buy more ingredients.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sidonie Tabiyi

texts.fr:
Born around 1966 in Pobè in Plateau County in the southeast of Benin, Mrs. Sidonie Tabiyi A. is a trained hairdresser. She is married and the mother of 5 children, two of whom are already independent. Along with her work as a hairdresser, Mrs. Sidonie Tabiyi A. sells cold drinks. She is requesting her third loan to deal with the financial difficulties she encounters in running her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1966 à Pobè dans le département du Plateau au Sud-Est du Bénin, dame A. Sidonie Tabiyi est coiffeuse de profession. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont deux ne sont plus à sa charge. Dame A. Sidonie Tabiyi a associé à son métier de coiffure la vente de boissons fraiches. Elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour faire face aux difficultés financières qu'elle rencontre dans l'exercice de ses activités.

loans.use:
Purchase of 15 cases of drinks and 4 dozen hair extensions

Achat de 15 casiers de boissons et de 4 douzaines de mèches.

loans.name: Tania Gloria

texts.en:
Tania, a member of the Trébol Village Bank, is a single 24-year-old woman who travels to the Huamanguilla fair where she sells vegetables and purchases cereals to resell in the Ayacucho markets on the weekends. She is also a gasoline attendant for a family business, twenty minutes away from the city of Ayacucho. Tania now needs a loan of $725 to invest in maize and sacks of oats for resale.

Tania’s dream is to have her own gas station, expand her cereal business and have a car to transport her products.

loans.use: To invest in maize and sacks of oats.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos decided to start his own home business in order to be able to raise his young children out of financial necessity and because his wife walked out on him and his three children—a two-month-old, a three-year-old, and a four-year-old. In view of the need to cover the food expenses and take care of his three children, he started the business two years ago. He was familiar with carpentry, so he dedicated himself 100% to this trade in order t help move his children forward and little by little make his business grow.

He needs a loan of $300 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase a table saw, thus allowing him to fill his customers’ orders.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos decidió emprender un negocio en su casa para poder atender a sus menores hijos, por necesidad económica y por que su esposa lo abandono junto con sus 3 pequeños de 2 meses, 3 y 4 años. Ante la necesidad de cubrir los gastos de alimentación y darles el cuidado a sus tres hijos, comenzó hace 2 años, el sabia el oficio de carpintero y se dedico al 100% a esto para poder sacar adelante a sus pequeños y poco a poco ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio.

El necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una cortadora y así poder cumplir con sus clientes con los pedidos de trabajo en carpintería.

loans.use: Purchase table saw

loans.name: Praxeda

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!

This is 42-year-old Praxeda M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 9 and 16. Praxeda has been running a snacks business since 2003. She prepares snacks such as chapati and sells them to people around her area.. She works at the business for 5 hours per day, 6 days per week and she is assisted by two employees. Praxeda R Mkandalara currently earns about $200 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $875 in order to buy wheat flower, cooking oil and other raw material for making snacks. In the future, she plans to renovate her business building and to establish a new business.

Praxeda thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional wheat flour, cooking, and other raw material for making sandwiches.

loans.name: Sandra Marizol

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 30 años de edad, estudió quinto de secundaria, es casada, y progenitora de 02 hijos (01 varón de 11 años y 01 mujer de 08 años de edad). Vive en Jirón Desaguadero S/N. en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Desde hace un año integra el Banco Comunal “24 de Junio” en Alintuyo. En un inicio obtuvo el crédito de S/. 300, con el cual aumentó su capital y compró 01 cilindro de combustible (petróleo). A los 19 años de edad formó su hogar, gracias a la enseñanza de parte de su cuñada aprendió a preparar jugo de quinua y cañihua que desde hace 02 años prepara y vende en la ciudad de Ilave, paralelo a éste negocio, desde el año pasado, se dedica a la venta de combustible conjuntamente con su esposo.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 02 cilindros de petróleo para comercializar en forma diaria en la ciudad de Ilave.

Su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia en la ciudad de Ilave y apoyar a sus hijos a que estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Sandra is 30 years old, studied through the fifth year of secondary school, is married and is the mother of two children (1 son who is 11 years old and one daughter who is 8 years old). She lies on Jirón Desaguadero in the Llave district in the province of El Collao, Puno. For the past year she has been a member of the "24 de Junio" Communal Bank in Alintuyo. In the beginning she obtained a credit of S/. 300, with which she increased her working capital and bought one cylinder of fuel (petroleum). At 19 years of age she formed her household and thanks to instruction from her sister-in-law she learned to prepare quinua and cañihua juices which for the past 2 years she has prepared and sold in the city of Llave. Parallel to this business, since last year she has worked selling fuel together with her husband. With this loan of S/. 1,200, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will purchase 2 cylinders of petroleum to sell them daily in the city of Llave. Her greatest dream is to have her own house in the city of Llave and to support her children so that they study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two cylinders of petroleum.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel tiene 41 años vive con su esposo Rubén de 43 años, que es abogado y sus cuatro hijos  Abel de 18, Luis de 17, Edith de 14 y Ruth de 3. Raquel se dedica a la venta de ropa de 2da mano para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar, ella suele comprar grandes fardos de ropa que llegan usualmente los días jueves traídas desde estados unidos. Lo que le gusta a Raquel de su trabajo es la independencia que le da el contar con su  propio dinero para los gastos del hogar y no depender del trabajo de su esposo. Las ventas usualmente son buenas ya que la gente suele comprar mucho estas prendas por su calidad y bajo precio, mayormente los días jueves que salen en feria. Raquel con el préstamo que viene solicitando comprara más fardos de ropa americana para vender.
texts.en:
Raquel is 41 years old. She lives with her husband, Ruben, 43 years old, who is a lawyer, and their four children: Abel, 18 years old, Luis, 17 years old, Edith, 14 years old, and Ruth, 3 years old. Raquel sells 2nd-hand clothes to help with the household expenses. She buys large bales of clothing that usually arrive on Thursdays, brought from the United States. What Raquel likes about her job is the independence that having her own money gives her for household expenses and not having to depend on her husband’s job. Sales are usually good, since people generally buy a lot of these clothes because of their quality and low price, usually on Thursdays which are market days. With the money from the loan that Raquel is requesting, she will buy more bales of American clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothing

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Chhorn C. Sim, 21, is a true entrepreneur who has a business selling groceries from her home and she is able to make $4 each day. Her husband, Eng Srann, 22, operates a taxi business and normally makes $3 profit per day to help support the family. This couple has one child who is still too young to attend school.

Chhorn C. Sim would like to take out a loan of $1000 to add to her grocery inventory and to purchase a water pump to irrigate her farm.

loans.use: Increase grocery inventory and purchase water pump for crop irrigation

loans.name: Rubi

texts.en:
Rubi Gonzalez B. N. lives in Pucallpa, Peru – the bustling capital of the Ucayali department in eastern Peru. The region is characterized by the meandering Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon. The weather is scorchingly hot and humid almost everyday and during the wet season, the city receives daily thunderstorms and rain showers.

Rubi lives in the city on Atahualpa Street with her husband – an electrician – and her two sons. Rubi has been taking out loans through the Talented Women communal bank for five years to support her shoe and clothing sales business.

Rubi is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 2,000 Nuevo Soles to help her finance the purchase of wines from the Southwestern coastal region of Peru. Rubi would like to sell these famous wines from the cities of Chinca and Ica as Christmas and holiday gifts. Rubi will also use her loan to stock up on shoes and clothing for her regular business activities.

loans.use: Rubi would like to purchase wines from the Chinca and Ica regions to resell for holiday gifts.

loans.name: Grupo Belen #2 Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Belén #2 que tiene cinco integrantes Doña Soraya M., Ma. Teresa D., Kenya Francisca P. M., Ma. De los Ángeles S. Vásquez, Auxiliadora del Rosario M. C., originarios de la comunidad Palo Quemado que pertenece al Municipio de Diriomo, ellos son vecinos de origen humilde con actividades de venta de tortillas, tamales y fritanga.
Doña Soraya M. de 30 años de edad, casada con dos niños, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos familiares pues trabaja de vigilante en una empresa en Managua. La señora vende comida en una escuela y vende Nacatamales los fines semana en su casa de habitación, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad porque los ingresos eran pocos y decidió apoyarle a su esposo, expresa que esto le ha permitido darle a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida y así tomar decisiones en su hogar. Ella sueña que sus hijos continúen estudiando y ella poder engrandecer su negocio.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar perecederos, frutas, carne, leña y poder comprar algunas utencilios que necesita para cocinar.
texts.en:
This is the group Birth #2, which has five members, including Mrs. Soraya M., Ma. Teresa D., Kenya Francisca P. M., Ma. De los Ángeles S. Vásque, and Auxiliadora del Rosario M. C.. All of them are from the community of Palo Quemado in the municipality of Diriomo. They are neighbors with humble means, who pursue activities, like selling tortillas, tamales, and fried foods. Mrs. Soraya M. is 30 years old and is married with two children. Her husband helps her with the family expenses, as he works as a security guard in a company in Managua. Mrs. Soraya M. sells food in a school and sells Nacatamales on the weekends in her home. She has spent three years pursuing their activity because she was earning little income and decided to support her husband. She says that her business has allowed her to give her children a better life and make decisions in her house. She dreams that her children will continue studying and that she can expand her business. This loan is needed to buy perishables, fruits, meat, and firewood. She will also buy some utensils that are needed to cook.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her business and invest in cooking utensils

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: Moeun S., 59, lives with her niece in the Bati, Takeo Province. She is a weaver and works from her home, earning about USD $10 every day. She weaves scarves and sells them in the market. Her niece has been an English teacher since 2004 and makes around $1.60 per day. Moeun S. would like to take out a loan to purchase silks to weave scarves. She is pictured here behind her niece.

loans.use: To purchase silks to weave into scarves

loans.name: Woetsa

texts.fr: Woetsa S. est une jeune femme de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales au grand marché d’Atakpamé, une ville située au centre du Togo. Elle fait des livraisons en gros aux détaillants. Elle désire avec ce crédit approvisionner son magasin afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients. Cette opportunité lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa clientèle
texts.en:
Woetsa S. is a young woman, 39 years old, married, and the mother of three. She sells grain at the grand marketplace of Atakpamé, a city located in central Togo. She makes wholesale deliveries to retailers. With this loan, she would like to supply her shop with goods, so as to do better in satisfying her customers. This opportunity will enable her to improve the living conditions of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, corn, beans, and peanuts for resale
